loans.name: Kelly Natali

texts.es:
Kelly de 28 años, es vendedora de productos Avon (empresa de cosméticos vende productos a un bajo costo para mujeres emprendedoras), vive en una zona periurbana caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra en el Fortín de Guayaquil. 

Hace un año comenzó a vender productos por catalogo Avon poco a poco con esfuerzo y la motivación de ser madre soltera pudo surtir su mercadería y hacer esta actividad la parte sostenible de su economía. Vende todo tipo de productos como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes y ahora ropa. 

Con el préstamo quiere surtir la mercadería comprando ropa, perfumes y cremas para la venta. En el futuro quiere seguir con su negocio y tener su propia boutique.
texts.en:
Kelly is 28 years old and a sales representative of Avon (a cosmetics company that helps women entrepreneurs sell products at a low cost). She lives in a periurban area called Fortín in Guayaquil which is known for its dirt roads.

Kelly started selling Avon products through catalogs a year ago. With a little bit of effort and her motivation as a single mother, she was able to stock up on merchandise and create a financially sustainable business. She sells all types of products including perfumes, crèmes, deodorants, and now clothing.

With this loan, Kelly wants to stock up on merchandise to sell such as clothing, perfumes, and crèmes. In the future, she wants to continue with her business and open her own boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, perfumes, and crèmes

loans.name: Janett Del Socorro

texts.es: Janett del Socorro es una mujer muy responsable y emprendedora. Por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en financiamientos y en su trabajo, pues esta no es la primera vez que solicita ayuda. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que sabe que tiene familia que alimentar, pues busca la forma de generar ingresos, se levanta muy temprano para arreglar todos los productos de su local y atender a sus clientes. Este crédito es destinado para comprar ropa, calzado, cosméticos, sabanas y otras cosas.
texts.en:
Janett del Socorro is a very responsible and enterprising woman. She has a good deal of experience with finances and in her job, as this is not the first time she has asked for assistance. She sells general merchandise because she knows her family needs to eat, so she looks for ways to generate income. She gets up very early to arrange all of the products in her store and to tend to her customers. This loan is intended to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, sheets, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, sheets, and other items to sell

loans.name: Bhyanti

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Bhyanti M.. She is married and has 3 children, ages 35, 30 and 22. In 1995, she established her general store. She supports her family working 7 hours a day, 6 days a week. She wishes to use this loan from Patan BPW to increase the inventory of her store. In the future, Bhyanti plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her general store.

loans.name: Gamo

texts.fr: Monsieur Gamo S. est un commerçant de 30 ans marié qui habite à Bambilor. Il a choisit le commerce comme métier sous l’influence de son frère. Par conséquent il s’adonne a l’achat et a la vente de marchandises diverses depuis 1992. Il est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis novembre 2009. Il n’y a jamais sollicité de prêt. Il emprunte un montant de 500 000 frs prévu pour renforcer sa boutique en riz, huile, savons et autres denrées alimentaires. Pour monsieur S. les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins personnels et aussi d’entretenir sa famille. En plus l’augmentation de ses bénéfices peut lui donner l’opportunité de tendre vers l’autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Mr. Gamo S., 30, is a married shopkeeper who lives in Bambilor. He chose retail as his profession due to his brother's influence. Thus he has been buying and selling a variety of merchandise since 1992. He has been a member of the Bambilor branch of UIMCEC since November 2009. He has never before sought a loan. He would like to borrow 500,000 francs in order to build his shop's stock of rice, oil, soap, and various food products. Mr. S.'s profits allow him to pay his personal expenses and also support his family. In addition, increasing his profits could give him the opportunity to move toward financial autonomy.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Sunita G.. She is married and has 2 children, ages 9 and 7. In 2005, she established her grocery business. She supports her family working 7 hours a day, 7 days a week. She wants to use this loan from Patan BPW to increase the inventory of her store. In the future, Sunita plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microc-redit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her grocery store

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es: Ana Lidia tiene su familia que proviene de gente trabajadora dedicada. Ella tiene 34 años y está casada tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cago su actividad es una pulpería vende golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos, pan entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, dice que tiene muchos clientes porque en su tienda se encuentra la variedad de productos que ofrece. Este crédito lo va utilizar para comprar la materia prima necesaria que sus clientes le solicitan.
texts.en:
Ana Lidia comes from a family of hardworking, dedicated people. She is 34 years old, married, and has 2 minor children who are in her care. She has a general store where she sells candy, detergents, staple grains, and bread, among other things. She works from 7 in the morning until 9 at night each day. She says that she has a lot of customers because of the large variety of products she offers for sale in her store. This loan will be used to buy products that her customers want.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy products for her general store

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: Gabriel, de 43 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tienen cinco hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos viven en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en el poblado de Triboline, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. El trabajo al que se dedica es la crianza de reses, negocio que está logrando posicionarse de manera rápida y segura, contrayendo una estabilidad económica, en comparación de otros años. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en  ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia, con la finalidad de facilitar en el cuidado respectivo de su ganado. Usualmente los vende en el mercado y a un precio competitivo. Su plan a futuro es aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene actualmente, de esa manera podrá obtener más ingresos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además está contento con su banco comunal, debido a las buenas decisiones que toman, para que de esa manera encamine su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de abono con la finalidad de que sus pastizales tengan buena calidad y cantidad, de esa manera le sirva de forraje a sus animales.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 43 years old and lives with his common law wife and their five school age children. They reside in the village of Triboline situated in the beautiful jungle of Ayacucho. There they have a house of their own made of wood. Gabriel has a business raising cattle that has grown rapidly and steadily. However, his financial stability has declined as compared to other years. Gabriel usually works alone, but occasionally he will receive help from his family in order to facility the care of his livestock. He usually sells his animals at the market for a competitive price. His plan for the future is to increase the number of animals he currently has in his herd so that he can generate more income.

This is his fifth loan with MFP. Gabriel assures everyone that he will faithfully complete each of his payments. In addition, he says he is pleased with his Communal Bank because the group has made good decisions and is headed in the right direction. With the loan he requested, Gabriel plans to buy compost so that his pastures will produce in high quality and quantity since they provide fodder for his animals.

loans.use: Purchase compost to fertilize his pastures

loans.name: Dodji

texts.fr: A. est une femme de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale  , sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle fait ce commerce depuis 2004. son stock de marchandises est en baisse. elle souhaite s'approvisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 3 bidons d'huile d'arachide et un sac d'oignons.
texts.en:
Dodji A. is 36-year-old married woman who is the mother of three children. She makes money selling groceries. Her customer base includes everyone, and she has been in business since 2004. Her stock is getting low, and she would like to restock. She is seeking a loan through WAGES in order to buy 3 barrels of peanut oil and a bag of onions.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de cosmetóloga, ella tiene un salón de belleza que atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,a ella le gusta hacer diferentes cortes de cabello para eso está estudiando, su esposo es policía, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para el salón de belleza como líquidos permanentes, tintes para el cabello, tijeras y ruleros. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Madres Trabajadoras” (Working Mothers), which is located in the District of Santiago, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. Sra. Juana divides her time between her daily activities and her cosmetology business. She has a beauty salon that she manages from 9am until 7pm. Juana enjoys providing the different types of haircuts that she learned. Her husband is a police officer. Juana wants to improve and expand her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her beauty salon such as liquid perms, hair coloring, scissors, and curlers.

Juana is grateful to those who made her dream come true and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase liquid perms, hair coloring, scissors, and curlers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy palm oil and rice for resale

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married and has a grown daughter whose name is Yuliya. She makes a living selling footwear in her home town of Pavlograd, where she owns two stores downtown. She started her venture over 10 years ago with the help of her husband, who still helps her run the business. It has been growing steadily and today she already has 100,000 Grivnyas invested in her small company.   

Nataliya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to buy seasonal merchandise and re-stock her inventory with newer, trendier brands of fall shoes and boots. She loves working with this type of merchandise and is hoping to use her profits to pay her daughter’s college fee.

loans.use: to buy more footwear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ramatou

texts.fr: ramatou est une femme mariée, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de mercerie et de tissus. pour  avoir une plus grosse marge bénéficiaire sur ces ventes, elle s'approvisionne au burkina faso qui est un pays voisin. elle a une ancienneté de 3 ans dans ce commerce et sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle fait face à une rupture de stock et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES son premier crédit pour l'achat de divers articles de mercerie et des tissus.
texts.en:
Ramatou is married and makes a living selling sewing supplies and cloth. In order to increase her profit margin, she stocks up in neighbouring Burkina Faso. She has run this business for 3 years and her customers are all kinds of people. Since she is running out of stock, she is requesting her first WAGES loan to buy various sewing supplies and cloth.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth and sewing supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pahaj No. 1 Group

texts.es: Doña Lucía T. C., tiene 29 años D. edad, tiene 3 hijos, D. los cuales  uno esta a su cargo; se dedica a la crianza D. animales y comercio D. calzado (sandalias) y D. esta Forma ha trabajado para poder sufragar sus gastos familiares. Conjuntamente con otras vecinas, deciden organizar un grupo para poder incrementar el volumen  D. ventas en su negocio. Son 8  señoras  que conforman el grupo denominadas  Grupo “Pahaj No. 1”, las señoras otras señoras se dedican a diversas actividades productivas  tales como: comercio, la crianza D. animales, bordado D. blusas. Con el prestamos que realizan esperan obtener mejores ganacias en las ventas que realizan.
texts.en:
Doña Lucía T. C. is 29 years old and has three children, one of whom is in her care. She raises animals and sells sandals in order to offset her family expenses. Lucía and some of her neighbors decided to organize a group to help increase the sales volumes of their businesses. There are eight women in this group called “Pahaj No. 1”. These women engage in a variety of business activities such as traD., raising animals, and producing embroidered blouses. With the loans they receive, they hope to generate better earnings through their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a widow who has two grown children - a son and a daughter. She is an entrepreneur who lives in Novaya Kahovka, where she makes a living selling children’s knitted wear, socks, pantyhose and other items in a local marketplace. She is an experienced businesswoman who has been in this line of work for 21 years. She has 18,000 Grivnyas invested in her business and her profits come to about 6,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Tatyana is seeking a loan of 9,100 Grivnyas to diversify the merchandise she has to sell and update her product selection for the fall season. Her business has benefited greatly from previous loans, and she believes this newest loan will allow her to generate income she and her family badly need.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bokk Jom 2 Group

texts.fr: Bokk jomm 2 est  un groupe de 5 femmes issues de la même localité de  Bambilor. Il est dirigé par madame Gnagna  S.. Madame Gnagna S. est la dame qui est vêtue  en bleu sur la photo de groupe. C’est dans le but de soutenir leurs maris quelles ont optées pour l’activité de commerce. Par  conséquent elles évoluent depuis plus de 10 ans dans l’achat et la vente de marchandises diverses telles que légumes, vêtements etc.  Elles sont membres de la caisse depuis juillet 2010.Le groupe  sollicite un prêt de 500 000 f  qui sera  destiné  a  l’achat de produits pour  renforcer leur  stock. L’accroissement  des bénéfices que leur génère leur activité les aide à satisfaire leur quelques besoins personnels et à participer a la gestion de la dépense quotidienne dans leurs familles respectives.
texts.en:
Bokk Jom 2 is a group of 5 women from the town of Bambilor. The group is headed buy Gnagna S., the woman dressed in blue in the photo. They all started running businesses in order to support their husbands. That’s why, for over 10 years, they have sold various items, like vegetables, clothes, etc. They have been members of the communal bank since July 2010. The group is requesting a 500,000 XOF loan to buy products to build up their stock. The profits generated by their businesses help them to cover some personal expenses and to participate in managing day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maryana

texts.en:
Maryana makes a living selling clothing in the town of Korolyovo, Western Ukraine. She is married and has a 3-year-old daughter. She has been in this line of work for the last eight years, and today runs a store which is located in the heart of town. She currently makes about 25,000 Grivnyas a month, and her profit comes to about 7,000 Grivnyas. 

Maryana is seeking a loan of 7,000 Grivnyas to buy assorted men’s and women’s clothing. She is a determined entrepreneur with a clear vision for her business, and hopes to open a second location in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Monte Horeb Solidarity Group

texts.es:
GRUPO SOLIDARIO MONTE HOREB




MARIA JOSEFINA C. G. .

Tiene 59 años, es originaria de San Juan Comalapa del Departamento de Chimaltenango, tiene 7 hijos todos ya grandes la ultima hija tiene 18 años, ella se dedica a elaborar tejidos a mano, desde hace 30 años se dedica a esa actividad, ella dice que necesita el préstamo para poder comprar mas hilo para elaborar sus tejidos típicos, porque ya viene la época de fin de año y es cuando mas se venden los güipiles.

CRISTY CAROLINA C.. 

Ella tiene 41 años de edad es originaria de San Juan Comalapa tiene dos hijos uno ya graduado y la otra que esta estudiando 4to magisterio, ella se dedica a la elaboración de güipiles a mano ella necesita el préstamo para aumentar su negocio, necesita el dinero para pode comprar mas materia prima para poder tejer mas productos, porque ya viene la época en que hay negocio, que es Diciembre.


RUTH ANABELLA C. C..

Ella tiene 30 años desde hace diez años ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de güipiles a mano, ella tiene a dos muchachas que la ayudan a sacar sus telas y ella es la que los vende, Pero necesita el préstamo para obtener mas materia prima porque le hacen pedidos pero por falta de materia prima a veces no se compromete y también para poder pagar a las muchachas que la ayudan, ella se siente feliz porque puede ayudar a otras personas a la elaboración de tejidos y güipiles, le da gracias a Dios y a FAPE porque ha logrado tener clientes que le hacen pedidos de güipiles.
texts.en:
MOUNT HOREB SOLIDARITY GROUP

Maria Josefina C. G. is 59 years old and originally from San Juan Comalapa in the Department of Chimaltenango. She has seven grown children, with her youngest daughter being 18 years old. Maria has been producing hand-woven items for 30 years. She says she needs a loan to buy more thread for making traditional weavings because the end of the year is approaching, which is when she sells more blouses.

Cristy Carolina C. is 41 years old and originally from San Juan Comalpa. She has two children, one of whom has already graduated while the other in the fourth year of study toward getting a teaching certificate. Cristy produces blouses by hand and needs a loan to increase her business. The money is needed to buy more materials to make her hand-woven products. December is when she has more business and the end of the year is approaching.

Ruth Anabella C. C. is 30 years old. She earns her living by producing and selling handmade blouses. She has two ladies who help her produce the fabrics and then she sells them. Ruth needs a loan to acquire more materials because she lacks the supplies needed to complete the orders she promised. She also needs to pay her assistants. Ruth is pleased that she can help other people produce weavings and blouses. She gives thanks to God and to FAFE because she has a customer base that place orders for blouses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is an entrepreneur who lives in the town of Melitopol. She is married, has a young son named Ilya and makes a living selling footwear in one of her town's marketplaces. She started her business six years ago with help from her parents. Today she makes about 20,000 Grivnyas a month, 8,000 of which is profit. 

Anna is requesting a loan for 18,000 Grivnyas to buy more footwear for the coming fall and winter seasons. She will use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. She is eager to work hard, succeed, and generate and larger and more stable income in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of pepper to sell to her customers

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El Sr. Esteban Vive en la localidad de el Torno, de la ciudad de santa cruz, es nacido en el departamento de Potosí,  considerado el departamento cuna de la minería Boliviana, hace uno 10 años que se vino a vivir al departamento de Santa Cruz, desde entonces se dedica al transporte urbano es separado pasa pensión a su familia, es el destino del crédito es para el mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que esta presentando fallas  y no le permite trabajar , con la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo desea brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Esteban lives in the town of El Torno which is in the city of Santa Cruz. He was born in the department of Potosí, which is considered to be the birthplace of the Bolivian mining industry. It was ten years ago that he came to live in the department of Santa Cruz. Since then he has worked in urban transportation upon leaving his job at his family’s diner.

This loan will be used to pay for maintenance to his vehicle since it has defects that are preventing him from working. By repairing and maintaining his vehicle, Esteban hopes to provide better service to his customers. He is extremely grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Rosa Magdalena

texts.es:
Rosa de 22 años, vende ropa por catalogo a sus conocidos y vecinos, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Paraíso” con caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Comenzó a vender ropa por la necesidad de mantener a su hija de dos años ya que es madre soltera, con sus pocos ahorros compro ropa de una revista y comenzó a venderlas a sus amigas y conocidos, trabaja repartiendo y promocionando la ropa por catalogo. 

Para mejorar sus ventas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y mejorar su casa comprando pintura. En el futuro quiere darle una buena educación a su hija y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 22 years old and sells clothing through a catalog to her friends and neighbors. She lives in a periurban area called “Paraíso” that has dirt roads and mountains.

Since she is a single mother, Rosa began selling clothes in order to support her two year old daughter. Using a portion of her savings, she purchased clothing through a catalog and began selling them to friends and acquaintances. Her work involves distributing and marketing the clothes available through the catalog.

In order to improve her sales, Rosa wants to use this loan to buy clothing. She also will buy paint to improve her home. In the future, she wants to provide a good education for her daughter and open her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell & paint for her home

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.es: El señor Prudencio, Casado con la Sra. Natalia, ambos nacidos en Cochabamba con cuatro hijos, hace 22 años, que se decidieron vivir aquí en Santa Cruz en la provincia Andrés Ibáñez en un lugar que se llama los Amarillos, distante 15 Km de limoncito, Carretera a Cañada II, en el municipio de El Torno, en la cual el tiene una parcela donde se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, siembra maíz y sorgo una vez cosechado sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado de el Torno, directamente del productor  al consumidor, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para contratación de mano de obra para el preparado de la tierra y también para la compra de semillas para, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado .
texts.en:
Sr. Prudencio is married to Sra. Natalia. Both of them were born in Cochabamba and they have four children. Twenty-two years ago, they decided to move to Santa Cruz and settled in a place called Los Amarillos in the province of Andrés Ibáñez, which is 15km from Limoncito along the Cañada II Highway.

In the town of El Torno, Prudencio owns a parcel of land where he farms and raises livestock. He grows corn and sorghum. When his products are harvested, he sells them at the market in El Torno where merchandise transfers directly from producer to consumer. The funds from this loan will be used to pay for labor to prepare his land and purchase seeds. Prudencio is extremely grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting corn and sorghum; pay for labor to prepare his land

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty K. is 35 years old. She is married and has five children, aged 17, 15 and 12 years. All of her children are secondary-school pupils. 

Mabinty started her business in the year 1991. For the past years, she has been selling clothing such as jeans, men’s shirts and gara (dyed clothing). Her business is located in the Cotton Tree Market in Makeni. 

Mabinty started this business to be able to generate enough profit to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Mabinty works seven days a week and 11 hours daily. On average, Mabinty earns 900,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) monthly from her business.

Mabinty has a very good loan repayment history. She needs a loan of 3,000,000SLL to help her buy ready-made jeans and men's shirts for her business. She intends to use the proceeds from this loan to educate her children and buy a piece of land. She thanks you for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy ready-made shirts and jeans

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 52-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married to a businesswoman and together they have five children, ages 23, 19, 17, 15 and 13 years old. He lives in a family of ten people. He has a produce business, purchasing cereals like maize, rice and beans for reselling at a profit. He has been at it for the last 20 years. Joseph says the biggest challenge he faces is the fluctuating prices of his produce. Sometimes the prices hit a low, meaning his profit is low for that period. However, he says it is a profitable venture and he would like to develop it further. Joseph intends to use this loan to purchase beans, rice and maize for reselling at a profit.

loans.use: To purchase beans, rice and maize for reselling at a profit

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a young man 29 years old. He is married to a tailor and together they have three children ages 9, 7 and 5 years. He is head of a family of five people and they live in Christopher’s house that he has managed to put up using hard-earned income from farming. He is a farmer and says he has been one since he was very young. Droughts are his stumbling block in some seasons but he says he is expecting better results from his farming business. Christopher says he feels he must diversify his sources of income to sustain his family in terms of welfare and education. He intends to use the loan funds to buy a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El Sr. Santiago tiene una librería    en el mercado de abasto de C.D.E, con clientela formada e ingresos permanentes.
Con el apoyo de su familia, trabajo en equipo y cooperación entre todos, se puede ver el crecimiento y progreso en el cual se están desenvolviendo. 

Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos dignos de nuestro apoyo.
EL solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio con la compra de los artículos que le faltan  como cuadernos, libros, lápices, cartucheras, bolsos y otros.
texts.en:
Santiago has an office supply store in the wholesale market of Ciudad del Este, where he has regular customers and a consistent income. With the support of family, teamwork and cooperation among all, one can see the growth and progress that are unfolding. He has been shown to be a responsible and honest person who fulfills his promises and is worthy of our support. He requests a loan to invest in his business, purchasing items that he lacks such as notebooks, books, pencils, pencil bags, bags, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy notebooks, books, writing instruments in general, pencil bags, backpacks, and other items.

loans.name: Guzman

texts.es: Guzmán, de 62 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijo alguno. Vive en el poblado de Triboline, ubicada en la selva tropical peruana, donde tiene su propia casa a base de madera. A pesar de tener estudios incompletos, eso no lo impidió a que siguiera su sueño, por el cual se había propuesto desde su adolescencia, que era tener su propio negocio agrícola, específicamente a la producción y comercialización de cacao. Desde luego que no lo fue tan fácil, ya que en varias oportunidades tuvo éxitos y fracasos, pero el más frustrante fue cuando se enfermó, impeliéndole a seguir trabajando, sin embargo sacó fuerzas para recuperarse. Hoy, vende su producto agrícola a sus clientes potenciales, además ofrece su producto a los clientes nuevos, con la necesidad de que capte mayor clientela, a pesar de ello, su economía se mejora paulatinamente. Usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en temporada de cosecha necesita la ayuda de su familia, con el propósito de que extraigan su producción. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su producto de cacao, con la finalidad de que pueda satisfacer a sus clientes más exigentes. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando, tal como lo hizo en sus anteriores préstamos, además augura en que seguirá en banco comunal, ya que lo trae ventajas positivas. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono con la necesidad de preservar la calidad de sus plantaciones de cacao, así como sacar la mala hierba de su terreno de cultivo.
texts.en: Guzmán is 62 years old, single, and has no children.  He lives in the village of Triboline, located in the tropical jungle of Peru, where he has his own wooden house.  Even though he did not finish school, this has not stopped him from following his life-long dream of having his own agricultural business, specializing in the production and sale of cocoa.  It has been difficult for him, and he has often had success and failure, but the most frustrating thing was when he got sick and was unable to work.  He was able to recover and today sells his produce to customers and also offers it to new clients, as he needs to increase his clientele.  His business has gradually been improving.  He usually works by himself, but during harvest time he needs his family to help.  His plans for the future are to increase his production of cocoa in order to satisfy his most demanding customers.  This is his tenth loan with MFP, and he is committed to make the payments, just as he has with his previous loans.  He will remain with his community bank, because it brings him benefits.  He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer to maintain the quality of his cocoa fields and to kill the weeds on his land.

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Sonia es cliente antigua, ella quedo viuda hace dos años, tiene un hijo en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de varios productos en su tienda que se halla bien surtida, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, ya que desde muy joven se hizo cargo de la tienda, en la casa donde vive se encuentra su mamá y hermano que comparten algunos gastos familiares, es esta última temporada ella se dedico también a la venta de comida por las noches, en una tienda alquilada por la misma zona, y precisamente el crédito invertirá en la compra de enseres y refrigerador para ese ambiente, así como productos alimenticios para el preparado de las comidas. Es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable por lo que se solicita este tratamiento preferencial de la tasa kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia is a long-time Emprender client. She has remained a widow for two years and has a child of school age. She sells several products in her well-stocked store. She is a very hard worker, since when she was very young she took over the store. Her mother and brother live with her to share some of the family expenses. This last season, she also sold food at night in a rented tent in the same neighborhood. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of furniture and a refrigerator for the store, as well as food stuffs for meal preparation. Sonia is a very hardworking and responsible person, why is why she is seeking this loan with preferential rates through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and groceries

loans.name: Elisa Gemy

texts.es:
Elisa tiene 27 años  de edad  es madre de tres niños y se encuentra casado con Remberto, ellos se dedican a la producción de la leche y viven en Itocta Sud que es una zona rural de la ciudad de Cochabamba.
Elisa es una mujer luchadora ya que hace como seis años atrás su esposo tuvo un accidente en el tractor que él trabajaba y estaba muy delicado de salud fue tan grave que él no podía caminar y tuvieron que hacer tratamientos y fisioterapias en las cuales Elisa siempre estuvo con el apoyándolo, ella se levantaba muy temprano para realizar su trabajo y poder entregar la leche a la empresa de leche y de esa manera poder tener más ingresos para la rehabilitación de su esposo y que sus niños no dejaran  la escuela  ya que era importante para ella y Remberto  en ningún momento ellos se dejaron vencer salieron solos adelante ya que los padres ni de Elisa ni los de Remberto los ayudaron en nada.

Elisa solicita el crédito para la compra de cascara de soya  ella realizara la compra de un camión de soya que eso le servirá para la alimentación de sus ganado por los próximos seis meses  ya que en épocas de le los primeros meses del próximo año siempre existe escases de soya, con esto podrá aumentar la producción de los litros de leche  ya que ella saca entre 150 y 170 litros diarios y de esa manera recibe mayores ingresos cada mes.

Ella junto a su esposo sueñan  que sus niños puedan en un futuro terminar el colegio y de la misma manera poder hacer una carrera  ya que ellos no pudieron ni terminar el colegio porque se conocieron muy jóvenes y se casaron, el señor Remberto trabaja mucho para poderles ofrecer un futuro mejor a sus hijos y sus esposa.
texts.en:
Elisa is 27 years old, a mother of 3 children, and is married to Remberto. For a living they produce milk and live in Itocta Sud in a rural area of the city of Cochabamba.

Elisa is a hardworking woman since her husband suffered an accident on his tractor and was gravely hurt. It was so severe that he could not walk and had to attend treatment and physical therapy. Elisa was always there to support him. She would wake up very early to work and deliver the milk to the milk company to make enough money to pay for her husband's rehabilitation. She also worked so that her children not leave school since she and Remberto considered their education as something important. She and Remberto never gave up. They were able to succeed on their own since neither Elisa nor Remberto's parents helped them.

She is requesting the loan to buy soy peels. She will buy a soy truck which will be used for her livestock for the next six months because during first few months next year there is a scarcity of soy. With this she will be able to increase milk production since she collects between 15 and 17 liters per day. This will allow her to receive the highest possible amount of profits each month.

Along with her husband she dreams that their children be able to finish school and be able to have a career. They themselves were not able to finish school meeting at an early age and getting married. Mr. Remberto works very hard to offer a better future for his children and wife.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Gladiz

texts.es: La Sra. Gladiz es cliente antigua, Se dedica a la venta de ropa desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana tiene su puesto en un calle muy conocida de la ciudad de la paz, vende ropa de niños y ropa juvenil,  en la casa donde vive se encuentra su mamá y hermano que comparten algunos gastos familiares, es esta última temporada ella se dedico también a la venta  de ropa en distintas ferias que hay en las provincias, con el dinero del crédito comprara ropa por  cantidad y de temporada, Es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable por lo que se solicita este tratamiento preferencial de la tasa kiva.
texts.en:
Gladiz has been a longtime Kiva client. She makes a living selling clothing from the very early hours of the morning from her sales post on a well-known street in the city of La Paz. She sells children's clothes and teen clothing. She lives with her mother and brother, and they share household expenses. This past season she decided to also sell clothing at the various flea markets in the provinces, and with the money from the loan she plans to purchase seasonal clothing in bulk. Gladiz is a very hard-working and responsible person, which is why she is requesting this loan through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasonal clothing in bulk

loans.name: Filadelfo Rigoberto

texts.es:
Filadelfo Rigoberto Barragán G. tiene 27 anos. Es soltero y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Filadelfo es un socio de la ventanilla rural San Isidro, que está ubicada a una hora y media de San Miguel. Son 10 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y trigo.
Filadelfo se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos a su familia. Los cultivos que mas cultiva son el maíz, el frijol, el tomate y el trigo. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el mercado de San Pablo.  

Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas. Con el apoyo del préstamo podra darles estudios a sus hijos. Su sueno para los proximo 5 anos es dar los estudios a sus hijos y comprar un terreno para construir una casa. Este ano, por el mal clima se enfermaron las plantas. Espera que el credito lo ayudara en recuperar este ano. 

Le gusta jugar el boli y salir de paseo con su familia.
texts.en:
Filadelfo Rigoberto Barragán G. is 27 years old, single, and lives in the San Miguel district in Bolívar province. He has two children. Filadelfo is a member of a group in the rural area of San Isidro, located an hour and a half from San Miguel. There are 10 group members and the majority of them work cultivating corn and wheat. Filadelfo works in agriculture to support his family. He mainly grows corn, beans, tomatoes and wheat. He buys and sells his produce in the San Pablo market.

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the support of the loan he can give his children an education. His dream for next 5 years is to provide an education for his children and buy land to build a house. This year the weather harmed his crops. He hopes the loan will help him recover this year.

He likes to bowl and go out with his family.

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 48 años de edad, está divorciada y  tiene cuatro hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en el poblado de Triboline, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Lidia se caracteriza por ser una persona humilde y carismática; actualmente está dedicado al rubro agrícola, específicamente a la producción y comercialización de cacao y café, donde ya viene laborando desde hace 20 años. Recuerda que sus primeras ventas no lo fue tan bien, ya que había días en donde solo le alcanzaba para el sustento familiar. Pero la perseverancia hizo que continuara en esta actividad. Hoy es una de las mejores agriculturas de su valle, debido a que produce productos de alta calidad, además le brinda buenos ingresos económicos. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, sin embargo cuando es temporada de cosecha, tiene que contratar mano de obra para que le ayuden a extraer su producto final. Ella anhela en un futuro cercano adquirir más terrenos de cultivo con la necesidad de que pueda ampliar su producción y a la vez mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está contenta con su banco comunal, debido a la responsabilidad y compromiso que tienen cada unos de los socios con dicha institución. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en los gastos educativos de sus cuatros hijos.
texts.en: Lidia is 48 years old, divorced, and has four school-aged children.  They live in the town of Triboline, located in the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own wooden house.  Lidia is known as a humble and charismatic person, and currently works in agriculture.  She specializes in the production and sale of cocoa and coffee, and she has been doing this work for 20 years.  She recalls that her first sales did not go very well, and there were days when she only made enough money to pay for her family’s basic needs.  However, her perseverance made her continue in her work.  Today she is one of the best farmers in her valley, due to the high quality of her produce, and her work provides her with high earnings.  She normally works on her own, but sometimes her children help her, and during harvest time she has to hire people to help gather the crops.  In the future, she desires to buy more land in order to increase her crop production and improve her family’s quality of life.  This is her tenth loan with MFP and she is dedicated to repay it on time.  She is happy with her community bank because of the responsibility and commitment that each member shows.  She will invest the loan in educational expenses of her four children.

loans.use: Education expenses for her four children

loans.name: Las Tejedoras De Ñanduti Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité  es del área Tavai-Pirayú. 

Son Señoras muy trabajadoras que se dedican de lleno a sus pequeños negocios, todas estas señoras anteriormente no tenían un capital para trabajar mejor y hoy en día gracias al programa Comité de mujeres Emprendedoras tienen una oportunidad de generar más ingresos a sus familias, gracias al pequeño capital que les brinda la Fundación Paraguaya.

Las Señoras están muy agradecidas con la Fundación por tan importante  apoyo que les brinda. 

Las integrantes ya culminaron hoy su ciclo número 6, poseen una antigüedad de  1 año y 7 meses.
Una de ella es la señora Norma quien se dedica a la venta de productos variados desde comestible, golosinas, bebidas, y productos para el consumo familiar como yerba, aceite, enlatados, panificados y otros.
Este negocio lo ha ayuda bastante con los gasto de su familia y por ello desea invertir en ella y aprovechar los ingresos para ir mejorando su actividad actual ampliando el negocio o comprando otros productos para vender.
Ella comenta que está muy satisfecha con el comité y la ayuda que recibe de su grupo es muy importante para ella ya ha progresado mucho no solo económicamente sino en también en el sentido de valores que se relacionan a la mujer y desea continuar en su grupo.

Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas, carne, aceite, panificada, enlatada y otros.
texts.en:
The women who form this group are from the Tavai de Pirayú area. They are very hard-working women who dedicate themselves fully to their small businesses. All of these women previously did not have enough capital to improve their businesses, but today thanks to the working businesswomen's group program and the little capital provided by Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya they have an opportunity to earn more income for their families. The woman are very grateful to the foundation for the support of such importance it provides. The members are now finishing their sixth loan cycle over the past year and seven months. One of the members is Norma, who makes a living selling varied food and beverage products such as maté, oil, canned goods, bread products and other items. This business has really helped her with family expenses, so she wishes to invest in herself and take advantage of the income by improving her business and expanding and buying more products to sell. She tells us she is very satisfied with the group and the help she receives from her fellow members has been been very important for her, since she has progressed so much not just economically but also in valuing the relationships with her fellow women, and she wishes to stay in the group. Norma is requesting the loan to purchase beverages, meat, oil, baked goods, canned goods and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages, baked goods, snacks, meat, oil and other products.

loans.name: Muhammed

texts.en: Muhammed  is a 42-year-old man married to a businesswoman with six children aged 22, 18, 16, 14, 11, and 9 years. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda with his family in his own house. He is a taxi driver meaning he is into the transport business. He has been in it for the last 18 years, having started as a conductor. He says it is a challenging business but says he sees himself progressing in the near future for better transport business deals. This is Muhammed‘s first loan from HOFOKAM and he intends to buy material like cement and iron sheets for construction of his commercial house intended for rentals.

loans.use: To buy cement and iron sheets for construction of his commercial house for rentals.

loans.name: Gumercindo Segundo

texts.es:
Gumercindo Segundo Barragán M. tiene 71 anos. Es casado y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos de 50, 45, 42, 40, 39, y 37 anos.  

Gumercindo es un socio de la ventanilla rural San Isidro, que está ubicada a una hora y media de San Miguel. Son 10 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y trigo.
Gumercindo se dedica a la agricultura y a la cria de animales (ganado) como fuente de ingresos de su familia. Lo que mas siembra es el maíz. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en la comunidad mas cerca, San Pablo. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos y un ganado pequeño. Con el apoyo de este credito espera mejorar las condiciones economicos de su familia. Su meta para los proximos anos es que haya el sosteniento del hogar y que hay medicinas. Un desafió es que el mercado de ganado se ha bajado de precio. 

Le gusta participar en las costumbres únicas de su comunidad como San Isidro, el patron de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Gumercindo Segundo Barragán M. is 71 years old. He is married and lives in San Miguel Canton in the province of Bolivar. He has 6 children; they are 50, 45,42, 40, 39 and 37 years old.

Gumercindo is a member of the San Isidro rural ventanilla ( rural loan group), which is an hour and a half away from San Miguel. There are 10 members, the majority of the members farm corn and wheat.

Gumercindo works in agriculture and raises animals (livestock) as a source of income for his family. He also plants corn. He makes purchases and sales of his products in a community closer to him, in San Pablo.

He is requesting this loan in order to buy fertilizer and a small amount of livestock. With the support of this loan, he hopes to improve the economic condition of his family. His goal for the next few years is that the household will be sustained and that there are medications. The challenge is that the prices have fallen in the livestock market.

He likes to participate in the unique customs of his community like the San Isidro celebration, who is the patron saint of the community.

loans.use: to buy agricultural fertilizers and a small amount of livestock

loans.name: Yasmin  Bolivia

texts.es: La Srta. Yasmin es cliente que vive en la ciudad de La Paz,  en la zona Villa nueva Potosí,  es soltera de ocupación comerciante cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el rubro , ella se dedica a la venta de café tiene su cafetería en una de las calles mas populosas de la ciudad de la Paz, le va muy bien cuenta con numerosa clientela,  y menciona que invertirá el dinero en la compra de café procesado, es muy joven y trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con Emprender por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Yasmin is a borrower that lives in the Villa Nueva Potosí area of the city of the La Paz. She is single and is a merchant with 4 years of experience in the trade. She works selling coffee and has her café on one of the most populated streets in La Paz. The business is going very well for her and she has a large client base.

She mentions that she will invest the loan money in the purchase of processed coffee. She is very young and hardworking, and is very appreciative of Emprender for the confidence provided in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of processed coffee

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto R. N. tiene 33 anos. Es casado y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos de 10, 8, 7, 6, y 4 anos. 

Luis Alberto es un socio de la ventanilla rural San Isidro, que está ubicada a una hora y media de San Miguel. Son 10 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y trigo.
Luis Alberto se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra maíz y trigo mayormente. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en San Pablo cada semana. 

Solicita el credito para comprar las semillas para agricultura. Viendo como se produce este ano, se aumenta sus cultivos. Su meta es seguir trabajando y dar algo a la familia. Las lanchas eran fuerte este ano, pero espera superar. 

Le gusta jugar el futbol y el boli.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto R. N. is 33 years old.  He is married and lives in the town of San Miguel in the Bolívar province.  He has 5 children, ages 10, 8, 7, 6 and 4.

Louis Alberto is a member of the San Isidro rural cooperative, which is located an hour and a half from San Miguel.  There are a total of 10 members, the majority of whom are dedicated to growing corn and wheat.  Luis Alberto is a farmer, who plants primarily corn and wheat.  He does his shopping and sells his product in San Pablo every week.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds for farming.  Seeing how production is this year, he increases his crops.  His goal is to continue working and give something back to his family.  

He enjoys playing soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: To buy seeds for farming.

loans.name: Alicia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Alicia, de 42 años de edad se dedica a la venta de pupusas, vive con su esposo y dos hijos uno de 24 y el otro de 26 años de edad, este último ya no depende económicamente de ella. Este negocio lo tienen desde hace dos años y lo atiende con su hija, al mismo tiempo fabrica hamacas estos negocios se dieron por iniciativa propia siempre viendo la manera de tener de ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares.
Ella necesita invertir una parte en los materiales para las pupusas como pollo, chicharrón, aceite y  otra parte en materiales para tejer hamacas como hilo de seda de diferentes colores, por tal motivo solita un préstamo que le ayudara a realizar las compras necesarias para contar con materia prima para la preparación de su venta.
Las proyecciones de Alicia son, establecer una pupuseria grande con muchos clientes, ampliar su confección de hamacas, mejorar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Alicia, age 42, sells “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas).  She lives with her husband and their two children, ages 24 and 26.  The oldest child is no longer economically dependent upon her.  She has had this business for two years; she and her daughter take care of the business.  She also makes hammocks.  She started these businesses on her own initiative, always seeing a way to have income to pay the family expenses.  

She needs to invest partly in materials like chicken, pork rinds, and oil.  She will also invest in materials like different colors of silk yarn to weave hammocks.  That is why she is requesting a loan.  She will use the loan to make the necessary purchases to have the raw materials she uses to make the things she sells.

Alicia’s projections are to establish a large pupusa shop with lots of customers, to increase the number of hammocks she makes, and to improve the family income.

loans.use: Buy materials to make "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas)

loans.name: Rigoberto Dionel

texts.es:
Rigoberto Dionel Barragán L. tiene 41 anos. Es casado y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos de 10, 6, y 4 anos.  

Rigoberto es un socio de la ventanilla rural San Isidro, que está ubicada a una hora y media de San Miguel. Son 10 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y trigo.
Rigoberto se dedica a la agricultura. Cultiva el maíz, el trigo, el fríjol, la arveja, y las papas. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en San Pablo, el centro comercial mas cerca de la comunidad, cada 8 días. 

Solicita el credito para comprar una baca de leche y comprar los abonos agrícolas. El préstamo lo ayudara en aumentar su producción agrícola. En los proximos anos espera aumentar su producion agrícola. Las lanchas han afectado mucho sus cultivos de maíz y trigo este ano. Se afecta mas los cultivos arriba de la comunidad por la altura mas alto, donde se han perdido mas de 50% de la cosecha. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar el boli.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 41 years old, married, and lives in the canton of San Miguel, province of Bolivar.  He has 3 children, ages 10, 6, 4.

Rigoberto is a member of the San Isidro rural bank, located 1 1/2 hours from San Miguel.  There are 10 members in total, who in the majority cultivate corn and wheat.  Rigoberto is also a farmer.  He plants corn, wheat, beans, peas, and potatoes.  Every 8 days, he makes his purchases and sells his produce in San Pablo, the commercial center nearest his community

Rigoberto is requesting a loan to buy a milk cow and agricultural fertilizers.  The loan will help him to increase his agricultural production, which, in the next few years, he hopes to augment.

Bad conditions have greatly affected his corn and wheat crops this year, especially in fields above the community at the highest altitude, where more than 50% of the crops have been lost.

In his free time Rigoberto likes to play 'boli' (boliche, a traditional game).

loans.use: BUYING A COW AND FERTILIZER FOR AGRICULTURE

loans.name: Bolivar Antonio

texts.es:
Bolívar Antonio R. M. tiene 43 años.  Es casado y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos de 22, 20, 16, 13, 11, 8, y 6 anos. 

Antonio es un socio de la ventanilla rural San Isidro, que está ubicada a una hora y media de San Miguel. Son 10 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y trigo. 
Antonio se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz, trigo, cebada, y alverja. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en San Pablo cada 8 dias.  

Solicita el préstamo para comprar los abonos, las semillas, y los insumos para producir en su agricultura. El apoyo del préstamo lo ayudara en trabajar para ayudar a sus hijos. Su meta para los anos proximos es progresar mas en la agricultura. Este ano las lanchas han sido fuertes y se han afectado un gran porcentaje de sus cultivos de maíz. 

Le gusta jugar el boli.
texts.en:
Bolívar Antonio R. M. is 43 years old.  He is married and lives in the San Miguel canton of the Bolívar province.  He has seven children; ages 22, 20, 16, 13, 11, 8, and 6.

Antonio is a member of the San Isidro Communal Bank, which is located one and a half hours from San Miguel.  There are ten members in all, and most of them grow corn and wheat.

Antonio is a farmer, and he grows corn, wheat, barley, and peas.  He buys and sells his products in San Pablo every eight days.

He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and the agricultural products needed for production.  The support from the loan will help in work in order to help his children.  His goal for the coming years is to make more agricultural progress.  The crop diseases have been strong this year, and they have affected a large percentage of his corn crop.

He likes to play volleyball.

loans.use: To buy compost, seeds, and liquid fertilizer

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El Sr. Rene es cliente antiguo, se encuentra en su decima secuencia, se dedica al lavado y venta de arena en el rio Mallasilla, en cuyo rio tiene un lugar delimitado de trabajo, especialmente en épocas de lluvia donde se extrae mayor cantidad de arena, él vive en Mallasilla con su esposa e hijo menor, quien se dedica  a la venta de carne de pollo en un puesto que adquirió en el mercado nuevo de Mallasilla, también tienen otros hijos mayores con hogar propio. Al margen de esta actividad don Rene viaja por temporadas a la localidad de Patacamaya a comprar ovejas en las comunidades cercanas y las vende en las ferias locales, es una persona dedicada a sus actividades y responsable, el dinero del crédito lo invertirá en la compra de Ovejas para criarlas y después venderlas. Esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rene is a previous borrower and this is his 10th loan cycle. He works washing and selling sand at the Mallasilla River, which has a defined work area, especially in the rainy season when more sand is extracted. Rene lives in Mallasilla with his wife and youngest son, who works selling chicken meat at a stand he obtained in the new market of Mallasilla. He also has older children who have their own homes. Aside from this business, Rene also travels seasonally to Patacamaya to buy sheep in the neighboring communities and then sells them at the local markets. He is a person who is responsible and dedicated to his work.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of sheep to raise and then sell. He is very appreciative of the institution for the support provided.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Cuatro Caminos Group

texts.es: Juana Margarita tiene con 41 años D. edad, es casada, y tienen dos hijas menores D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. ropa típica, venD. en las plazas D. San Francisco El Alto y Salcajá. Tiene 10 años D. tener esta actividad económica. Una D. las dificultades D. tener un negocio propio es no contar con el capital necesario para lograr adquirir más mercadería, esto es el caso D. doña Juana y viéndose en la necesidad y ella siendo una mujer  líder. Se organizan con otras señoras conformando el Banco Comunal Cuatro Caminos integrado por 14 mujeres,  en su mayoría se dedican a la venta D. comida y cuentan con tiendas D. consumo diario. Lo que anhelan es incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana Magarita is 41 years old, married, and has two young daughters. She works selling traditional clothing in the San Francisco El Alto and the Salcajá plazas. She has been in the business for 10 years. One of the difficulties of having your own business is not having the money necessary to obtain more merchandise. This is the case with Juana, a leader, who is in need. She is organized with 14 other women who form part of the Cuatro Caminos communal bank. The majority of them work selling food or have stores where they sell daily need items. What they hope for is to increase their sales and their income.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres De Calle ' I Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio San Miguel  de Tobati.
Las señoras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que le está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya, con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida y la de sus hijos. 
Las señoras  están en el ciclo Nº  4º con sus 12 integrantes.
La señora Juana es una de las integrantes del comité y de dedica  a la venta de bebidas en una cantina que posee en su domicilio, así ella con esta actividad ayuda a su familia. 
Ella quiere seguir trabajando en este negocio ya que le deja un buen ingreso especialmente los fines de semana, sin embargo esta con varios proyectos de incluir dentro de sus actividades y desea concretar en un corto periodo. 
Sin embargo en esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas que  para su negocio y también para la compra de una vitrina o heladera para conservar fríos sus bebidas.
texts.en:
This committee is made up of 12 women from San Miguel de Tobati who are in their fourth loan cycle. They are very satisfied with the assistance that Fundación Paraguaya has given them. With the working capital they have received the women are increasing their small businesses and also increasing their income to obtain a better quality of life for themselves and their children. Juana is one of the members of the committee and she sells beverages in a canteen that she runs from her home to help her family. She wants to keep running this business as it provides her with a good income, especially on weekends. However, she has many other actvities to attend to so she would like to get her business going within a short time frame. She is requesting a loan to purchase beverages for her business and also a glass cabinet or a fridge where she can keep them cool.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos, de 27 años de edad, es carpintero y tiene un negocio de venta de papas fritas, reside en el Departamento de San Miguel y vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos uno de 6 y 1 año de edad.
Él se dedica a la carpintería desde hace tres años y en la zona no hay otro carpintero por lo que Juan Carlos adquiere la mayoría de trabajo de sus vecinos, el atiende el taller desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde.
Juan Carlos solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera, pleywood, tubos y otros materiales  necesarios para su negocio, esto ayudara que su inventario este fortalecido y pueda realizar el trabajo que sus clientes de demanden.
Las aspiraciones de Juan son crecer con su carpintería, capacitarse en nuevos diseños de muebles, aumentar la clientela y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, age 27, is a carpenter.  He also has a business selling French fries.  He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 6 and 1, in the San Miguel department.

He decided to work in carpentry three years ago.  There is no other carpenter in the area, so Juan Carlos gets most of his work from his neighbors.  He tends his workshop from eight in the morning until four in the afternoon.

Juan Carlos is requesting a loan to buy wood, plywood, tubes, and other needed materials for his business.  This will help him increase his inventory, and it will allow him to do the work that is in demand by his customers.

Juan’s aspirations are to grow as a carpenter, to train himself to make new furniture designs, to get more customers, and to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: Buy plywood for carpentry

loans.name: Gladys Del Rocio

texts.es:
Gladys de 42 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. Tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa.  

Inicio su tienda porque vio que en el sector donde vive no había tiendas disponibles para las personas. Al principio solo tenia una vitrina y arroz para la venta poco a poco fue surtiendo la tienda. Ahora trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar vitrinas y arroz para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener su casa bien construida y una tienda grande y muy conocida.
texts.en:
Gladys is 42 years old, lives in a Peruvian zone in the Paraíso de Guayaquil (Guayaquil Paradise), known for its terrain and mointains. She has a small store in the front section of her home.

She started her business because in the area she lives in there are no stores for people to go to. In the beginning she only had a display cabinet and rice to sell. Little by little she stocked her store. Now she works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

With the loan she wants to buy display cabinets and rice for her business. In the future she wants her home to be well built and also have a well known store.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy display cabinets, rice, and canned goods.

loans.name: Flor De Avispa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor de Avispa está conformado por Luz Marina Hernández, Veronica del Carmen M. E. y Ana F. P. tres féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras quienes tienen muchos deseos de autosuperación. La coordinadora del grupo es la Joven Luz Marina Hernández quien vende ropa desde hace dos años negocio que con los créditos ha mejorado y el cual sueña en poner una tienda.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Veronica del Carmen M. E. de 23 años comercializa pollo en pizas y entero y Ana F. P. realiza ropa de cama y bolsos desde hace 2 años aproximadamente.
texts.en:
The group Flor de Avispa (Hibiscus) is formed by Luz Marina Hernández, Veronica del Carmen M. E.,and Ana F. P.. These are three hardworking, strong, and entrepreneural women who have many dreams to improve their lives. The coordinator of the group is the young Luz Marina Hernández whom has sold clothes for two years and with the loans has improved her business and dreams of opening a store.

The other members of the group are Veronica del Carmen M. E. who is 23 years old and sells chicken in portions or whole and Ana F. P. who has been making bed linen and bags for approximately two years now.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Fuente De Vida Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Fuente de Vida” está iniciando su primer ciclo con crédito. Esta conformada por ocho personas, siete mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva esta constituida por la señora Claudina como presidenta, la señora Valentina como tesorera y la señora Lourdes como secretaria de actas.

La señora Lourdes tiene como tarea registrar lo que sucede en la asociación durante la reunión de pago, desde el día de desembolso, durante las reuniones de pago hasta el último días pago del ciclo, momento en el que podrá dejar el cargo o  ser reelegida. Si bien es joven, 23 años y no tiene mucha experiencia, esta dispuesta a aprender. Para este primer ciclo está solicitando Bs.500.- para la compra de dulces e iniciar un negocio propio. Piensa realizar la venta los días sábados y domingos de 8 de la mañana a 8 de la noche.

En la asociación también se encuentra socias con otros negocios: tienda de barrio, taller de mecánica chapista, ayudante de minibús, venta de comida y tejido de mantas.
texts.en:
The communal association "Fuente de Vida" (Fountain of Life) is beginning its first loan cycle. It is made up of 8 members, seven women and one man. The board of directors is made up of Mrs. Claudina as president, Mrs. Valentina as treasurer, and Lourdes as recording secretary.

Mrs. Lourdes registers what happens in the association during the payment meeting from the expenditure to the last payment of the loan cycle. At the moment she can either leave the position or be re-elected. In spite of being a young 23 year old and not having much experience, she is willing to learn. For this first loan cycle she requests 500 Bolivianos (Bolivian currency) to buy candies and begin a new business. She plans to sell Saturdays and Sundays from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m.

In the association are other members with other businesses: a local store, a panel beater shop, a minibus helper, an individual who sells food, and and one who sews blankets.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of candies.

loans.name: Cristalina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cristalina está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzada y emprendedoras una de ellas es Idalina del Socorro S. V. de 25 años propietaria de una pequeña pulpería. Este negocio lo inicio hace cuatro años vendiendo gaseosas, meneítos y pan en la actualidad gracias a los préstamos ha aumentado su negocio. Ella sueña con tener una pulpería grande, surtida con variedad y cantidad de productos.

Los otros integrantes son Julia de los Ángeles Leiba S. comerciante de ropa y calzo negocio que inicio con unas cuantas piezas y pares de zapatos y Ramón Francisco B. A. es agricultor el siembra maíz, pipián, ayote
texts.en:
The Cristalina group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising members, one of whom is Idalina del Socorro S. V.. At 25 years of age she is the owner of a small general store. She started this business four years ago selling soft drinks, chips and bread. Thanks to previous loans, she has been able to expand her business. She dreams of having a large general store filled with many and varied products. The other members are Julia de los Ángeles Leiba S., a dealer of clothes and shoes who began with just a few items of clothing and pairs of shoes, and Ramón Francisco B. A., a farmer who grows corn, pumpkin and squash.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pulses, dairy products and yoghurts

loans.name: Ruth Meri

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Ruth Meri; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de cosméticos en forma independiente, ella lleva perfumes, lápiz labiales y cremas a diferentes instituciones y los vende y también vende a las personas en general, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender los cosméticos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cosméticos al por mayor. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ruth Meri belongs to the “Banco del Desarrollo” (Development Bank) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Wanchaq district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Ruth Meri is 27 years old and single.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of independently selling cosmetics.  She carries perfume, lipstick, and creams to sell to different establishments.  She also sells to the general population.

She wants to have a store to sell her cosmetics.  She is requesting the loan to purchase cosmetics wholesale.

She is grateful to everyone who made this dream possible, so she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics wholesale

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Isabel Cristina G. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 43 años quien se dedica al comercio de nacatamales, comida típica a base de cerdo, masa, especies, papa, arroz etc. que se comercializa por lo general los fines de semana. Ella en un principio destazaba pero como vio que era mucho esfuerzo para ella decidió mejor comprar la carne para realizar dicho producto.

G. comercializa sus nacatamales en Tipitapa ya que hay mayor concurrencia y sueña en poner una pequeña venta. Ella  tiene cinco hijos de los cuales uno de ellos está a su cargo y es quien le ayuda en sus tiempos libre en el negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel Cristina is a hardworking, dedicated and entrepreneurial woman. She is 43 years old and sells "nacatamales", a local food made with pork, dough, spices, potatoes, rice and others (similar to a tamale). She normally sells them on weekends. At first she butchered the meat but it took a lot of effort si she decided to purchase it instead to prepare the product. Isabel sells her "nacatamales" in Tipitaba since there is more competition. She dreams of opening a small shop. She has five children. One of them is under her care and helps her with the business in his free time.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: "Nacatamales" (salty food similar to a tamale) production

loans.name: 12 De Junio Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó gracias a la invitación que recibieron  algunas de las integrantes D. comité Mujeres Emprendedoras con Esperanza el cual se encuentra en el 15° ciclo D. programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, estas señoras  una vez que se enteraron D. programa decidieron formar un  comité invitando a otras vecinas y amigas. 
 De esta forma se inicia el comité 12 de Junio Barrio San Carlos de Yka´a de la ciudad de Luque.
 
La señora Lorena C.  quien es una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de carbón es cual es una actividad que ella le conviene mucho en todo sentido, porque la realiza en su casa, le deja buena ganancia y además es muy fácil manejar y vender este producto.
Todos los días la mayoría de las vecinas quienes cocinan a carbón compran de ella para utilizarlas en sus casas ya que actualmente el precio D. gas es muy caro en nuestro país y todos lo  pagar.
Es por ello la importancia para ella en adquirir este producto en gran cantidad para no dejar de proveer este producto a sus clientes, y para ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de carbón en gran
Cantidad.
texts.en:
This group formed thanks to an invitation the members received from some of the members of the Mujeres Emprendedoras con Esperanza group, which is in its 15th loan cycle through the businesswomen's group loan program. Once these women joined the program, they decided to form another group, inviting their friends and neighbors. In this way the 12th of June group was founded in the Barrio San de Yka'a in the city of Luque. One of the members is Lorena C., who makes a living selling charcoal, which is an activity that is convenient for her in every way because she can do it from her home and earn good profits, and it's also very easy to manage and sell this product. Every day the majority of her neighbors who cook with charcoal buy it from Lorena to use in their homes, since the price of gas is very expensive in this country and everyone pays. Therefore, it's important for her to acquire a high quantity of charcoal so she will be able to fully provide this product to her customers. For this reason, she is requesting the loan to purchase charcoal in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase charcoal in high quantities

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana D. 29 años D. edad, se dedica al comercio D. perfumería (venta D. lociones) al por mayor, resiD. en El Transito Departamento D. San Miguel donD. vive junto a sus 3 hijos el mayor D. 10 años y el menor D. 4 años D. edad, Ella realiza este negocio desD. hace 10 años cuando pensó en ayudar a su familia con los gastos; Pero ella tiene una desventaja con estas ventas pues la mayor parte D. ellas son al crédito y los clientes  tardan para pagarle y otros que no le pagan.
Ana solicita un préstamo para cancelar un pedido D. 7 cajas D. producto(lociones) esta inversión ayudara a obtener mercadería y seguir ofreciendo a los clientes distintas marcas D. lociones, trabajando siempre para que no falte la alimentación en su hogar y progresar con el negocio.
El objetivo propuesto por Ana es cancelar bien este préstamo y seguir obteniendo D. esta ayuda por mucho tiempo, ayudar a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante mejorando sus condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 29 years old and dedicated to selling perfumes and lotions at wholesale.  She resides in El Transito, San Miguel Department, where she lives with her 3 children, the eldest 10 and the youngest 4 years old.  Ana has been in this business for the last 10 years, since thinking of a way to help her family with their expenses.  But she has a disadvantage with these sales – the major part are on credit and the customers are late paying, while others don't pay at all.

Ana is requesting a loan to pay for an order of 7 boxes of lotions.  This investment will help her obtain merchandise and continue offering her customers distinct brands of lotions, working always so that there will be no lack of food in her house and that her business will progress.

The objective proposed by Ana is to pay off this loan and to continue obtaining such help in the future, in order to aid her children, help them to advance, and better their conditions of life.

loans.use: BUYING PERFUMES TO SELL

loans.name: Las Samaritanas Group

texts.es: Doña Elena es casada, tiene cinco hijos, y se dedica a la tejeduría trabajo que ha sido D. gran beneficio para ella, ya que D. esta forma ha podido sufragar sus gastos tantos personales como familiares, su arte es la elaboración D. Cortes Tipicos. Es la Presidenta del Banco Comunal "Las Samaritanas" integrado por catorce mujeres quienes también son artesanas dedicadas a la Tejeduría.
