Se organizan para poder apoyarse y ayudarse en obtener un crédito y aumentar el capital D. cada una. El objetivo principal del grupo es mejorar su negocio y vender por mayor y asi garantizarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Elena is married, has five children, and is a weaver. This work has been of great benefit to her, because this way she has been able to defray her personal and familial costs. Her art is making traditional skirts. She is the president of the "Las Samaritanas" communal bank, which is maD. up of 14 women who are also artisans who work as weavers. They organized in order to support themselves, to help themselves to get a loan, and to increase each of their capital. The principal objective of the group is to improve their businesses and to sell wholesale, as this will guarantee a better future for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for working capital

loans.name: Alvina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alvina; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el su estudio de la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, ella quiere acabar su carrera profesional y asi poder trabajar en un estudio contable y sacar adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar las mensualidades de sus estudios.  


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Alvina belongs to the communal bank "Banco del Desarrollo."  This bank is located in the Wanchaq district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Alvina is 37 years old, lives with a partner, and has 2 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her studies, as she is working toward a degree in accounting.  She wants to finish her professional degree so that she can work in an accounting firm and in this way help her children to get ahead.  She requests a loan so that she can pay her monthly educational fees.

Alvina is grateful to the people who make it possible for her to pursue her dream through these means, and pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to pay her monthly educational fees

loans.name: Julio Alfonso

texts.es:
Julio de 26 años, es vendedor de panes en las calles de Paraíso, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.  

Inicio el negocio hace 6 años atrás cuando descubrió la habilidad que tenia para hacer panes, poco a poco comenzó a trabajar para mantener a su familia. Ahora trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 14h00pm repartiendo pan y después hasta las 21h00pm haciendo panes para el siguiente día.

El quiere comprar con el préstamo víveres como arroz, azúcar, harina para crear una pequeña tienda y asegurar el futuro de su esposa ya que esta embarazada. En el futuro quiere arreglar el local.
texts.en:
Julio is 26 years old and sells bread in the streets of Paraíso. He lives in the semi-urban zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil, which is known for its dirt roads and mountains. He started his business six years ago, when he discovered the ability he had for making bread. Little by little, he began to work to sustain his family. Now he works distributing bread from 6:00AM until 2:00PM, and after he works until 9:00PM making bread for the following day. He would like to use this loan to buy food supplies like rice, sugar, and flour, in order to set up a small store and thereby ensure the future for his wife, who is now pregnant. In the future, he would like to fix up the location.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Santiaguito Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santiaguito lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Ligia M. García, de 59 años la cual desde 1992 inicio con su negocio de nacatamales, comida típica que generalmente se comercializa los fines de semana. Ella comenzó con la compra de un cerdo los cuales en ese tiempo costaban 450 córdobas ahora son más caros según comento, además de esto invirtió en una pequeña pulpería.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son Luz Marina D. Obando quien desde hace 14 años aproximadamente comercializa leche en Managua y Manuel Salvador Días Urbina quien vende leña. Este grupo ha sido beneficiado tanto con los créditos como por las capacitaciones lo cual le a ayudado a salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Santiaguito Group is made up of three hard-working individuals. One of them is Ligia M. García, who is 59 years old. In 1992, she started her business selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan tamales, usually made with pork and other ingredients], a typical food generally sold on weekends. She started by buying a pig, which at that time cost 450 córdobas. Now, pigs are more expensive than that. She also invested in a small pulpería [grocery store]. The other members of the group are Luz Marina D. Obando, who has been selling milk in Managua for approximately 14 years, and Manuel Salvador Días Urbina, who sells firewood. This group has benefited both from the loans and from the training they have received. It has helped them to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy meat, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Santos Maria

texts.es:
Santos María J. I. es una mujer trabajadora, que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con sus tres hijas en las edades de 19, 21 y 26 anos, que fueron la fuente de su inspiración cuando desde muy pequeñas, elaboro la ropa que vestían con sus propias manos imprimiéndole cariño y dedicación a lo que hoy es su negocio y fuente de ingreso familiar.  Su primera y permanente clientela fueron sus familiares y sus vecinos cercanos, que gradualmente la han ayudado a salir adelante recomendándole nuevos clientes porque reconocen localidad de sus prendas y sobre todo su amabilidad.
Este es su primer financiamiento y quiere con el comprar  materia prima e insumos, como telas, pellones, hilos para elaborar uniformes respondiendo a un contrato con colegios en la zona muy cercana a su negocio, Su meta a mediano plazo es comprar una nueva máquina y una fileteadora- bordadora, que ayude a dar buen acabado a sus prendas y a mejorara los tiempos de producción así como los gastos relacionados con la contratación de estos servicios que aun no tiene.
texts.en:
Santos Maria J. I. is a hard working woman. She lives in the city of Cartagena with her three daughters aged 19, 21, and 26 years of age. They are the source of her inspiration when they were little. She started out making clothes for them with her own hands, making them with care and dedication. This developed into her business and it is the source of income for the family. Her first and permanent client base has been her family and her nearby neighbors. They have gradually helped her improve, recommending new clients. They recognize the quality of her work, and above all, her kindness. This is the first loan she accesses and she will purchase materials, such as fabrics, lining, and threads to make uniforms, to honor contracts she has with schools in the region. Her short term goal is to purchase a new sewing and embroidery machine. She wants to give her products a better finish and improve the time to complete her projects. She also hopes to one day hire help.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchaes materials such as fabric, lining, and threads to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Julia Estela

texts.es:
Doña Julia, es una señora de 63 años de edad, reside en El Transito Departamento de San Miguel,  es madre soltera de cuatro hijos y vive junto a una hija, Ella tiene este negocio desde hace 10 años donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad como frijoles, Azúcar, arroz entre otros productos que le son demandados por los clientes, ella atiende todos los días y durante todo el día pero cuando Doña Julia esta indispuesta por algún malestar es su hija la que se encarga de controlar las ventas.
Ella quiere mejorar su tienda e invertir en mas víveres para ofrecer,  es por eso que solicita un préstamo que ayude a impulsar mas su negocio y a reforzar sus inventarios para mejorar su atención a los clientes y satisfacer las necesidades de estos.
Su principal objetivo es mantener buena relación con la institución pagando puntual y de esta manera ella cree que contara con el apoyo para superar su negocio y mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Julia is 63 years old and lives in El Transito, in the Department of San Miguel. She is the single mother of four children, and she lives with one of her daughters. She has operated this business for 10 years, offering basic products such as beans, sugar and rice, along with other items that are in demand among her customers. She works all day, every day, in her store, but when Julia is indisposed with some kind of illness, her daughter takes charge of overseeing sales. 

She would like to improve her store and invest in more groceries to offer. For this reason, she is requesting a loan which will help give her business a boost and strengthen her inventory, so she can improve the service she provides to her customers and satisfy their needs. 

Her main objective is to maintain a good relationship with the institution by making her payments punctually, and thus she believes that she will have support in advancing her business and improving her economic stability.

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar and beans for her business

loans.name: Jans Steven

texts.es:
JANS STEVEN, (A QUIEN APRECIAMOS EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA) TIENE 20 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVE SOLO CON SU MADRE EN LA ZONA DE LA MERCED – COMAS, ES SOLTERO Y ACTUALMENTE ESTUDIA LA CARRERA DE GASTRONOMIA CURSANDO EL CUARTO CICLO, ADEMAS PARA SOLVENTAR SUS GASTOS, EN CIERTAS OCASIONES AYUDA A SU TIO EN LIMPIAR MAQUINAS DE TRAGAMONEDAS DESDE HACE 2 MESES, LA CUAL QUEDA UBICADO AL COSTADO DE SU DOMICILIO, ENTRE LOS GRANDES SUEÑOS QUE TIENE JANS ES EL DE ACABAR SU CARRERA Y TENER SU PROPIO NEGOCIO DE UN RESTAURANTE TURISTICO.
EL RECIENTEMENTE PRESTAMO SERA DESTINADO PARA LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS Y MENSUALIDAD DE SU CARRERA, SU MADRE LE APOYA CON LO QUE PUEDE EN SUS ESTUDIOS AUNQUE A VECES NO ES SUFICIENTE YA QUE ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS NATURALES. JANS ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO PORQUE GRACIAS AL PRESTAMO PODRA CONTINUAR CON SUS ESTUDIOS.
texts.en:
Jans Steven (seen here in the photograph) is 20 years old and he lives with his mother in the city of Merced-Comas. He is single and he is on his fourth term in a cooking college. In order to cover his personal expenses sometimes he helps his uncle attend to the slot machine located near his house. One of Jans' greatest dreams it to finish his schooling and to have his own restaurant that caters to tourists. This loan will be used to purchase ingredients and to cover his monthly tuition bills. His mother supports him as much as she can with the school expenses but it is not enough. She sells natural health products. Jans is very appreciative of the loan because it gives him the opportunity to stay in school.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Claudia Lucia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Claudia Lucia; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa, ella tiene una tienda que atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar la tienda de venta de ropa.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como polos, pantalones y casacas. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Banco del Desarrollo” ["Development Bank"] communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Her name is Claudia Lucia; she is 22 years old and single. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business of buying and selling clothing. She has a store which she operates from 9:00 a.m until 8:00 p.m. She would like to improve and expand her clothing store. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as shirts, pants and jackets. 

The borrower is grateful to all of those who are participating in her dream in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Buying merchandise such as shirts, pants and jackets

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. José Luis; el tiene 26 años de edad y es soltero; el socio estudia la carrera profesional de derecho, el quiere terminar de estudiar y así poder empezar a trabajar, el socio quiere tener su estudio jurídico. El socio solicita el préstamo para pagar las mensualidades de sus  estudios de la carrera profesional de derecho. 

	
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “Banco del Desarrollo” ["Development Bank"] communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

His name is José Luis; he is 26 years old and single. He is studying for a professional career in law. He would like to finish his studies and earn a law degree so he can start working. He is requesting the loan to pay the monthly fees for his studies toward his professional law degree. 
	
The borrower is grateful to all of those who are participating in his dream in this way, and he is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: Making his monthly payments for his studies toward a professional law degree

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Jessica; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, blusas y polos para varones y mujeres, ella tiene una tienda propia desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar su local. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda de venta de ropa. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jessica belongs to the Banco del Desarrollo communal bank, located in the Wanchaq district which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Jessica is 24 years old and single. She alternates her daily activities with her business buying and selling clothing. She sells pants, shirts, and t-shirts for men and women. She has a store where she works from 9am to 7pm, but she wants to expand her store. Jessica is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise for her clothing store.

She is grateful to everyone who is making this dream possible and promises to make her payments in the stipulated time frame.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her clothing store.

loans.name: Searle

texts.es:
Es muy usual en el Barrio Chino de Cartagena  el dinamismo diario que se  produce por el sinnúmero de pequeños negocios y comerciantes que transitan alrededor del mercado de Cartagena, que circunda a esta zona  donde vive  Searle, una mujer emprendedora y madre de dos hijos de 18 y 20 anos, quien inició su negocio de confecciones, hace mas de 15 anos con una sola maquina, después de haber trabajado de empleada de un taller. Su clientela inicial fue su propia familia, amigos y vecinos cercanos, con los que se esmero por fabricarle los mejores vestidos y responderle con mucha puntualidad,  para poder conservarlos  como  hasta hoy lo ha hecho y lograr el crecimiento de su negocio,   que ahora es reconocida por  instituciones y empresas con las que esta realizando contrataciones. 
Searle ha recibido 22  créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que la ha apoyado durante 14 anos, durante los cuales ha fortalecido su capital de trabajo y ha logrado tener su propia vivienda.  En la actualidad esta aplicando a su credikiva para comprar telas e insumos y responder a un contrato de uniformes que tiene con una entidad estatal.
Su sueño se concentra ahora,  en el montaje de una cacharrería donde pueda vender insumos de confecciones como hilos, correderas, pellones y adornos, ampliar su mercado y lograr rotar rápidamente el efectivo mediante un nuevo negocio  que venda de contado y fortalezca  también al crecimiento de su confección .
texts.en:
In the China town district of Cartagena it is very common to sense the energy produced by the countless businesses and vendors that sell in the market of Cartagena. Searle lives in this region. She is an enterprising woman and a mother of two children, aged 18 and 20. She started out sewing clothes more than 15 years ago with one sewing machine, after having been employed in a tailor's shop. Initially her client base was her own family, her friend, and her nearest neighbors. She worked hard to make high quality clothes and to have her projects completed on time. She wishes to keep her clients and that has been a measure of her success. She has made her business grow and now she is well known by companies and shops, some of which she has established contract agreements. Searle has accessed 22 past loans from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner), an organization that has support her for the past 14 years. During that time she has strengthened her working capital funds and she has managed to have her own home where to live. Currently she requests a new loan to purchase fabrics and other materials to fill a contract to make school uniforms, a contract with a provincial institution. Her dream is to set up a stand from where to sell products such as threads, zippers, lining and decorations. She wishes to expand her client base and to this end she wants to start this new business. It will also help in supporting the growth of her tailoring shop.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and other materials to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Yinis Miliana

texts.es:
Yinis de 41 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Chinameca, departamento de San Miguel, es madre soltera y vive junto a su familia y tres hijos de 15, 12, 8 años de edad, ellos dependen económicamente de Yinis y ella se dedica a la confección de ropa oficio que aprendió por su madre quien le enseño la sastrería, atiende su taller de lunes a domingo todo el día su mayor ventaja es que confecciona los uniformes de las escuelas cercanas. Yinis está solicitando un préstamo para la compra telas de diferentes marcas y colores así como las necesarias para confeccionar los uniformes escolares, este préstamo ayudara a fortalecer su taller ya que contara con el material necesario para realizar su trabajo.
Las proyecciones de Yinis son, obtener una nueva máquina para mejorar sus costuras, atender más clientes, ayudar a sus hijos para que se preparen con estudios superiores que les permita mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Yinis is 41 years old and lives in the municipality of Chinameca, located in the department of San Miguel. She is a single mother and lives with her family and three children who are 15, 12, and 8 years old and are economically dependent upon her.

Yinis works making clothing, a trade that she learned from her mother who taught her how to tailor. She works in her tailor’s shop all day Monday to Sunday, and her biggest advantage is that she makes the uniforms for schools nearby.

Yinis is requesting a loan for the purchase fabrics that are of different colors and brands, such as those needed to make the school uniforms. This loan will help her to strengthen her tailor’s shop since she already has the materials necessary to do her job. In the future she wants to get a new machine to improve her sewing, have more customers, and help her children prepare themselves with university studies so that they can improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Cosmos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “COSMOS” y está ubicado en Toluca Estado D. México, este grupo se integra D. 11 clientas; el nombre del grupo lo tomaron del equipo D. Fut-Bol, donD. las clientas se reúnen todos los fines D. semana en dicha comunidad. 
En este grupo se encuentra L. Sra. Rosa Amelia A. L., mejor conocida en el grupo como “Rosi” elL. era tesorera del grupo hace un tiempo, nos comenta que tiene cuatro hijos D. 7, 6, 2 y 3 meses D. edad, además  su esposo desD. hace dos años trabaja D. chofer en L. línea D. transporte que va D. L. terminal D. Toluca al Municipio D. Xonacatlan, L. señora ha ocupado el crédito para invertirlo en L. venta D. cosméticos con sus familiares y conocidas, el crédito le ha servido para tener una mejor calidad D. vida, a pesar D. haber estudiado solamente L. primaria, su fin es que sus hijos puedan algún día estudiar y ser  profesionistas y no dejar D. estudiar, ya que, es muy común en dicha zona.

   En este mismo grupo se encuentra L. señora Rosa María Vázquez G. quien se dedica igualmente a L. venta D. cosméticos, L. clienta tiene 4 hijos solamente uno depenD. D. elL. y su hija es L. señora Rosa Amelia Vázquez  G., el crédito que L. clienta ocupa es para surtir su negocio D. cosméticos, los cuales venD. con sus conocidas pero su mayor ganancia L. obtiene  en L. empresa donD. labora, con sus compañeras D. trabajo cuya empresa se denomina “Mundo Dulce”, su giro es L. producción D. dulces.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
PRESIDENTA: 
María Dolores C. S.

TESORERA:    
Mariana N. N.

INTEGRANTES: 
Rosa María Vázquez G.
Azucena Méndez S.
PrisciL. I. C.
Arisbel D. L. O. V.
Rosa Amelia A. V.
Edith A. V.
María S. S.
Leonor C. S.
Gloria P. G.
texts.en:
This group is called 'COSMOS' and is located in the Toluca state in Mexico. There are 11 members of the group; they took the name from a football team in their community where all the members meet each weekend. One of the members of this group is Señora Rosa Amelia A. L, better known in the group as 'Rosi'. She was the group's treasurer for some time. Rosi tells us that she has 4 children - 7, 6, 2, and 3 months old. Her husband has worked as a chauffeur for 2 years in a transport company, where he drives from the Toluca terminal to the municipality of Xonocatlan. Rosi will use this loan to invest in the sale of cosmetics to her family and acquaintances. These loans allow her to obtain a better quality of life. As she has only studied up to primary school, her goal is that her children can one day study and be professionals and not have to abandon their studies, which is very common in this zone. Another member of this group is Señora Rosa María Vázquez G, who also works selling cosmetics. She has 4 children, only one of whom depends on her, and her daughter is señora Rosa Amelia Vázquez G. She is seeking a loan to stock her business with cosmetics, which she sells to her acquaintances. Her major source of income is obtained in the company where she works, working with colleagues for a company called 'Mundo Dulce' (Sweet World), producing sweets. The other members of the group are: PRESIDENT: María Dolores C. S. TREASURER: Mariana N. N. INTEGRANTES: Rosa María Vázquez G. Azucena Méndez S. PrisciL. I. C. Arisbel D. L. O. V. Rosa Amelia A. V. Edith A. V. María S. S. Leonor C. S. Gloria P. G.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cosmetics to stock the business

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Rodolfo; el tiene 40 años de edad y es soltero; el socio estudia ingeniería electrónica en la universidad andina del Cusco desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, el socio quiere concluir su carrera profesional para trabajar en una empresa. El socio solicita el préstamo para construir su casa, comprara materiales como cemento y yeso.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rodolfo belongs to the Banco del Desarrollo communal bank, located in the Wanchaq district which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Rodolfo is 40 years old and single. He studies electronic engineering at the Universidad Andina del Cusco (Andean University of Cusco) from 7am to 1pm. He wants to finish his degree program so that he can work for a business. Rodolfo is requesting the loan to build his house – he will purchase materials such as cement and plaster.

He is grateful to everyone who is making this dream possible and promises to make his payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as cement and plaster to build his house.

loans.name: Jose Lorenzo

texts.es:
José tiene una tienda pequeña pero bien surtida de víveres, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.  

Inicio su negocio hace 10 años atrás con una vitrina y una percha. Debido a la demanda de los víveres el comenzó a comprar arroz y aceite, poco a poco con esfuerzo y algunos sacrificios, ahora trabaja en su propio negocio. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta el anochecer. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, enlatados, azucar etc. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando y agrandar mas su tienda.
texts.en:
José has a small but well-stocked grocery shop. He lives in a peri-urban zone in Paraíso de Guayaquil, a zone characterised by its dirt roads and mountains. He began his business 10 years ago with one glass case and a stand. Owing to the demand for his groceries he began to purchase rice and oil, and little by little with force and some sacrifice, he now owns and works in his own business. He works from 6am until night time. With this loan José wants to buy groceries such as rice, canned goods, sugar etc. In the future he wants to continue working and expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, canned goods, sugar

loans.name: New Jerusalem Group

texts.es: Josefina tiene 42 años, es casada, comerciante con nueve hijos, se dedica a la venta D. trastos en el Mercado D. Totonicapán, tiene veinticinco años D. contar con el negocio. Integrante y Presidenta del Banco Comunal, el cual es integrado por diez socias, quiene quierewn ampliar su capital D. trabajo para surtir sus productos. Se organizan con las vecinas a quienes conocen y confían, en el grupo se dedican a multiples actividades, que podemos mencionar, la Sastreria, Venta D. ropa típica, Panadería, etc. Lo que sueñan es incrementar el volume D. ventas y mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y la D. la familia D. cada integrante D. este grupo.
texts.en:
Josefina is 42 years old, she is married, and she has nine children. She is a vendor that sells kitchen ware in the market of Totonicapan. She has twenty five years experience in the business. She is a member and the leader of her community bank. The community bank is maD. up of ten members, each wishing to supplement their working capital and to add variety to the products they sell. They grouped together as neighbors that know each other and trust each other. The members of the group carry out various businesses, such as tailoring, sales of traditional clothing, bakery etc. Their dream is to increase their sales and to improve the living conditions for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina A. Báez tiene 47 años,  es soltera y tiene 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad.
Anteriormente Cristina era empleada de un local comerciante importante de la zona. Como en aquel entonces era muy poco lo que percibía como salario decidió independizarse y abrir su propio negocio. Fue así que habilitó un puestito de ventas de verduras y frutas en el mercado de la cuidad.
Gracias a sus ingresos de las ventas de frutas y verduras pudo lograr que sus hijos terminaran sus estudios secundarios.
En la actualidad quiere seguir ampliando su stock en mercaderías para así poder tener mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Crisitina A. B. is 47 years old and she is single and she is the mother of 4 grown children. Previously Cristina was an employee in a larger business in the region. But her salary was very meager and so she decided to go into business for herself. She set up a stand from where to sell vegetables and fruits in the city's market. Thanks to the profits she has earned selling fruits and vegetables she has managed to send her kids to school and to see them graduate high school. Currently she requests a loan to supplement her stock of merchandise, to have greater quantity of products to offer her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Heavenly Times Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Tiempos de cielo” se ha organizado para iniciar su sexto ciclo con crédito en el centro focal de Villa Exaltación. Integran esta asociación nueve personas, ocho mujeres y un varón. 

La señora Beatriz es la presidenta y como tal, tiene la responsabilidad de coordinar su trabajo con el de la tesorera y la secretaria de actas. 
El negocio de la señora presidenta se ha especializado en la venta de carteras y aceitunas, compra su mercadería de la localidad de Desaguadero y la ciudad de La Paz, para luego venderlo en la localidad de Llallagua. No tiene un día fijo para viajar, sin embargo, cuando lo hace se queda desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche. Generalmente viaja sola.
A la consulta sobre que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella responde la capacitación por que la orienta y el servicio de salud por que la atención es muy buena.

Los negocios dentro de la asociación son variados, entre ellos tenemos: venta de artefactos, puesto de fruta, venta de ropa interior, venta de ropa de bebé, venta de productos de belleza, macramé, venta de libros, venta de comida y venta de calzados.
texts.en:
The community bank named Heavenly Times is currently on its sixth loan cycle. It is located in the downtown core of Villa Exaltacion. There are nine members of this group, made up of eight women and one man. Beatriz is the leader of the group and she has the responsibility to coordinate her role as the treasurer and the record keeper. The business that she carries out is the sale of binders and olives. She purchases her merchandise in the Desaguadero district in the city of La Paz. She later resells the merchandise in Llallagua. She doesn't have any one specific day when she travels but when she does travel, she is gone from 8 in the morning and doesn't return until 8 at night. She usually travels alone. When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner) she said that she enjoys the orientation and the health services provided by them. Their attention is very good. The businesses that are run by members of this group are various, among them are: crafts sales, fruit stand, undergarment sales, sales of baby clothes, sales of beauty products, macramé crafts, book sales, catering, and shoe sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase binders and olives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sheets of crafters' foam, sewing supplies, shoes, paints, and clothing.

loans.name: Erika Marjori

texts.es:
Erika tiene 26 años, se dedica a la venta de Ropa también a la venta de hamburguesas y hot dog, ella reside en San Francisco Gotera, y vive con su esposo y sus hijos Marjori de 10 años, Cesar de 6, Luis de 4 y Axel de un año, no posee casa propia sino que renta una.
Ella desarrolla dos negocios en uno prepara Hamburguesas y Hot Dog y vende la ropa por las calles de la ciudad, dedicándose de esta manera desde hace vario tiempo para dar el sustento diario a sus hijos.
Erika necesita un préstamo para comprar ropa y abastecer su negocio, pues ella desea ofrecer diferentes colores y modas en las prendas de vestir, esta inversión la ayudara a incrementar sus ventas y a mejorar sus ingresos.
Su objetivo es mejorar la condición económica de su familia y poder algún día contar con una vivienda propia y digna para el desarrollo de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Erika is 26 years old and works selling clothing, and also sells hamburgers and hot dogs. She lives in San Francisco Gotera with her husband and children (Marjori – 10, Cesar – 6, Luis – 4, and Axel – 1). She does not have her own house so she rents one.

Erika has two businesses – she makes hamburgers and hot dogs in one, and sells clothing by foot on the streets of the city for the other. She has been working like this for quite some time to provide for her children. Erika needs a loan to purchase clothing and stock her business because she wants to offer clothing of different colors and styles. This investment will help her to increase her sales and to improve her income.

Erika’s goal is to improve her family’s economic situation and to someday be able to own a decent home for the development of her children.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza D. is a married woman who lives in Labogon, Bgry. 1, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: fish vending and food vending. Her husband, Lemuel, who is 42 years old, works as a carpenter and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are 8 to 19 years old. Liza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Liza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,500, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 14000, which she intends to use to as revolving capital for her fish-vending activities. She plans to continue to save for future home repairs and the education of her children. Liza D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund fish-vending business

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una señora D. 73 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y una hija D. 38 años D. edad, residen en el Transito D. San Miguel, se dedica a la venta D. tamales D. frijol y D. pollo, el negocio lo comenzó por iniciativa D. propia y tiene 15 años D. dedicase a este oficio junto a su esposo e hija.
Doña Ana esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. maíz, frijol, y todos los materiales que necesita para la elaboración D. tamales. Este préstamo el ayudara para producir más y generar estabilidad a su negocio a largo plazo, aumentando sus ventas y así mismo sus ingresos serian mayores.
Sus aspiraciones son poseer un negocio fuerte en la venta D. tamales para mejorar su condición D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a 73-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 38-year-old daughter in El Tránsito, a city in the department of San Miguel. She works selling bean and chicken tamales. She began the business herself and has been working at it for 15 years with her husband and daughter.

Ana is requesting a loan for the purchase of corn, beans, and all of the materials that she needs to make tamales. This loan will help her to make more and to bring stability to her business in the long term, increasing her sales as well as her income. Her aspiration is to have a strong business selling tamales to improve her living condition and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make tamales.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Miguel Angel; el tiene 33 años de edad y es soltero; el socio tiene un consultorio particular de la especialidad de Obstetricia, también se dedica al negocio de venta de calzados que trae de lugares como Trujillo, el socio quiere mejorar su negocio de venta de calzados. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar calzados al por mayor para mujer y varón.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Señor Miguel Angel is 33 years old, single and is a member of the communal bank "Banco del Desarrollo" (Development Bank).  The bank is located in the Wanchaq district in the province and department of Cusco.  

Señor Miguel Angel has a private practice specializing in Obstetrics.  He also sells footwear that he brings to places like Trujillo.  He would like to improve his footwear business.  He is requesting a loan to buy men's and women's footwear wholesale.  

He is grateful to everyone who will help make this dream come true and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase men's and women's footwear wholesale

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila, de 54 años de edad, está divorciada y tiene tres hijos en etapa escolar. Viven en el poblado de Triboline, ubicada en la selva tropical peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Desde hace 40 años,  Lucila se dedica a la actividad agrícola, específicamente a la producción y comercialización de frutas en general. Recuerda que en un inicio, cuando tuvo su primera parcela era como si cumpliera uno de sus objetivos, desde entonces al obtener su primera producción los llevo a vender en el mercado de su poblado y en las ferias de otras localidades. Ahora todo lo que produce lo lleva a la ciudad de Ayacucho, lugar donde percibe buenos ingresos económicos, además con estas ganancias puede pagar de mano de obra de sus peones. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, sin embargo en tiempo de cosecha necesita de sus peones con la finalidad de que puedan facilitar la extracción de sus productos. Su plan a futuro es construir su casa a base de material noble, con la necesidad de que pueda brindar seguridad y comodidad a su familia. Este es su decimotercer crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además está satisfecho con su banco comunal, debido a los buenos beneficios que se obtiene. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono, de esa forma podría cuidar sus plantaciones de frutas, como: mandarina, naranja, plátano, papaya, piña.
texts.en:
Lucila is 54 years old, divorced and has three school age children.  The live in the village of Triboline, located in the tropical Peruvian jungle, where she has her own house made of wood.  

For the past 40 years Lucila has worked in agriculture, specifically, the production and sale of fruits.  She remembers that in the beginning when she obtained her first plot of land it was as if she had reached one of her goals.  Ever since her first production she has taken her fruit to sell in her village market and at fairs in other locations.  Now, all that she produces she takes to the city of Ayacucho,  where she receives a good price.  With these earnings she can now pay for labor.  Generally, she works on her own, but occasionally her children help her. At harvest time, however, she needs her workers to help her pick the fruit.  

Her plan for the future is to build a house of solid materials so that her family is safer and more comfortable.  This is her thirteenth loan with MFP for which she guarantees that she will faithfully make her payments.  Also, she is pleased with her communal bank due to the good benefits she receives.  She plans to use this loan to buy supplies and fertilizer to care for the fruits she grows like tangerines, oranges, bananas, papayas and pineapples.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and supplies to care for the fruits she grows

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria V. is a 63-year old married woman who supports her family by selling fish and oysters in her community. She lives in Labugon, Brgy. 1, Ilog, in the southern part of Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard selling oysters and fish in her community and the surrounding areas, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10000. Gloria needs PHP 16000 to sustainably expand her oyster and fish vending activities. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. She previously borrowed PHP 14000 to fund her vending operations, and since paying it off, she now wants to add a little more to her revolving capital so that she can increase her income capacity. Gloria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. Gloria is shown in the accompanying picture with the raw oysters that she sells in her community. Her hometown is known to have some of the best-tasting oysters in the island of Negros.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund oyster and fish sales operations

loans.name: Vanesa Guisela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Srta. Vanesa Guisela; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella tiene una tienda de ropa en el centro comercial Cusco, ella vende ropa para damas dese las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como blusas, pantalones, chompas y casacas para mujeres.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the the community bank "Development Bank". The bank is located in the Wanchaq district of the province and department of Cusco.
The member is Vanesa; she is 25 years old and single. She combines her daily chores with running a business selling clothes. She has a clothes store in the commercial center of Cusco. She sells women's clothing from 9:00am until 8:00pm. She wants to improve and grow her business. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as blouses, pants, sweaters, and jackets for women.
She is grateful to the people who are part of this dream through this loan and promises to complete her repayments according to the established timeframe.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as blouses, pants, sweaters, and jackets for women

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, D. 55 años, está casada y tiene una hija, Karina D. 20 años. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en el poblado D. Triboline, donD. tiene su propia casa. Cuando tenía 10 años, le gustaba ayudar a sus padres en cualquier tarea que se le encomendaba, además le gustaba el campo y se identificaba con ello; pero nunca se imaginó que iba seguir los pasos D. sus padres. Hoy se dedica a la producción y comercialización D. cacao, negocio que le esta yendo muy bien, ya que cuenta con cantidad D. clientes, quienes le compran al por mayor sus productos. Por otro lado también posee una panadería, que poco a poco se esta estableciendo, por ello procura siempre D. mantenerlo abastecido D. productos. Su mayor anhelo es adquirir más terrenos agrícolas, en la que su esposo pueda dedicarse a esta actividad, mientras que Nancy, desea implementar con nuevas maquinarias su panadería, para que pueda salir adelante con este negocio. Este es su decimotercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma D. pagos, además está convencida D. que llegará muy lejos con su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra D. insumos y abono, para que pueda aplicar a sus plantaciones D. cacao.
texts.en:
Nancy, 55 years old, is married and has one daughter, Karina, who is 20 years old. They live together in the beautiful Ayacuchana rainforest, located in the village of Triboline, where Nancy has her own home. When she was 10 years old, she liked to help her parents with whatever work they had; she also liked the countrysiD. and identified with it, but she never imagined that she would follow in her parents' footsteps. Now, she works in the production and sales of cacao, a business which is going very well for her. She has a number of customers who purchase her products from her wholesale. In addition to this, she also has a bakery, which she is establishing little by little by trying to always keep it stocked with products. Her greatest longing is to acquire more farm land, which her husband can work, while Nancy (also) wants to install new appliances in her bakery so she can progress in this business. This is her thirteenth loan through Kiva partner MFP, for which she has promised to continue paying on a regular basis. She is also convinced that she will get far with her communal bank. With this loan that she is soliciting, she is thinking of investing in the purchase of supplies and fertilizer for her cacao plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags of fertilizer to use on her farmland

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy B. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Pateno, Brgy. Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fish-vending  business. Her husband, Jerry B., who is 40 years old, works as a fish vendor and driver. They have three children who are 14 to 17 years old. Mary Joy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mary Joy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her twelfth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 25000, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save for the future economic security of her family. Mary Joy B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund fish-selling operation

loans.name: Nuris Mercedes

texts.es:
Nuris Mercedes, en su actividad como estilista de belleza, ha logrado ampliar su oferta de servicios, asesorando a sus clientes y  comercializando productos de belleza y de peluquería que realzan la imagen y belleza femenina masculina e infantil. Ella es una mujer que vive  en Malambo con su cónyuge y sus  tres hijos de 20 a 25 años.
Desde hace 25 años cuando vivió en Santa Marta, aprendió todo lo relacionado con la belleza femenina y  por eso cuando se traslado a Barranquilla,  pensó inmediatamente, en crear una alternativa de ingresos, haciendo lo que a ella mas le gusta ;  así fue como hace 15 años inicio su negocio de realzar la imagen de belleza, comenzando con clientela de Soledad, Barranquilla y Malambo,  ofreciendo como productos a domicilio , el corte de cabello, tinturado, alicer y peinados, gradualmente sus clientes,  le pedían asesoría respecto a los productos que deberian usar para conservar el cabello hermoso,  tal como Nuris se los dejaba, y fue entonces que se le ocurrió la idea de venderle a su clientela,  productos de belleza logrando ingresos adicionales importantes y también ofreciendo el servicio de aplicación de los mismos. Gracias a sus esfuerzos en el negocio  y el de su esposo, hombre también muy trabajador,  han logrado educar a nivel profesional a sus hijos y ahora están bien empleados.
Este es el tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con su credikiva comprará productos de belleza como shampoo, desrisados, aliser, masajes y protectores de brillo; con las anteriores  financiaciones ha logrado incrementar sus ingresos, mejorar su vivienda  y sobre todo  incrementar sus oferta de servicios. Su sueño se enfoca en  el reacondicionamiento del local y mejoramiento de su vivienda;  su mayor desafío actualmente es la lluvia, porque le dificulta  el servicio a domicilio, porque  con los fuertes aguaceros que están ocurriendo diariamente, los arroyos se crecen,  paralizando toda la ciudad porque resulta peligroso salir de casa a responder a los clientes.
texts.en:
Nuris Mercedes is a beautician. She has increased the services she is able to offer, including assessing clients and selling beauty products and providing hair cuts to compliment the appearance of women, men and children. She is a woman that lives in Malambo with her three children aged 20 and 25 years old. When she was 25 years old and still living in Santa Maria she learned to provide beauty services to women, so when she moved to Barranquilla she immediately thought about setting a business to generate an income, a business doing something she enjoys. Fifteen years ago she set up her business selling beauty products, door to door, giving hair cuts, dying hair, hair styling for events et. Gradually her clients sought out her advice on the products they should be using to have healthy hair, keeping it the same way as when they left Nuris' shop. She started selling to her clientele beauty products, engaging another source of income. She continued to offer her beauty services. Thanks to the efforts she invested in her business and her husband's efforts, a very hard working person too, she has granted her children to have higher education. They are all enjoying careers now. This is the third loan accessed through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With her loan she will purchase beauty products such as shampoo, streaks, massage oils, conditioners etc. With previous loans invested she has seen improvement in her profits, and she has improved the quality of their house. She has also increased the services she is able to offer. Her dream is to remodel her beauty shop and carry out some home improvements. Her greatest challenge now is facing rainy days because it becomes difficult for her to provide her services at their clients' homes. The rains come in terrible storms that come almost daily. The rivers swell and the entire city is paralyzed because it is dangerous to go out of the home.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shampoos, conditioners, massage oils etc.

loans.name: Edwar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edwar; el tiene 30 años de edad y es soltero; el socio estudia la carrera profesional de informática y también tiene un negocio de bar que atiende desde las 7:00 p.m hasta las 2:00 a .m, el socio quiere mejorar su negocio y también quiere terminar de estudiar para que pueda abrir su negocio de computadoras. El socio solicita el préstamo para pagar las cuotas de una computadora 

 
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Edwar is a member of the community bank "Development Bank", located in the Wanchaq district in the province and department of Cusco.

Edwar is 30 years old and single.  He is studying for a professional career in computer science and also owns a bar, which he tends from 7:00pm until 2:00am.  He would like to improve his business, and also finish his studies so that he can open a computer business.  He is asking for a loan to pay for the costs of a computer.

He appreciates the people who are helping his dream come true, and he promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: The costs of a computer

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor de 42 años, tiene un taller de reparación para vehículos, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.  

Inicio trabajando como ayudante en un taller de reparación de carros pero por la falta de oportunidades el decidió implementar su negocio propio de automóviles ya que le gusto esta profesión. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido tener su clientela y tener dinero para mantener a su esposa, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm con un ayudante. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar lubricantes cemento y bloques para construir mejor el taller mecánico. En el futuro quiere tener un taller grande y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Victor is 42 years old and he has an auto repair shop. He lives in a suburban region in Paraiso de Guayaquil, a region known for its unpaved roads and its mountains. He started working as an assistant in a repair shop but he didn't get very many opportunities so he decided to set up his own repair shop business. He greatly enjoyed the profession. With a great deal of effort he has won himself a client base and he earns enough of an income to support his wife. He works from 8 a.m. until 7p.m. and he has an assistant. The loan that he requests will be used to purchase lube, cement and cement blocks to build a better repair shop. In the future he would like to have a larger shop to provide a better level of service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement and cement blocks.

loans.name: Source Of Living Water Group

texts.es: Santos Paulina es casada tiene seis hijos, con 37 años de edad, se dedica a la Tejeduría, (elaboración de Servilletas Típicos). Este negocio la ha ayudado a salir adelante y poder sufragar sus gastos familiares, cuenta con 15 años de experiencia. Por lo que quieren ampliar su capital para poder comprar materia prima en cantidad y poder incrementar las ventas. Ella y otras once señoras deciden lo mismo y se organizan para solicitar financiamiento en la Asociación ASDIR por medio del Banco Comunal "Fuente de Agua Viva". Esto ayudará a Paulina a seguir adelante y poco a poco ir logrando sus sueños que es lograr exportar su mercadería hacia el exterio de este país.
texts.en:
Santos Paulina is married and she has six children. She is 37 years of age and she sells crochet crafts as a business (traditional doilies). This business has helped her support herself and it has helped her cover the family's expenses. She has 15 years' experience. She would like to expand her working capital to be able to purchase materials in large quantities, to increase the amount of products she can create. She and eleven other women have organized themselves into a group named "Source of Living Water" and they have requested a loan from ASDIR (Kiva Field Partner). This will help Paulina to keep moving forward in the attainment of her goals. Her dream is to export her products to an international market.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rosa; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ferretería, ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, ella por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su ferretería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the community bank "Development Bank".  The bank is located in the Wanchaq district in the province and department of Cusco.

Carmen Rosa is 30 years old and is a single mother to one child.  She works at her hardware store from 8:00am until 7:00pm.  This business allows her to improve the life of her child, so she would like to expand the business.  She is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise for the hardware store.

She appreciates everyone who is a part of making her dream come true, and promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her hardware store

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia, de 43 años, está casada y tiene un hijo, Aldair de 12 años. Juntos residen en el poblado de Triboline, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa. Teodosia afirma que el negocio de abarrotes se ha convertido en estos últimos años en un gran  negocio, es por ello que se dedica a esta actividad. En un inicio se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero necesitaba de más ingresos, así que decidió emprender un nuevo negocio. Han pasado 26 años y hasta hoy tiene clientes que acuden siempre a su establecimiento, por lo que ella sola se queda atendiendo a su clientes, mientras su esposo con ayuda de un peón se dedica a cuidar de sus plantaciones. Su rutina laboral a es a partir de las 5:30 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche y su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su tienda, con la finalidad de que pueda implementar con más productos y que estén al alcance de la economía de sus clientes. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está contenta con su banco comunal, ya que todos se apoyan entre sí. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería, con el propósito de que pueda abastecer su tienda de abarrotes y no tenga ningún contratiempo con sus clientes.
texts.en: Teodosia, 43 years old, is married and has one son, Aldair, who is 12 years old. They live together in Triboline, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own house. Teodosia indicates that her grocery business has become a large business over the last few years, and for that reason she's very dedicated to this work. In the beginning, she worked in farming, but she needed a larger income, so she decided to start a new business. Twenty-six years have passed, and today she has customers that always come to her store, and for that reason she is always attending to customers while her husband, with the help of a laborer, takes care of their fields. Her work begins at 5:30am and goes until 9:00pm, and her plan for the future is to continue expanding her store, in order to carry more products and meet her customers' needs. This is her fourth loan through MFP, and she agrees to continue following her payment plan. She is also very happy with her communal bank, as they all support each other. With the funds she is requesting, she plans to invest in purchasing products, in order to stock her store with groceries and avoid mishaps with her customers.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of products to stock her store

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Edid, ella tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera; y tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 14 años de edad;  La socia se dedica a trabajar de empleada en un restaurante turístico de nombre Keros desde hace 5 años; La socia solicita el préstamo para apertura de un nuevo negocio propio,  La socia tiene como cábala no hacer público su proyecto del negocio propio hasta que salga el proyecto. La socia a ahorrado un capital para realizar este sueño y a esto le servirá de mucha ayuda  para aumentar a su capital final el crédito que ahora solicita. La socia solicita el préstamo para realizar un proyecto propio.

Los otros socios se dedican a la atención de una botica, artesanía, moto taxi,  docentes, venta de comidas, venta de desayunos, a la venta de abarrotes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Santo Domingo communal bank, located in Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco. 

The member is Mrs. Edid. She is 41 years old, a single mother, with 2 children, 14 and 16 years of age. She has been employed by the tourist restaurant Keros for the last 5 years. She is requesting a loan to open her own business. She believes it is good luck not to make her project public until it starts. She has saved some capital to realize this dream, and the funds she is requesting now will be very helpful to her in increasing this capital. This loan is for her own personal project.

The other members work in pharmacy, handicrafts, taxi service, teaching, food sales, breakfast food sales, and grocery sales. 

The member appreciates and values the loan received through this process, and also agrees to comply with the repayment plan.

loans.use: The member seeks a loan to start her own business

loans.name: The Rebels Group

texts.es:
“Rebeldes” es el nombre de la asociación comunal que está por iniciar su noveno ciclo en el centro focal Santiago II. Integran esta asociación diez y seis personas, quince mujeres y un varón. 

La señora Yola es la presidenta. Su negocio es la venta de “palos”.
Los mismos que pueden ser utilizados de diferentes formas, ya sea en la construcción como en la elaboración de algún mueble sencillo.
Aprendió este negocio de su esposo y lo lleva adelante desde hace siete años. Ella recuerda que su primer crédito fue de Bs.500 y lo utilizó para el arreglo de una máquina.  Ahora su crédito solicitado es por Bs.3000, ella espera que con este dinero pueda comprar una motosierra.

Los negocios dentro de la asociación son variados, entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, tienda,  puesto de fruta, venta de ropa interior, librería, panadería, confección de edredones, repostería, venta de comida y venta de DVD´s.
texts.en:
"The Rebels" is the name of the community bank and they are on their ninth loan cycle. They are located in the Santiago II region. There are sixteen members in this group, of whom fifteen are women and there is one man. Yola is the leader of the group and she sells wood. The type of wood that she sells can be used in a variety of ways. They can be used in construction of in the production of a simple piece of furniture. She learned this business from her husband and she has been running the same business for the past seven years. Her first loan was in the amount of Bs. 500 and she used it to repair a machine. The loan she requests now is in the amount of Bs. 3000 and with it she will purchase a chainsaw. The businesses carried out by the group are various, among them are: the sale of clothing, cosmetics, a general store, a fruit stand, undergarment sales, bookstore, bakery, apron sales, pastries, catering and DVD sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a chainsaw.

loans.name: The Reincarnates (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Renacientes  está formado por un grupo de 7 mujeres, son amigas y  muy buenas compañeras, trabajan en diferentes actividades  y  con un mismo fin de ayudar a la economía de sus hogares para así salir adelante y entregarles un mejor futuro a sus familias. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad está ubicada al  sur de Ecuador, es capital de la provincia del Azuay y está situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana. Su centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

La Señorita Mayra S. vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la fundación. Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de juguetes actividad que empezó hace 2 meses y tiene confianza de que le va ir muy bien, vende en una escuelita de la ciudad. También hace 7 meses cuentan con un puesto de comida en la parroquia de Ricaurte, donde vende una variedad de platos. 
La Señorita Mayra es muy joven, tiene 18 años, es soltera y tiene  una bebe de 4 meses de edad. Vive  con sus padres quienes son un gran apoyo para ella, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.  Su crédito lo va a invertir en su hija ya que necesita ropa.
 
Sus metas son  retomar sus estudios del colegio ya que los abandono cuando estaba en quinto curso y también desea superarse para entregarle a su hija un mejor futuro.

La Señorita. Lorena L. vive en la parroquia de Narancay Alto en la ciudad de Cuenca. Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en la fundación. Nuestra socia tiene de 26 años es soltera y tiene un hijo de 3 años y 3 meses de edad. Vive con sus padres y ayuda en la economía del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
La Señorita. Lorena  trabaja hace 7 meses en un camal de pollos en donde los pela, los lava etc., labora desde las 7 de la mañana hasta que termine con su trabajo y el resto del tiempo lo dedica a su hijo. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y vitaminas para su hijo.
 
Su meta es  llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The community bank named "The Reincarnates" is a group of 7 women. They are friends and very close colleagues. They each have different businesses but they have one goal in common, to contribute to their family's finances, to keep on progressing and to provide a better future for their families. They live in various locations throughout the city of Cuenca. The city is located near Cordillera along the equator. In 1999 Unesco named the city a World Heritage site. Mayra Simbana lives in the district of Miraflores in Cuenca. It is the second loan she requests. This member sells toys, a business she started two months ago but she is very confident of its success. She sells in a small school in the neighborhood. Seven months ago she also set up a food stand in the Ricuarte district, offering a variety of foods to her clients. Mayra is a very young woman. She is 18 years old, she is single and she has a 4-month old baby girl. She lives with her parents and they are a source of great support for her. They rent the place where they are living. The loan will be used to buy some clothes for her baby. Her goal is to go back to school. She stopped going when she was in her fifth semester but she wants to improve herself, to provide her daughter with a better future. Miss Lorena L. lives in the Narancay Alto district in the city of Cuenca. This is the third loan she requests. She is 26 years old, she is single and she has a 3 year old son. She lives with her parents and she contributes to the household economy. They rent the space where they live. Lorena has worked in a chicken farm for the past 7 months. There, she processes the chickens, plucking their feathers, washing etc. She works from 7 in the morning until she has completed the work she was assigned. The rest of the time she dedicates to caring for her son. The funds will be invested in the purchase of clothing and vitamins for her son. Her goal is to have her own home one day.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and vitamins.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 59 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cayaltí, sus hijos ya se encuentran disipados. La zona en donde vive es tranquila y apacible, la mayor parte de sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario a precios cómodos y con un buen trato. Esto le ha hecho conocida en la zona y actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles que prefieren su establecimiento. Con los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad se encarga de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que puedan ampliar sus ventas y percibir un mayor número de ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Rosa es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Santos is 69 years old and she lives together with her family in the district of Pacasmayo, it is located in a province by the same name. It is located in the region of La Libertad, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has worked for more than thirty years in the sale of plastic goods, selling from a store located in the exterior section of the small market in the city where she lives. She works every day from the very early morning hours. Thanks to the years she has had in this business she has a well established client base that always come to her business to purchase what they need. Santos wishes to expand her business by adding new merchandise to put on sale. She will be able to have a greater variety of products to offer the clients and her sales will increase. In order to meet her objective she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. She is a very reserved person and she is always ready to help anyone in need. She has worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past and she has always demonstrated responsibility in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grocery store items.

loans.name: Santos Yrene

texts.es:
Santos tiene 69 años D. edad y vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. Pacasmayo, perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombre y ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más D. dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. treinta años a la venta D. artículos D. plástico en un puesto ubicado en el exterior del mercadillo D. la ciudad donD. vive. Ella trabaja todos los dias desD. muy temprano y, gracias al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad, cuenta con un grupo D. clientes fieles que siempre acuden a su negocio cada vez que necesitan D. alguno D. los articulos que venD..

Santos desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas mercadería para ofrecerla en venta. D. este modo podrá contar con mas productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y sus ventas aumentarán. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer tranquila y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar a los que le necesitan. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Santos is 69 years old and she lives together with her family in the district of Pacasmayo, it is located in a province by the same name. It is located in the region of La Libertad, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has worked for more than thirty years in the sale of plastic goods, selling from a store located in the exterior section of the small market in the city where she lives. She works every day from the very early morning hours. Thanks to the years she has had in this business she has a well established client base that always come to her business to purchase what they need. Santos wishes to expand her business by adding new merchandise to put on sale. She will be able to have a greater variety of products to offer the clients and her sales will increase. In order to meet her objective she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. She is a very reserved person and she is always ready to help anyone in need. She has worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past and she has always demonstrated responsibility in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase plastic goods for resale in the market.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer - Huasao Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito D. Oropesa – Huasao, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

El socio es el Sr.  Edgar, el socio es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo y el socio se dedica al comercio, el tiene una ferretería y también trabaja en obras D. construcción civil; El socio es una persona muy trabajador y sumamente disciplinado, el socio requiere el préstamo para equipar su ferretería y así tener mejor ingreso económico. El socio solicita el préstamo para equipar su ferretería y comprar herramientas D. este modo diversificar su negocio.

Los otros socios se dedican a la crianza D. animales menores y la venta; agricultura, administración D. tienda abarrotes, venta D. cosméticos por catálogos, artesanía, venta D. comida rápida. El socio Juan Carlos tiene a su esposa en representación D. él, porque el trabaja en Cusco y dejo los papeles firmados para su su esposa recogiera el dinero.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member (described here) is part of the New Dawning communal bank. The communal bank is located in the Oropresa - Huasao district, part of the Cusco province and department. The member is Mr. Edgar, the member is married, has one son, and the member works in sales. He has a hardware store and also works civil construction jobs. The member is a very hardworking person and extremely disciplined. The member needs the loan to supply his hardware store and thus have better income. The member is requesting the loan to supply his hardware store and buy tools, thus diversifying his business. The other members raise young animals, work in sales, work in agriculture, run a grocery store, sell cosmetics by catalog, work in arts and crafts, and sell fast food. The member is grateful and values the loan granted through this medium and so promises to complete the payments in the set period.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock his hardware store

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia G., from the village of Kahayagan West, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, is 43 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Herminia has been planting and harvesting flowers for sale for over four years, earning approximately 4,300 PHP a month.

In 2007, Herminia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise, she is now requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Herminia's fifth loan from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Los Arbolitos (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En las Acacias en la vía a Santa Ana en la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida por su gente honesta y trabajadora, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Los Arbolitos.
Ellas se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como, (comercio, ventas, producción y  servicios,) este es el tercer ciclo en el banco y están muy a gusto ya que gracias a la Fundación Espoir han logrado sacar sus negocios adelante.
