Aquí conocimos a la señora Aracely, tiene 29 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 16 años de la cual tiene 4 hijos, dos de los cuales estudian en colegio y dos en escuela lo que representa una dura carga económica, su marido es maestro pintor.
 
Ella para ayudar a su marido en los gastos del hogar decidió empezar un negocio de ventas de sabanas y productos de Esika (productos de belleza y perfumería), trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8h30 hasta las 11h30 y de 14h00 a 16h00,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende bajo pedido más que todo en los productos de Esika que se los realiza de acuerdo a lo que sus clientes le pidan, las sabanas las va a comprar  una vez al mes a Guayaquil aunque  a veces también hace pedidos por docenas que se los entregan en su casa.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar sabanas ya que tiene algunos pedidos y quiere cumplir con todos ellos.

Sus sueños son construir su casa ya que donde viven es alquilado.
texts.en:
In the Acacias, on the road to Santa Ana, in the city of Portoviejo, which is known for its honest and hardworking people, the Saplings Community Bank meets every 15 days.  

The women dedicate themselves to different activities, such as business, sales, production, and services.  This is the third loan cycle for the bank and they are very happy and thankful to the Espoir Foundation that they have succeeded in improving their businesses.

Aracely is 29 years old and has been married for 16 years.  She has four children.  Two of them are in high school, and two in lower school, which is difficult economically.  Her husband is a master painter.

In order to help her husband with household expenses, she decided to start a business selling sheets and Esika cosmetics.  She works from Monday to Saturday from 8:30am to 11:30am and from 2:00pm to 4:00pm.  She sells door to door and by request, mostly for Esika products, because she has to order what her customers want.  She buys sheets once a month in Guayaquil, but sometimes orders them by the dozen.

She will use this loan to purchase sheets since she already has some orders placed and wants to be able to fill all of them.

Her dream is to build a house, because where she lives now is rented.

loans.use: Purchase sheets

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy G. is a 45-year old married woman who supports her family by selling fresh and dried fish. She lives in Sitio Pateno, Brgy. Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. As a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish-vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. With the help of her loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she now earns an average monthly income of PHP 33000. Nancy is now borrowing PHP 29500 so that she can purchase more stock to sell in her business. This will be her twenty-first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Nancy aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for fish-selling business

loans.name: Florelita

texts.en:
Florelita C., 58, is a married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: fishing/fish vending and pig fattening. She lives in Brgy. Pasil, Santander, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing/fish-vending and pig-fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20000. Florelita is borrowing PHP 15000 to  purchase more  fishing gear and materials to use in her fishing activities. This will be her eleventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14000, which she paid off well within its term, was another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Florelita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear and materials

loans.name: 08.03.01 Dong Ve Group

texts.en:
Minh N. T. (1) is a 61-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Minh is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 08.03.01 Dong Ve (08.03.01 Dong Ve).


Minh is married and has no children.  To make a living, Minh works in a family member's business making and selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  Minh has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Minh is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is requesting a loan of 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Minh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. T. Nga (2) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


2.  B. T. Hang (3) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Minh N. T. (1) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố thanh hoa.  Minh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 08.03.01 Dong Ve (08.03.01 Dong Ve).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán thức ăn nhanh & những loại thực phẩm cao cấp khác trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Minh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Minh kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Minh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Minh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. T. Nga (2) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  B. T. Hang (3) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Segundo Julio

texts.es:
Segundo es un padre de familia de 69 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de San José, una zona agrícola perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad. Ubicada a mas de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la crianza y venta de animales menores, el cría patos, gallinas, cerdos cuyes y conejos en unos corrales situados en la parte posterior se su domicilio, alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Esta actividad es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia por lo que siempre se esfuerza para mantenerla.

Segundo desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas animales para criarlos y venderlos, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.

Segundo es una persona entregada a su trabajo y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y responsable.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 69 year old father who lives with his wife in the San José district, an agricultural area in the Pacasmayo province, in the La Libertad region. It is located more than two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. For more than five years he has raised and sold small animals, he raises ducks, chickens, pigs, guinea pigs and rabbits in some pens situated at the back of his home, feeding them grain and natural fodder. When they have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to the business owners who always visit the area where he lives. This business is an important source of income for the economic well being of his family therefore he always works hard to maintain it. Segundo wants to grow his business buying more animals to raise and sell, as he does not have sufficient capital to realize this he has seen the need to request from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 600 nuevos soles for the first time. Segundo is a person who is devoted to his work and who always gives his best to get his family ahead. People who know him consider him to be a calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals to raise and sell to increase business.

loans.name: 08.03.02 Dong Ve Group

texts.en:
Lan N. T. (4) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Lan is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 08.03.02 Dong Ve (08.03.02 Dong Ve).


Lan is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, Lan owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Lan has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lan is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women for 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby pigs to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by Lan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Hanh (5) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  N. T. Hue (6) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  T. T. Lan  (7) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lan N. T. (4) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Lan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.Kieu Dai II . Dong Ve (08.03.02 Dong Ve).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Lan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lan kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Lan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Hanh (5) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. T. Hue (6) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  T. T. Lan  (7) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Mrs. Bernadita A. is 45 years of age, married to Epenito, a driver, and is blessed with five children, two of whom are now adults while the other three are still in school. She is from the barangay of Pisaan within Bonifacio municipality, a part of Misamis Occidental region on the island of Mindanao. Bernadita raises pigs for butchering. She also receives support from her husband as a driver. She’s been in this business for almost a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009 Bernadita joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP program, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities. Bernadita successfully repaid a loan amount of 7,000 PHP. She is now requesting a loan, her third from PMPC, of 14,000 PHP to be used for additional capital to buy and sell pigs for butchering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family, in particular to meet their basic needs, to save for the future, for loan repayments and for her children’s education, insurance and possible expansion of her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for her butchering business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia M. is 43 years of age, married to Vicente M., a carpenter, and is blessed with five children of whom three are now working while the other two are in school. Alicia is from the barangay of Cabunga-an within the municipality of Clarin, a part of Misamis Occidental on the Mindanao islands. Alicia runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She also receives support from her husband’s carpentry. She’s been in business for five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

Just this year Alicia joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is a newly-recognized member of PMPC under the PDP-LP program, a microfinance program that reaches out to the rural communities. Alicia is now requesting a loan amount of 3,000 PHP to be used for additional capital for her sari-sari store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of their family, in particular meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, and for loan repayments, her children’s education, insurance and possible expansion of her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Mrs. Raquel B. is 36 years of age, married to Rene, an overseas filipino worker (OFW), and is blessed with three children who are all school aged. She is from the barangay of D. Fernan within the municipality of Bonifacio, a part of Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Raquel runs a sari-sari store. She also receives money regularly from her husband. She’s been in business for twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009 Raquel joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP program, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities. Raquel successfully repaid a loan of 10,000 PHP. She is now requesting a loan, her third from PMPC, of 14,000 PHP in additional capital for her sari-sari store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family, in particular to meet its basic needs, save for future use, and for loan repayments, her children’s education, insurance and possible expansion of her business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Mrs. Evangeline G., from the Barangay of Bitoon, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is 39 years of age, married, and blessed with two children, both of whom are students. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari store business and is also receiving support from her husband as a farmer. Engaged in her business for five years already, Evangeline earns approximately Php3,000.00 a month.

In 2005, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. An active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out the rural communities, she has repaid her previous loan amount of Php5,000.00 and is now requesting her seventh loan in the amount of Php10,000.00 to be used as additional capital for her store.

Evangeline plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, save for future use, make loan repayments, and pay for the children’s education, insurance and possible business expansion.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa S., from the village of Dapaon, is a 57-year-old widowed mother of four adult-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling baked goods in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 18,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Elsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC that she used to provide financially for her son going to another country to work, Elsa is requesting her fifth loan of 35000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

The official name of this borrowing group is 03-Đông Vệ.
 
Loan is married and has two adult-aged children. To earn a living, Loan provides repair services to local community members. Loan has been engaged in this business for more than a decade, and she earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.
 
This year, Loan joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in order to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Loan is requesting her first loan from the organization, requesting 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Loan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To expand her repair-service business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita P. lives in Brgy. Gawi, Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living through her food vending  business. Her husband, Richard P., age 51, works as a taxi driver to earn his living. They have two children between the ages of 15 and 25.
 
Anita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired toward something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Anita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,500, thus improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her tenth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to purchase raw materials for her food vending business. Her goal is to continue to save up for the future, specifically toward children's education and her family's needs. Anita P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon, a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable." Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her food vending business.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila S. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old. Teofila is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Teofila owns & operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling coconuts in the local community. Teofila has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Teofila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Teofila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. Teofila is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Teofila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Alma's Group

texts.en:
Alma D., age 26, is from the village of Salimpuno. She is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Alma is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Alma plants, harvests, and sells assorted crops. Alma has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer for the farm. Alma is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to invest in cassava plantation. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Alma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
Debbie Y., age 51, is from the village of Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga. She and her husband have two adult-aged children. To make a living, Debbie owns and operates a grocery store, where she sells household items such as canned goods and other daily basic needs in the local community. Debbie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Debbie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Debbie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda  D. C. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Bagacay, Sibonga, Cebu. She earns her living through her sari-sari (general) store  business.  Her husband Lito D. C., who is 33 years old, works as a conductor for the bus company to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 3 and 10 years old. Three of the children currently go to school. 

Brenda  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Brenda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save for the future and for her children's education. Brenda D. C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo F. is from the village of Caraniogan. He is 47 years old. Edgardo is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Edgardo owns and operates a business venture in the transportation sector, providing motorcycle transport services. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Edgardo has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Edgardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edgardo is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair the vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edgardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Mrs. Isabel B. is from the barangay (neighborhood or district) of Remedios, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years of age and a widow. She was blessed with three children and all of them are already adults. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is also receiving support from her children in terms of her other needs. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for 20 years already and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from this business activity. In the year 2009, Isabel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabel is an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out to the rural communities. She has successfully repaid a loan amount of 7,000 PHP. She is now requesting a loan amount of 10,000 PHP as her third loan to be used for additional capital for her existing sari-sari store business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for a future use, loan repayments, house repairs and maintenance, insurance and possible business expansions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married. She runs a small store selling food. Olena has been in this business for two years. She started selling just fresh and salted fish. High demand and hard work allowed Olena to develop this business fast and open a second location. Today, this is a family business that gives a stable income.

Olena is requesting a loan of 8,478 Grivnas to purchase inventory for the recently opened second location. Olena hopes to make enough income to purchase one more refrigerator to store fish.

loans.use: To increase inventory

Janeth has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and has grown children. She is a small market entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. Irina sells women’s clothing merchandise in one of the local markets. Irina rents a small facility that serves as a vending outlet. 

She admits that she started this business because it was the only way to survive when her family was going through some challenging financial times. Irina has been in this business for eight years. Irina enjoys her business and has a long-term view of her venture development and is disciplined with all her business plans. 

Irina has used micro-loans in the past and found them very helpful for her business. This time Irina is requesting a 15,000 Grivnya loan to increase the selection of clothing items.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing items

loans.name: Winnyrose

texts.en:
Winnyrose is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. She has been farming for the last five years. Her main product is milk, which she sells locally. She also earns income from her small-scale farming of tea and a bodaboda (motorbike transport) business.

Winnyrose is 24 years old. She is married and has been blessed with three children, ages 9, 7 and 2. Two of the children attend school.

Winnyrose has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo after successfully completing her second loan. She has requested this loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a dairy cow. She says that with this loan she will be able to purchase a quality dairy cow that will increase her milk production and earn her more income. She does, however, face the challenges of an unreliable market for her milk and a lack of artificial-insemination services. In the future, she would like to buy a pure breed of dairy cow and land to plant enough dairy feeds.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with no children yet. He owns a retail business and sells baby carriages, toys and accessories. Alexander started this business eight years ago. At that time there was no competition at the store where he rented his business space. Even today, there still is none! The business goes well and many young couples come to his store to buy a baby carriage.

Alexander enjoys his business and wants to develop it further. He would like to borrow 7,500 Grivnas to purchase more carriages to sell. Alexander wants to develop his business further and make it a stable source of income for his young family.

loans.use: To increase his assortment of products

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica C. is a 52-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling fresh and dried fish. She lives in Sitio Pateno, Brgy. Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business activities, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Veronica is now borrowing PHP 27,000 to purchase more fresh and dried fish to sell. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Veronica aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Кодиров Исмоил проживает в районе Бохтар. Возраст, 33 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей на центральном рынке района. У него собственная торговая точка, где он продает парфюмерию. Имеет богатый опыт в этой сфере. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:

He has his own vendor spot where he sells cosmetic products. He has a good experience in this field. He is taking out the loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret N. is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has six children. All of her children are currently in school. Margret has a business in African arts and crafts, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more materials for arts and crafts. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and to pay school fees. In the future, Margret hopes to see her children complete university.

loans.use: To buy more materials for arts and crafts

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou B. is from the village of Letican, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Marylou is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marylou owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marylou is just starting this business.

In 2010, Marylou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marylou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marylou is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marylou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Lebina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and assures their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. loans.name: Vigen

texts.en:
Vigen K. is from the village of Aghin in the Shirak region of Armenia. He is married with a 6-year-old daughter and a 1-year-old son.  

Vigen has a high school education and for the past 15 years, he has been in the vegetable-growing and pig-breeding business. At this time of the year, animal feeds and additional livestock are less expensive. Therefore, Vigen has chosen to take a loan at this time to grow his business. He has chosen microfinance as the services are well organized without complications.  

With the loan, Vigen is going to purchase feed and additional livestock. He is expecting his family income to increase by up to 20 percent with this investment. His dream for the future is to save enough money for his children to attend university. He enjoys the village life and being a farmer.

loans.use: Feed and livestock

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Aisha has a business in cosmetics, which she has had for 10 years.  She also has rental houses and a tailoring shop.   

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase and stock more oil for hair treatments and weaves for ladies.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Aisha hopes to develop all her businesses.

loans.use: To stock more oil for hair treatments and weaves for ladies

loans.name: Bettielyne

texts.en:
Bettielyne R. is from the village of Naasag, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Bettielyne is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Bettielyne owns & operates a bakeshop, baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. Bettielyne is just starting this business.

In 2008, Bettielyne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Bettielyne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Bettielyne is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Bettielyne from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Tanveer's Group

texts.en:
Tanveer is a resident of Lahore, which is the second largest city of Pakistan and is famous for its history and culture. She is 40 years old and the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her eldest daughter is in 10th standard and the youngest daughter is in 6th. Her elder son is in 9th and younger one is in 5th standard. 

Tanveer is a very hardworking lady. She supports her family by selling clothes to her neighbors and to different clothing shops as well. She buys clothes from different cities like Faisalabad and Multan at cheap rates and sells for a good profit.  
 
Her husband has an electronics shop in the market. He sells different electronic items such as irons and sandwich makers to earn a living for his family. He has been doing this work for over six years.
  
Tanveer has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy the electronic items and sell them through his shop to his customers. 

Tanveer is hopeful that her husband will make good use of the loan amount and successfully be able to improve his business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her fourth loan cycle. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and has never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Tanveer.

loans.use: To buy electronic items for reselling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more crates of soda and beer

loans.name: Ashurmah

texts.ru: Камолова Ашурмах проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж, занимается народной медициной и лечит людей. Сама Ашурмах не имеет высшего образования. Более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Она в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Ashurmah K. lives in the Khuroson district. She is 48 years old, married and has 4 children. Her husband is involved in holistic medicine and provides medical service to people. Ashurmah does not have a higher education. She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years. She primarily breeds livestock for future resale. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock in order to increase its quantity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Albie

texts.en:
Albie A. is from the village of Looc, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Albie is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Albie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Albie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Albie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Albie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Albie is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Albie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran M. lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Hovouny. He is a trained veterinarian but due to the limited salaries and employment opportunities for veterinarians, he has chosen the life of a farmer.  He is the proud father of three children: a 23-year-old daughter and two sons, who are 9 and 21 years old.  

Both Tigran and his wife have been working on the family farm for the past 17 years. He is looking for a loan to purchase wheat seeds and fuel and to rent a tractor to harvest wheat and his potato crop.  

With this investment, he is expecting his family income to increase by 20 percent. He considers himself a hard-working, disciplined farmer. His hopes and dreams include growing his business for his children and also supporting them to obtain college degrees.  

Trigan was born in Hovouny and enjoys living near his friends and family.

loans.use: Wheat seeds, fuel

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya is a resident of Lahore, which is the second largest city of Pakistan. She is 38 years old and a mother of two daughters. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family in an area called Mughalpura. Suraiya operates a business selling bed sheets. She has a good number of clients from her community and outside of the community as well. She makes a good income every month by selling them bed sheets. 

Her husband is a milkman by trade. He gets milk from his own buffalo and sells the milk to the milk shops. Presently he has a buffalo that gives him almost 6-8kg milk every day and he sells 1kg milk for 45 PKRs. This has become the standard amount in the cities. In this way, he earns approximately 360 PKRs everyday, which helps him run the finances of his house. 

Suraiya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo, which will increase the milk production and his sales as well. Suraiya is hopeful that by purchasing another buffalo, her husband will be able to successfully upgrade his business and his income will be increased. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is on her second loan. In the previous loan year, she has proved herself a responsible person who has paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Suraiya.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk-selling business

loans.name: Doe

texts.en:
Deo Ssemppuga is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda.  He is married and has seven children. Five of his children are currently in school. Deo has a business in food production, which he has had for five years.         

To help expand his business, Deo has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fertilizers, fungicides and insecticides for the crops. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Deo hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Deo hopes to buy a grinder.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides, fungicides

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita B. is from the village of Poblacion, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Chita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Chita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Chita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Chita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Chita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Chita is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Chita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en:
Sobia is a resident of Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She is 32 years old and works in a medical dispensary on a monthly wage. Her husband operates a scrap shop in the market. Sobia has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Two of them are getting their education. 

Sobia and her family live in a small two-room house in the area called Mughalpura. Sobia and her husband work hard to meet the financial and educational expenses of their kids and they wish to enroll their other kids in school as well. Her husband has five years of experience in the scrap business. He deals with wood & iron. He buys items at cheap rates and sells them to factories at a good profit. 
 
Sobia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy scrap and increase his sales. Sobia is a regular loan user of Asasah and is on her second loan. In the previous loan year, she proved herself a responsible person who paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Sobia.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

texts.en:

To make a living, Emelita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

Emelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy F. is a married woman who lives in Rizal Street, South Poblacio, Naga City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a food vending business, a sari-sari (general) store and an electronic-reloading business. Her husband Sotero F., who is 40 years old, works as an electrician to earn his living. They have five children who are 8 months to 15 years old. 

Analy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Analy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 75,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital to buy stock to sell to continue to save for her children's education and improve their standard of living. Analy F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Xasay

texts.ru:
Xasay A. 37 let. On jenat  i imeyet 2 detey, sin 14 let uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya sportom, i sin 10 let toje uchitsya v shkole  i zanimayetsya tancami. Xasay i yeqo semya jivut v Absheron regione.

7 let tomu nazad Xasay nachal zanimatsya etim biznesom taksista. Etomu biznessu on  nauchilsya u svoyeqo dedushki kotoriy bil shoferom , on nauchil Xasaya kak pravelno doljen vesti sebya shofer. Seychas Xasay nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya mashini.
texts.en:
Xasay A. is 37 years old. He is married with two children. Both of his sons go to school The 14-year old son is good at sports. The 10-year old son is enrolled in a dance course. Xasay and his family live in the Absheron region. Seven years ago Xasay started working as a taxi driver. He learned all about this trade from his grandfather, who was also a taxi driver. At the moment Xasay needs 2000 AZN in otder to buy spare parts for his taxi.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase car parts

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 37-year-old married man.  He is a hardworking man who sells clothes to earn a living.  Having been in the business for four years, he hopes to open several boutiques in the future.  Samuel is a member of Faulu Kenya in Rukaka group.  He had previously serviced two loans through the group.  His living standards have improved since he joined the Faulu Kenya.  He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy trousers, shirts and other types of clothes.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts and other types of clothes

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz has lived in Lahore in a two-room brick house with her family for the last 10 years. Lahore is the second largest city in Pakistan. A very talented Shahnaz owns & operates her embroidery business at her home. She makes embroidered dresses for her neighboring clients. Earlier, she made embroidery dresses for her relatives but now she is receiving orders from her neighbors as well. She is good at her art and knows many embroidery techniques. She crafts beautiful embroidery designs on clothes, which are admired by her customers and this gives her encouragement to work with more dedication and enthusiasm. She earns a good profit by completing orders. The earnings allow her to pay for the household utilities. Her husband appreciates her for her helping and caring nature towards the family.  

She is the mother of six children. All of them are illiterate and couldn’t get an education due to financial constraints. Her husband is a government employee and her eldest son has an embroidery shop in the market where he embroiders dresses and contributes financially to his family. He started learning this art from his mother at an early age. 
 
Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, her son will buy embroidery items such as beads, colored thread and clothes in bulk, which will enable him to make more embroidered dresses to display in his shop to attract customers. Shahnaz is hopeful that, by investing the loan money in her son’s business, her son will be able to expand his business and increase his income as well. This is her first loan and she hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family.  

Note: In the photo, the lady who is slightly raising her hand is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items for her son's embroidery business

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy S. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. He is 33 years old. Jimmy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jimmy owns & operates a manufacturing business. He has been manufacturing & selling glass and iron works, like window grills and glass cabinets, to local businesses and community members for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jimmy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jimmy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials to manufacture additional products. Jimmy is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand the product offerings. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jimmy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 35 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 16 and 10.  She runs Romu Investment where she provides transport services.  This is her tenth year in the business and she has employed one person.  She also has flats that she rents out to increase her income.  

Faulu Kenya has helped her to upgrade her skills on business record keeping.  She has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy sand and vehicle tires.  She hopes to build more flats in the future.

loans.use: To buy sand and vehicle tires

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia  A. is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating her pig fattening and weaving businesses. She lives in Barangay Bog-ot, Argao, Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $185. 

Cresencia is now borrowing 12,000 PHP so that she can purchase pig feed and vitamins.  This will be her 12th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Cresencia hopes to raise her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of pig feed and vitamins

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia M. is from the village of San Isidro. She is 48 years old, married, and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, she operates a furniture making business, making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over nineteen years and earns approximately $206 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Simplicia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. 

Simplicia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Jane Pearl

texts.en:
When Jane Pearl, who is single, became a member of Kiva's field partner, Ahon Sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she found that she not only received capital from them, but also her second family in her group mates. That is why she enjoys being a part of it.

This, her 4th loan, will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store. She will buy different groceries and many other items that are needed for her business. Sari-sari stores basically sell small quantities of various foodstuffs, grocery items and beverages. Such stores are convenient for people in the village who live far from the market place.

Jane Pearl’s business has been very helpful in achieving her family's dreams. Her greatest hope is that her family will be able to have a good life, as it currently lives in poverty. Her long term goals are to invest and build a better house for the family and to have a full-fledged mini-grocery store.

loans.use: To buy different groceries and many items that are needed for her store

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia G. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Casay, Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living through her general store and pig fattening businesses. Her husband, Simplicio G., is 61 years old. They have seven children who are between 19 and 32 years old. 

Aurelia  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Aurelia  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $210, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 8th cycle loan, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital to buy stock for the store and vitamins for the pigs, so that she can continue to save up for the future and improve her businesses. Aurelia G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

To make a living, Mary Jean owns & operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling gasoline, by the liter, in the local community. Mary Jean has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2002, Mary Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional gasoline to sell. Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Mary Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Ashi's Group

texts.en:
Ashi lives in a city called Lahore, which is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. 

She is 23 years old and married with three children. Her husband's name is F. M.  and he is a private entrepreneur operating a clothes-selling business. Her older son has started attending school and is in kindergarten. The other kids are still too young to attend school.  

Ashi is a very caring lady. She prefers to spend her time at home taking care of her house and family. She has a set routine of getting up early in the morning, preparing breakfast for the family and getting her son ready for school. 
 
Her husband buys clothes from the famous markets of Lahore, named Ichra and Anarkali, and sells them to different other markets and in the community for a good profit. He has been doing this business for over six years. 

Ashi has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount her husband will buy clothes in bulk quantities and increase his selling. Ashi is hopeful that her husband will be able to make good income by utilizing the loan money in a positive way. She is a new loan applicant and is hopeful that it will be a profitable experience for her family. 

Note: In the photo, the group member Parveen is showing her sewing business by working on a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy clothes for reselling

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man with two children who are in school.  He makes soap dishes, necklaces, bangles, earrings, spoons and dishes. He is able to make these products because he is talented artistically.  He has been in the business for two years and he has five employees. 

Previously, he was farming to earn his daily bread.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money.  He hopes to buy a piece of land in the future, and he dreams of owning a big curio shop some day.  He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to add to his stock of raw materials for making curios.

loans.use: To add to his stock of raw materials for making curios

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 25 years old, married, and blessed with one child.  He has been practicing dairy farming for the past four years.  In his business, he has one employee.  He is a lucky farmer because he has a ready market for his products.  George also works as a driver to earn extra income.  

He is a member of the Ikinu Star One group, registered under Faulu Kenya, whose members guarantee each others' loans.  He says that he has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he had previously managed to buy a cow.  He has requested for 50,000 KES to buy another cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila E. is a married woman who lives in Jingjong Village, Brgy Alimango, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating oyster culture and fish vending businesses. Her husband Jesus E., who is 50 years old, works as a businessman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children who are 14 to 28 years old. 

Cirila joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cirila has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 13000, which she intends to add to her capital to purchase a fishing boat and to fund her oyster culture activities so that she can continue to save up for future, for family and business. 

The accompanying picture shows Cirila on the beach pointing to her oyster culture site. Cirila E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard J. is 42 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda.  He is married and has 2 children.  None of his children are currently in school.  Richard has a bar business, which he has had for less than one year.  He also has rental houses and a taxi for income.

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more sodas and beers.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Richard hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Richard hopes to construct more rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda and beer

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela S. is a 59-year-old married woman who supports her family through food vending, farming and sari-sari (general store) businesses. She lives in Brgy. Balisong, Argao, Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending, farming and sari-sari store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. 

She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6000. Marcela is now borrowing PHP 20000 so that she can have additional capital. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marcela aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Abashyirahamwe No 10 Group

texts.fr:
Pierre Bungura, née à Ruhuha l’Est du Rwanda, il a 43 ans, il est marié et il a 8 enfants, son ainé a 19 ans et son cadet a 1 ans, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Elle vit avec sa famille à Ruhuha Bugesera. 5 enfants vont à l’école.
Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé ABASHYIRAHAMWE NO 10 cultivateurs de riz,  qui est un groupe dont les membres sont  agriculteurs de riz et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Pierre et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie et en payant les minervals pour leurs enfants. Le groupe a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les engrais chimique pour félitiliser leur champ. Quand le groupe récolte, une partie de la récolte est vendue et une autre est utilisée pour les familles.
texts.en:
Pierre Bungura was born in Ruhuha, in eastern Rwanda. He is 43 years old, married and has 8 children. The eldest is 19 years old and the youngest is 1. Pierre has completed primary school. He lives with his family in Ruhuha Bugesera. 5 of his children go to school.
He belongs to Abashyirahamwe No 10, a solidarity group of rice growers who guarantee each other’s loans. Pierre and his group work to support their families, to improve their quality of life and to pay their children’s tuition fees.
The group has taken out a loan from Amasezerano Community Banking to buy chemical fertilisers for their fields. When the group harvests their crops, a part is sold and the rest is used for their families.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilisers

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Сафаров Саид проживает в городе Сарбанд. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. У него имеется столовая, где он работает вместе с семьей. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 8 лет. Кроме того клиент хочет открыть продуктовый магазин рядом со столовой. Кредит берет для расширения сферы деятельности, то есть хочет закупить товар для магазина.
texts.en:
Said S. lives in the city of Sarband. He is 50 years old, married and the father of three. He completed middle education. He has a stall, where he works together with his family. He has been involved in this type of business for eight years. In addition the client wants to open a product store beside his booth. The loan gives the chance to expand the sphere of his activities and he wants to buy goods for the store.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer
