Ashula is 47 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 9 and 24. All of her children are enrolled in school, although she mentions that paying all of the children’s school fees is a challenge.  

Ashula owns a restaurant where she sells African food. She says that her restaurant is successful because it is clean and she provides good customer care to her clients. 

With the proceeds from this loan, she will buy more types of foods and snacks such as donuts in order to increase her product offering. Any profit that she makes from the business will be used to meet the needs of her children, such as buying food and paying school fees.

loans.use: Food and snacks to sell in her restaurant

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Salima is 37 years old.  She is a widow and has five children between the ages of 15 and 19.  All of her children are enrolled in school.  With the proceeds from this loan, Salima will purchase clothes to sell.  She plans to save any profits that she makes on the business.  Currently Salima does not have a business location.  Instead she delivers the clothes that she sells to her clients.  In the future she would like to have a shop.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Afisa

texts.en: Afisa is 36 years old. She is married and has four children between the ages of 10 and 16.  All of her children are enrolled in school.  Her husband runs the family’s meat business.  Afisa sells charcoal which people use for cooking.  She has had this business for 10 years and she says that she is successful because her shop is near well-populated residential areas.  With this loan she will purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.  With the profit that she makes from her business, she will buy more animals to raise, such as cows and goats, for the family business.  The family businesses have been so successful that Afisa and her husband have been able to construct a two-roomed house for their family.  In the future, Afisa hopes to get a car to transport the charcoal from rural areas to her workplace.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 22 years old. She is married and she has two children, ages 2 and 3. Her husband is a student. 

For the last six years, Yvonne has owned a very well-known local bar. With this loan, she will buy more beverages to sell in her bar.  

Going forward, Yvonne hopes to significantly increase the popularity of her bar. She currently sells 20 crates of beer and her goal is to sell 200 crates. With the profit from her business, she hopes to open up a shop.

loans.use: Beverages to sell in the bar

loans.name: Dave Alexander

texts.es:
Dave de 20 años, es diseñador aerográfico (arte en tela), vive en el suburbio una zona caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes. 

Empezó hace 4 años cuando estaba en el colegio de diseños y artes con algunos ahorros y muchas ganas de tener su propio negocio par poder solventar sus gastos. Actualmente esta perfeccionando su técnica de dibujo en camisetas, gorras y telas. Diseña en la computadora los diseños y las plasma en la ropa que le piden. 

Para seguir con su negocio de diseño aerográfico quiere el préstamo para comprar camisetas, gorras y para mejorar el loca. En el futuro quiere ser licenciado en diseño grafico y tener una agencia de publicidad.
texts.en:
20-year old Dave is a graphic designer using airbrushing techniques (art on fabric). He lives in an area where most of the local people run businesses. He began four years ago using some of his savings to take a course in the college of art and design and determined to run his own business so he could earn a living. Currently Dave is perfecting his technique putting designs on t-shirts, ball caps, and fabric. He uses a computer to create the designs and then transfers them to clothing as requested by his customers. Dave plans to use the loan to buy t-shirts and ball caps, and to improve his place of work. In the future he wishes to obtain a professional qualification in graphic design and run an advertising agency.

Translated from Spanish by Jane A, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy t-shirts and ball caps for his design business

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 44 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 15 and 17. Both of her children are enrolled in school. Her husband works in a hotel.  

Judith sells second-hand clothes for children and adults in a market.  The success of her business has allowed her to pay her children’s school fees and to get medical insurance. Her business is so popular that she is often called out of the market to take clothes to people.  

With this loan, Immaculee will buy more clothes to sell at the market. Immaculee has several dreams for her business and for her family. She would like to be able to buy larger quantities of clothes to sell because she would get lower prices and a higher profit. She would like to be able to buy a motorcycle or a car in order to transport clothes to her clients. She would also like to construct a home for her family.  

With the profit from her business, she will buy a plot of land worth 300,000 RWF (about $512 USD).

loans.use: Clothes to sell at the market

loans.name: Ada

texts.fr: Monsieur Ada N. habite dans la localité de Dalifort. Il est marié et âgé de 49 ans. Monsieur N. a choisi son activité de commerce de pièces détachées par amour et il  évolue  dans ce secteur depuis longtemps. Son activité consiste à acheter en gros les pièces détachées, à les stocker dans son magasin et à les revendre a ses clients chauffeurs. Il est membre de la caisse de Dalifort depuis 2 ans et il sollicite un crédit de 130 000 frs dans le but d’augmenter son fond de roulement. Ce financement pourra lui permettre de consolider ses gains financiers et de mieux prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Ada N. lives in the Dalifort area. He is 49 years old and married. Mr. N. chose to start a business selling spare parts because of his love for it, and he has developed his business in this field for a long time. His business consists of buying spare parts in bulk, stocking them in his store, and re-selling them to his driver clientele. He has been a member of the Dalifort local fund for 2 years, and he is seeking a loan of 130,000 F with the goal of increasing his working capital. This loan will allow him to consolidate his financial earnings and better provide for his family. prendre en charge sa famille.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 35 years old. She is married and she has one child, age 14, who is in school. Rose works as a cleaner and her husband drives a motorcycle taxi for a living. This loan will be used to buy motorcycle spare parts.  

She says that the business is successful because her husband is clean and he has good customer care. With the profits from the business, she and her husband hope to buy a piece of land and to complete their house.

loans.use: Motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en: Pelagie is 28 years old, she is married and she has three children between the ages of 18 months and three years.  Her oldest child is in school.  Her husband has a hair salon.  Pelagie is a tailor and she also sells sewing materials such as thread.  She says that her business is successful because she makes nice clothes in good styles.  She plans to use this loan to buy a sewing machine.  With the profits from their businesses, she and her husband hope to build a house within one year.

loans.use: purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: Rafael Arcangel

texts.es:
Rafael de 57 años, tiene un taller mecánico en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en el suburbio una zona caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes. 

Desde muy joven el aprendió arreglar carros pero recién hace 25 años pudo tener su pequeño taller mecánico en la parte delantera de su casa. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 18h00pm arreglando las bujías, motores, frenos de los carros. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una maquina para su trabajo y cemento y bloques para readecuar su casa y negocio. En el futuro quiere tener clientela fija y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rafael is 57 years old and has a mechanics shop in the front part of his house. He lives in a suburb that is an area where most of its residents are business people. He learned to repair automobiles when he was very young and for the last 25 years has been able to have a small mechanics shop in his house. He works from 7am to 6pm fixing spark plugs, motors, and breaks of cars. With the loan he wants to buy a machine for his work and cement and cement blocks to better adapt his house and his business. In the future, he wants to have steady customers and be able to finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a machine, cement, paint.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 40 years old and married with four children who are between 4 and 19 years old.  Vestine owns a shop where she sells a variety of goods which include rice, sugar, salt, etc. She also sells drinks and some other goods (as shown in the picture).  She has been in this business for about three years. The business hours are from 6 am to 9 pm every day.

Vestine needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Vestine will purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs.  She hopes to earn more profits which, in turn, will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó gracias a la iniciativa de una vecinas quienes decidieron  reunirse y formas un grupo para trabajar De esta forma, se inicia el comité La Victoria Barrio San Carlos de Yka´a de la ciudad de Luque.
 Todas las integrantes de este comité tiene un trabajo especifico e independiente, y de esa forma cada una procura para ayudar a su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Gloria Rodríguez quien  se dedica a la venta de verduras e invirtió el dinero en la compra de verduras varias al por mayor para el incremento de su negocio.
Hace varios años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ayuda para la alimentación de su familia, ella comenta que tiene muchos deseos de seguir trabajando y mejorar su actividad, y al mismo tiempo desea vender otros productos que le puedan dejar mayor beneficio.
Es por ello que quiere seguir trabajando con el grupo y en futuro contar con un mayor capital para invertir en la actividad que a ella mejor le convenga.
texts.en:
The current committee was formed thanks to the initiative of some neighbors that decided to unite and form a working group. This is how the committee "La Victoria Barrio San Carlos de Yka´a" of the city of Luque was started. All the members of this group have specific and stand-alone work, and in this way each one of them helps support her family. One of the members is Mrs. Gloria R. who makes a living selling vegetables and invest her money in the purchase of varied vegetables at wholesale to increase her income. She has been working at this for several years and this activity has helped her feed her family. She notes that she wishes very much to continue working and improving her business and at the same time she wants to sell other products that could be more beneficial to her. For these reasons she wants to continue to work with the group and be able to count on more working capital in the future to invest in the business that would best suit her needs.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of all types of vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, potatoes, carrots.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Apeli

texts.en:
Apeli is 45 years old and married with five children who are between 10 and 26 years old.  Apeli is well known for her business selling a variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs such as rice and flour, and some other goods as shown in the photo.  She has been in this business for about six years. The business hours are from 6 am until late in the evening.

Apeli needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Apeli will increase the sale of foodstuffs and she will increase the size of her business place.  If successful, she will hopefully earn more profits which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Apu Katunki Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “APU KATUNKI ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en la provincia D. Urubamba, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Nohemi, ella tiene 26 años D. edad, es madre soltera; y tiene 1 hijo;  La socia se dedica a trabajar en artesanía en piedra, la socia venD. en las diferentes ferias artesanales sus productos, ella venD. al por mayor, lo que quiere decir que venD. como mayorista; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. artesanía en piedra.

Los otros socios trabajan en construcción civil, venta D. golosinas, venta D. chicha, venta D. verduras, venta D. productos D. abarrotes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nohemi is a member of the Apu Katunki communal bank, located in the province of Urubamba and in the department of Cusco.

Nohemi is 26 years old and is a single mother with a son. She works selling stone handicrafts in the different artisanal markets. She sells wholesale, meaning that she sells as a wholesaler. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of stone handicrafts.

The other group members work in civil construction, candy sales, chicha sales, vegetable sales, and grocery sales.

The group members are grateful for and value the loan provided and they promise to make their payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: To purchase stones and quartz (handicrafts).

loans.name: María Group

texts.es: Doña María P. T. casada con 33 años D. edad, que tiene cuatro hijos tres están estudiando y uno que no estudia, originaria D. Santa Clara La laguna, ella se dedica al comercio y tiene 8 años ya con este negocio. Contando con el entusiasmo y con la ayuda D. algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para solicitar un préstamo. El banco comunal se denomina grupo María, el grupo esta integrado por siete mujeres quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, artesanía y comercio. El préstamo ella lo utilizara en la compra D. materia prima y así incrementar el volumen D. ventas. Espera que su negocio sea más granD. y productivo D. la mejor forma posible.
texts.en:
María P. T.,age 33, is married and has four children. Three of the children go T. school, and one does not. María is from Santa Clara La Laguna. She is a merchant, and she has been in this business for eight years. Counting on enthusiasm and help from some neighbors, they formed a group T. request a loan. The name of their communal bank is the María group. The group is comprised of seven members who work at different activities like handicrafts and sales. She will use the loan T. buy raw material T. increase her volume of sales. She hopes that her business will become larger and more productive in the best way possible.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 33 years old and she is still single.  Antoinette is a successful entrepreneur who has owned a nursery school since 2005.  She is very proud of her business as it allows her to provide for the basic needs of her family.

Antoinette needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  Once given this loan, Antoinette will buy some equipment like chairs and renovate the classrooms.  If successful, Antoinette will start planning how to build some other rooms so that she can find her business being expanded.

loans.use: To buy some school equipment

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou  est une e femme mariée ayant 4 enfants et dont l’âge varie entre 0et 4 ans. Elle habite dans la localité de Dalifort .Elle est âgée  de 43 ans. Elle enseigne dans une institution préscolaire de la localité. Mais depuis 9 ans elle s’active dans le commerce de produits cométiques. Son  objectif est d’augmenter ses revenus pour pouvoir soutenir sa famille. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Dalifort depuis 9 mois. Elle emprunte 200 000 destine a l’achat de produits cosmétiques qu’elle va vendre par placement auprès  de ses amies et connaissances du quartier. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices et de renforcer son soutien a  l’endroit de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Seynabou is a married woman with 4 children whose ages vary from less than 1 year to 4 years. She lives in the Dalifort area and is 43 years old. She teaches at a preschool institution in the area. However, for 9 years, she has been active in selling cosmetics. Her goal is to increase her income to be able to support her family. She has been a member of the Dalifort local fund for 9 months. She is borrowing 200,000 F, to be used to buy cosmetics that she will sell at home to her friends and acquaintances in the area. This loan will allow her to increase her profits and strengthen her ability to support her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her working capital

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo de 47 años de edad es soltero, tiene 2 hijs, el mayor de 8 y el menor de 5 añitos, ambos estudiando la primaria.  Trabaja como vendedor de productos perecederos (verduras y frutas)  y abarrotes desde hace 14 años en la zona del Ayote, a donde viaja semanalmente.  

Esta solicitando su 6to credito con el objetivo de fortalecer su negocio, comprando mayor variedad de producto para tratar de abastecer la demanda de sus clientes, y lograr mayores ventas que le proporcionaran mejores ganancias que le permitiran brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.  

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos estudien y sean hombres de bien que puedan sacar adelante nuestro pais.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 47 years old. He is single and has two children, 8 and 5, who are elementary school students. Ricardo has worked selling perishable goods (vegetables and fruits) and groceries for 14 years in the Ayote area, where he travels weekly.

He is requesting his sixth loan for the purpose of strengthening his businesses. He will purchase a greater variety of goods to meet the demand of his customers and to have better sales. This will provide him with greater earnings that will allow him to provide his family with better living conditions.

His biggest dream is for his children to study and be good men that can get our country ahead.

loans.use: Groceries and vegetables

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
Carmen de 31 años, es vendedora informal de productos Omnilife, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Paraíso” con caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Hace años atrás ella vendía cosméticos para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares pero como necesitaba mas ingresos una de las amigas la inscribió como vendedora de productos Omnilife, en la actualidad trabaja vendiendo casi toda la línea los productos dirigidos para el malestar de cuerpo, energizantes, vitaminas aunque no tiene horario fijo pero si trabaja sola recorriendo las calles de Paraíso. 

Para seguir con las ventas de estos productos ella quiere comprar mas de estos productos, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener dinero para que su hijo pueda estudiar.
texts.en:
Carmen is 31 years old, and she sells Omnilife products. She lives in a periurban area called “Paraíso” (Paradise), which has dirt roads and mountains. Years ago she started selling cosmetics to be able to help with the family expenses. But, because she needed more income, one of her friends signed her up to sell Omnilife products. She currently works selling almost all of the line of products for physical discomforts, energizers, and vitamins. Even though she does not have a fixed schedule, she works alone traveling the streets of “Paraíso”. In order to continue selling, she wants to buy more of these products. In the future she wants to finish building her house, and she wants to have money so that her child can go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Omnilife products

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Don Henry de 59 años de edad habita en el municipio de La Libertad junto a su familia compuesta por su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos, el mayor de 22 y el menor de 19 años.  Trabaja como comerciante de carne desde hace 20 años.  

Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de comprar cerdos para engordarles y venderlos a un mejor precio que le genere mas ganancias, al mismo tiempo realiza destace de cerdos para vender su carne, permitiendole obtener mayores ganancias para cubrir los gastos familiares.  

Su mayor sueño es poder ir creciendo en su negocio para brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Henry is 59 years old and lives in the municipality of La Libertad with his family, which consists of his life partner and two children, 22 and 19 years old. He has worked as a meat merchant for the past 20 years.

Henry is requesting his third loan for the purpose of buying pigs to fatten and sell at a better price so that he can earn more. At the same time, he also butchers pigs to sell their meat, allowing him to earn more to cover the family expenses.

His biggest dream is for his business to continue growing so that he can provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase and sell pigs

loans.name: Enrique Alexander

texts.es:
Enrique es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Pacasmayo, ubicado en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la comercialización de pescado fresco, el compra su mercadería en el terminal pesquero de Santa Rosa, ubicado en el distrito del mismo nombre que pertenece a la región Lambayeque (ubicado a casi tres horas de la zona en donde vive), y luego la distribuye en los principales mercados de la ciudades de Pacasmayo y San Pedro de Lloc. Esta actividad le permite contar con los ingresos necesarios para hacerse cargo de la economía de su familia por lo que siempre trata de mantenerla para sacarla adelante.

Enrique desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas pescado fresco para aumentar su nivel de ventas y percibir mas ganancias, para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles.

El es una persona entregada a su trabajo y que siempre trata de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Enrique, 34, is a father living with his family in Pacasmayo district, Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region, located over two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. He has been a fresh fish merchant for over 10 years. He buys his merchandise in Santa Rosa’s fishing terminal located in Santa Rosa district which is also part of Lambayeque region. It’s located almost three hours away from the area where he lives. He then takes it to sell at the main markets in the cities of Pacasmayo and San Pedro de Lloc. This activity provides necessary income for him to be able to meet family expenses so he always exerts his best effort to see it succeed. Enrique would like to expand his business buying more fresh fish to increase sales levels and thus earn more profits. To reach this goal he has deemed it advantageous to request a 1700 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa. He is a person who is dedicated to his work and is always seeking ways to improve his family’s quality of life. He has had previous financings with Edpyme Alternativa and has been responsible and punctual with his repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: K. kossiwa est une femme mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de djagble au nord de la ville de Lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de Liqueurs. le lieu de son approvisionnement est le grand marché de Lomé. elle fait face à une rupture de stock et sollicite par conséquent de wages un crédit pour l'achat de liqueurs afin de gonfler son stock et satisfaire ses clients
texts.en:
K. Kossiwa is a married woman with 3 children, and lives with her family in the Djagble area north of the city of Lomé. She runs an income-generating business selling liquor. She obtains her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. She is facing a stock shortage and is thus seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy liquor in order to increase her stock and satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Yessenia Cecilia

texts.es:
Yessenia de 37 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Paraíso” con caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Inicio su negocio vendiendo helados y bebida en un congelador que le regalo su ex-esposo con la ganancias que le generaba compro víveres y unas vitrinas para ya ubicar una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Trabaja sola con ayuda de sus hijos cuando llegan del colegio, vende granos, enlatados, bebidas, carnes. 

Con el préstamo quiere surtir mas su negocio dando recargas celulares y comprar víveres como arroz, aceites, enlatados. En el futuro quiere mejorar su casa y que sus hijos terminen los estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Yesenia, age 37, has a small store in the front part of her house. She lives in a periurban area called “Paraíso” (Paradise), which has dirt roads and mountains. She started her business of selling ice cream and drinks from a freezer that her ex-husband gave her. With the income that was generated she bought supplies and some show cases in order to set up her small store in the front part of her store. she works alone, and her children help her when they come home from school. She sells grains, canned goods, drinks, and meat. She wants to use the loan to better stock her store with rechargeable cell phone cards. She will also buy supplies like rice, oil, and canned goods. In the future she wants to improve her house, and she wants her children to successfully complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, oil, and rechargeable cards for cell phones

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: Ysabel tiene 44 años,  es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. El trabajo al que se dedica Ysabel, es la venta de cosméticos de líneas muy reconocidas, que luego de enviar su listado de pedidos, en el lapso de tres días se dedica a la distribución de los productos  que le solicitaron sus clientes. De este modo viene trabajando 22 años en este negocio que tanto le apasiona, con el tiempo ha ascendió y ahora es ejecutiva de ventas. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, son las campañas que se presentan ya que hace mayor cantidad de pedidos, siendo así sus utilidades muy buenas, sin embargo lo difícil es que a veces no pagan a tiempo sus clientes. En adelante, continuará vendiendo cosméticos así como tratar de llegar a más clientes, ya que su fin es tener una tienda para vender ropa. Es su dieciochoavo crédito con MFP, por lo que seguirá siendo puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, puesto que le es de mucha utilidad este préstamo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una vitrina para exhibir sus productos y evitar que se deterioren.
texts.en:
Ysabel is 44 years old and is a very friendly and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house together with her husband and two children.

Ysabel works selling cosmetics from very well-known brands. After submitting her list of requests, she distributes the products requested by her customers within three days. This is how she has been working in the business for 22 years and she is passionate about it. Over time, she has risen and is now sales manager. What she likes most about her work are the campaigns presented because they mean a higher quantity of requests, making them very useful. However, it is difficult when her customers do not pay on time. In the future, she will continue to sell cosmetics to try and get more customers, since her end goal is to have a store to sell clothing.

This is Ysabel’s 18th loan with MFP. She will continue to be on time with her payments since the loan is very useful. With the loan requested, she will purchase a display case to show her products and prevent them from being damaged.

loans.use: To purchase a display case to show her beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buying rice and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buying inventory for food market sales

loans.name: Touré

texts.fr: K. est une femme de 33 ans, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2004 et s'approvisionne à Lomé dans le marché local de kégué. elle exerce son activité dans sa propre boutique. la demande actuelle de sa clientèle est élevée, elle voudrait s'approvisionner avec divers produits d'alimentation générale et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour s'approvisionner et satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
K. is a 33-year-old woman, and runs an income-generating business selling general food products. She has run this business since 2004 and gets her supplies in Lomé, at the Kégué local market. She operates this business in her own store. The current demands of her clientele are very high, and she would like to supply herself with various general food products, so she is seeking her first loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to obtain supplies and satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buying charcoal, fufu, salt, palm oil, etc. for resale at a food market

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buying peppers and potato greens for resale

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Don Virgilio de 56 años de edad habita en El Ayote junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa Maria Lidia y sus 4 hijos, los cuales aun cuentan con su apoyo para que estudien y obtengan una carrera universitaria que les permita tener mejores oportunidades de trabajo y que puedan mejorar sus condiciones de vida.  Virgilio se desempeña desde hace 30 años como un pequeño productor de la zona de El Ayote,ademas tiene una pequeña farmacia veterinaria que le genera ingresos adicionales. 

Esta solicitando su 10mo credito con el objetivo de mejorar su pequeña finca de 100 Mzs mejorando las condiciones de manejo para su ganado, y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan mejorar las condiciones de la familia.  

El mayor sueño de don Virgilio es que sus hijos estudien y sean hombres de provecho.
texts.en:
Virgilio is 56 years old and lives in El Ayote with his family, which is comprised of his wife, Maria Lidia, and four children. He still supports his children so that they study and receive a university degree that will allow them to have better work opportunities and be able to improve their living conditions. Virgilio has worked for the past 30 years as a small producer in the El Ayote area. He also has a small veterinary pharmacy which provides him with additional income.

Virgilio is requesting his tenth loan for the purpose of improving his small, 100-manzana farmland (1 manzana is the equivalent of approximately 7,000 square meters) and to improve the conditions for caring for his cattle. This way, he can earn more and improve his family’s conditions.

Virgilio’s biggest dream is for his children to study and be good men.

loans.use: To improve his farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of frozen meat, fish, pig tails, etc.

loans.name: Union Group

texts.en:
James M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Union. He is 55 years old and married. James has four children whose ages are between 11 and 21 years. He was only able to attend school through first grade due to financial constraints. 

For 12 years, he has been selling tailoring materials such as needles, thread, zips, cloth, etc., in the Chicken-soup Community Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000-Liberian-Dollars portion of this 30,000-Liberian-Dollars group loan to buy more tailoring materials such as needles, thread, zips, cloth, etc. 

He describes himself as a good man whose dream is to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials such as needles, thread, zips, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Lucila Del Rosario

texts.es:
Lucila es una madre D. familia D. 33 años D. edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. Pacasmayo, perteciente a la provincia del mismo nombre y ubicada en la región La Libertad, a mas D. dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. quince años a la venta D. verduras en el exterior del mercado D. la zona en donD. vive. Ella ofrece verduras frescas a sus clientes y debido al tiempo que lleva en el negocio ya cuenta con una clientela fija que siempre consume los productos que ofrece. El negocio es una fuente importante D. ingresos para la economía D. su familia por lo que siempre se esfuerza para mantenerse en el rubro.

Lucila desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas verduras D. modo que pueda ampliar su nivel D. ventas y aumentar sus ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 800 nuevos soles.

Lucila ya ha tenido préstamos con Edpyme Alternativa anteriormente y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas. Las personas que le conocen le consideran un mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Lucila, 33, is a mother living with her family in Pacasmayo district, Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region, located over two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. She has sold vegetables outsiD. her local market for over fifteen years. She offers fresh vegetables to her customers and thanks to the length of time she’s been in business she can count on a regular customer base that always consumes what she has in stock. The business is an important source of income for her family so she always exerts maximum effort to stay in business. Lucila wants to expand her business buying more vegetables in order to increase sales levels and thus profits. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for an 800 new sol loan to achieve this end. Lucila has had previous loans with Edpyme Alternativa and has been punctual and responsible with her repayments. People acquainted with her consider her to be a levelheaded, responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, meat, fish, pepper, salt, seasonings, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 47 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo. Hace más de 8 años Lucia se dedica en la venta de productos comestible de primera necesidad e incluso chocolates y bebidas en general. Su negocio esta situado en el primer ambiente de su casa, en donde atiende con mucha amabilidad a sus clientes, es así que su día laboral empieza desde muy temprano por la mañana, ya que en esa hora es cuando más gente acude a su establecimiento. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es la sección de verduras y frutas; por lo que le deja mayor utilidad que otros productos, por ello procura siempre de abastecerse de estos productos alimenticios. Para el futuro desea ampliar su negocio y proveerse de diversos productos. Es su dieciochoavo crédito con MFP y se comprometen pagar todas sus cuotas como hasta ahora, ya que esta ayuda le es de mucha utilidad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará arroz, azúcar y productos lácteos, para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en: Lucia, 47 years old, is a hard-working mother.  She lives in her own home with her husband and three children, the reason for all her efforts.  More than 8 years ago, Lucia began selling basic food products, including chocolate and refreshments, in general.  Her business is located at the front of her house, where she attends to her customers with great care and attention.  She starts her day very early in the morning, since this is when the most people frequent her establishment.  What she likes most about her business are the sections of fruits and vegetables, which gets more turn-over than any other items in her store.  As such, she is always re-stocking this section.  For the future, she hopes to expand her business and provide a more diverse range of products.  This is her eighteenth credit with MFP.  She promises to make all of the payments, like she is currently doing, and recognizes the helpfulness of this financial assistance.  With the credit that she is seeking, she will purchase rice, sugar, and dairy products to stock her business.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and dairy products.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor Manuel de 39 años de edad habita junto a su familia en la Comarca de Puerto Diaz junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa Ilva Hurtado y su hijo de 18 años de edad.  Trabaja en la pesca artesanal desde hace 25 años, pues sus padres le enseñaron este trabajo desde muy joven.  

Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de comprar redes para pesca, pues actualmente esta trabajando con unas que estan deteriorandose porque tiene bastante tiempo de usarlas.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa y de su hijo, quienes salen a la ciudad a comercializar su producto (pescados) cueando don Victor los pesca, obteniendo ingresos que le permiten el sustento familiar.

Su mayor sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ademas hacer crecer el negocio.
texts.en: Victor Manuel, 39 years old, lives in Comarca de Puerto Diaz with his family, which is composed of his wife, Ilva Hurtado, and their 18 year-old son.  For the past 25 years, he has worked as a fisherman.  His parents taught him this profession when he was very young.  He is applying for his first loan with the objective of purchasing fishing nets.  The ones that he are currently using are deteriorating because they are quite old.  He relies on the support of his wife and his son, whom take what he has caught to the city to be sold.  This income is what sustains his family.  His ultimate dream is to improve the quality of life of his family and expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Xoljuyub No. 5 Group

texts.es: Doña Luisa P. T., tiene 55 años D. edad, es casada, tiene un hijo, D. lo cual esta a su cargo, se dedica al comercio D. ventas D. panes y D. esa  forma ha trabajado diario. Conjuntamente con otras vecinas deciden organizar un grupo para poder incrementar el volumen  D. ventas. Son 5  señoras  integrantes, las otra señoras se dedican a diversas actividades productivas, tales como: comercio, venta D. panes, la crianza D. animales, bordado D. blusas y ropas típicas. Quieren que su negocio sea rentable por lo que el credito les será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luisa P. T., 55, is married and has a son in her care. She sells bread and has worked at this daily. Together with some neighbors they decided to form a group to increase sales. There are 5 members. The other women are in various kinds of productive activities such as: commerce, bread sales, animal raising, blouse and typical clothing embroidery. They want their businesses to be profitable so the loan will be of much help.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, flour, sugar and milk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more dried meat

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: cette femme est âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle exerce son commerce de façon ambulante, ainsi elle arrive à toucher une plus grande clientèle. la période des fêtes est proches, elle souhaite s'approvisionner afin de bien vendre pour la circonstance, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour gonfler son stock avec 10 pagnes super, 10 pagnes hollandais, 10 pagnes GTP, 10 pagnes Hitarget.
texts.en:
This woman is 39 years old, married, and has 2 children. She runs her business door-to-door, and thus is able to cater to a larger clientele. The holiday season is approaching, and she hopes to supply herself in order to sell well during the occasion. She is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to boost her stock with 10 pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth) of the 'super' brand, 10 pagnes of the 'hollandais' brand, and 10 pagnes of the 'Hitarget' brand.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Dodzi Ameyovi

texts.fr: cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de produits alimentaires, elle exerce son commerce dans sa propre boutique qu'elle a appelé "LE VIVABLE", elle a une ancienneté d'un an dans son commerce qui est de jour en jour florissant. elle veut accroître sa capacité à servir ses clients elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers produits d'alimentation générale. elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de novissi à Lomé.
texts.en:
This woman sells food products for a living from her shop, called 'Le Vivable', which she has run for a year and continues to go from strength to strength. She would like to boost her capacity in order to satisfy her customers' demands and so is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase various food products. She is married with two children and lives with her entire family in the Novissi quarter of Lomé.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes and shoes

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: kossi est une jeune homme marié qui est très dynamique, l'activité qu'il exerce pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce de détail de CD audios. il  a commencé ce commerce depuis 2008 et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. actuellement son stock de marchandises est en baisse, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec plus de 500 CD audios. ainsi il se prépare à servir ses clients pour la période des fêtes de fin d'année qui approche.
texts.en:
Kossi is a young married man who is very dynamic and sells audio CDs in order to meet his family's needs. He began in this line of work in 2008 and sources his goods from the large market in Lomé. His customer base is wide and varied. His stock of goods is depleting and so he is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase 500 CDs; in this way he will be able to serve his customers' needs for the end-of-year festivities.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat de CD audios

loans.name: Angelica Marina

texts.es:
Angelica es una madre de familia de 65 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Oyotún, sus hijos ya se encuentran independizados. La zona en donde vive es netamente agrícola y se geografía bastante accidentada por su cercanía con la sierra del país. Se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la venta de comida en un pequeño restaurante ubicado en la localidad donde reside. Sus principales clientes son las personas que por motivos de trabajo se quedan en la zona como por ejemplo profesores, profesionales de la salud y todo tipo de trabajadores. El negocio cuenta con bastante acogida debido a la buana sazon con la que prepara sus comidas y al buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes.

Angélica utiliza las ganancias de este negocio para colaborar con la economía de su familia. Actualmente desea ampliarlo con la compra de mas insumos, de modo que pueda preparar mas platos y aumentar su nivel de ventas. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer que desea seguir trabajando para sentirse activa y útil. En la zona las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Angélica, 65, is a mother living with her husband in Oyotún district. Her children are all independent now. The area where she lives in totally agricultural and its terrain is pretty rugged due to its proximity to the country’s mountains. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For over 10 years she has sold prepared food in a small restaurant located where she lives. Her main customers are people who due to work stay in the zone like teachers, health workers and all kinds of workers. The business is quite well received thanks to the tastiness of her dishes and the good service she gives customers. Angélica uses profits from the business to contribute to the family’s economy. She would like to buy more ingredients so that she can make more dishes and increase sales. To reach this goal she needs to ask Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan. She is a woman who wants to continue to work to feel useful and active. People in the area who know her consider her to be a calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her dishes and to expand her sales.

loans.name: Wassimre

texts.fr: leou est une femme très dynamique, l'activité qu'elle exerce est simple, elle achète des tissus et confectionne des habits pour vendre.  cette activité est une réussite pour elle. son souhait est d'agrandir son commerce. elle a une ancienneté de plus de 5 ans dans ce commerce. elle a déjà obtenu du crédit de WAGES qu'elle a bien remboursé. pour réaliser son souhait d'agrandir son activité elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers tissus. elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Leou is a very dynamic young woman who buys fabric in order to produce and sell clothes. She has had great success with her business. Her aim is now to grow this 5 year-old business further. She has already received one loan from WAGES which she has successfully repaid. In order to achieve her goal she is seeking another from WAGES so that she may purchase various fabrics. She is married with two children.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase fabric

loans.name: Amevor

texts.fr: en 2002, G. s'est lancée dans le commerce des articles de mercerie, elle a ouvert sa propre boutique à cet effet et appelle sa boutique " SOLID ROCK", elle s'approvisionne à lomé. la demande actuelle de sa clientèle est élevée, elle voudrait s'approvisionner pour mieux les satisfaire, elle sollicite donc de WAGES son premier crédit qui va lui servir à acheter divers articles de mercerie pour gonfler son stock. elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. cette activité lui permet de contribuer aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
In 2002 G. began to sell haberdashery items from her shop, called 'Solid Rock'. She sources her goods from Lomé. Given that customer demand has risen, she would like to boost her stock levels in order to better meet their needs. For this reason she is seeking her first loan from WAGES which will enable her to do this. She is married with four children, and this business enables her to meet her family's needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of haberdashery goods

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: fati exerce depuis  2004 le commerce de pagnes, elle exerce son commerce au marché local de kégué et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.  sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle a constaté une baisse de son stock de marchandises. elle veut s'approvisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour l'achat de d'une trentaine de pagnes. elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants
texts.en:
Fati has sold pagnes (wax cloths) since 2004 from the local market at Kégué and sources her wares from the large market at Lomé. Her customer base is made up of a variety of people. She has noticed a fall in her stock levels and is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase around thirty pagnes. She is married with four children.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing "pagnes" (wax cloths)

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María de 29 años, vive en una zona periurbana con caminos de tierra llamada “Paraíso”. Es vendedora de colchones y camas. 

Inicio su negocio hace 5 años atrás para ayudar con los gastos familiares, al principio como trabajo en un local comercial de muebles se incentivo al ver la magnitud de las ventas. Su esposo se encarga de vender los colchones y ella de administrar el local. El estilo de ventas es dar a crédito para que sus clientes paguen por cuotas los colchones.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar colchones y camas para tener mas mercadería para vender. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda de muebles y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
María is 29 years old and lives in a periurban area with unpaved roads called Paraíso. She sells mattresses and beds.

She started her business five years ago to help with the family expenses. At the beginning she worked in a place selling furniture, and she was motivated by seeing the number of sales. Her husband works selling the mattresses and she works managing the place. Their sales style is to sell on credit so that their customers can pay for the mattresses in installments.

With this loan, she wants to purchase mattresses and beds to have more merchandise to sell. In the future she wants to have a furniture store and to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mattresses, beds

loans.name: Félicia

texts.fr: félicia est une femme veuve qui a 2 personnes à sa charge. elle exerce comme activité le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce depuis plus de 10 ans et maîtrise donc ce commerce. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle voudrait agrandir son stock et sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 15 sacs de riz, 20 bidons d'huile et divers produits d'alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Felicia, a widow with two dependents, makes a living selling general food products. She has been doing this for over ten years and has a good command of her activity. Her customer base is very diverse. She wishes to increase her stocks and is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase 15 bags of rice, 20 cans of oil, and various other general food items.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: P. est une femme de 47 ans qui exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de tissus, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2006 et exerce son activité à domicile. elle vend à crédit à ses plus fidèles clients et récupère ses créances dans les 8 jours suivants. son stock est en baisse. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour agrandir son stock avec diverses qualités de tissus.
texts.en:
P. is a 47 year-old woman who began selling fabric for a living in 2006; she sells her wares from home for 8-day credit to a loyal customer base. However, her stock levels are falling and so she is seeking a loan from WAGES to supplement her stock with a range of different quality fabrics.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Djémila

texts.fr: Y. est une jeune femme célibataire, pour subvenir à ses propres besoins, elle s'est lancé dans la vente de bazins, elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 1995.  elle s'approvisionne à Lomé et commande aussi son stock au mali. actuellement elle fait face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'une vingtaine de bazins.
texts.en:
Y. is a young single woman who has sold bazins (local cloth) for a living since 1995. She sources her goods from Lomé and orders her goods from Mali. She is currently facing a stock shortage and so is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase around twenty bazins.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of bazins (fabric)

loans.name: Laura Alexandra

texts.es:
Laura de 28 años, es vendedora de artículos electrónicos,   vive en una zona periurbana caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y lomas. 

Inicio con su esposo el negocio de los aparatos electrónicos y domésticos hace 5 años atrás con un muy bajo capital compraron microondas, cocinas, ventiladores para venderlos  a sus amigos y conocidos. Poco a poco en el sector donde viven se hicieron muy conocidos. Los dos trabajan turnando su tiempo para poder estar con sus dos hijas. 

Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar televisores y perfumes para venderlos a sus clientes. En el futuro quiere invertir en su casa para construirla mejor.
texts.en:
Laura, age 28, sells electronic appliances. She lives in a peri-urban zone characterized by dirt roads and hills. She started her household and electronic appliances business with her husband 5 years ago. With a little capital, they bought microwaves, stoves, and electric fans to sell to their friends and acquaintances. Bit by bit, they became more well known in the sector where they live. The two take turns working so that they can spend time with their two daughters. To continue developing her business, Laura wants to buy televisions and perfumes to sell to her customers. In the future she wants to invest in improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Television sets, perfume.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este comité se inicio gracias a que las integrantes gracias a la invitación de otro comité quienes  se encuentran trabajando con el programa Comité de Mujeres. 
De esta manera entre vecinas y amigas se agruparon y hoy día se encuentran trabajando cada una en su trabajo pero con la posibilidad de obtener un crédito para invertirlos en sus actividades o en otras urgencias o necesidades. 
Ella para cubrir las cuotas del crédito organiza actividades que  para recaudar fondos y de esa manera cumplen la responsabilidad en conjunto. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Hermelinda, una mujer muy activa y trabajadora.

Ella tiene una granja en su casa con crías de varios animales  y los productos que obtiene los vende a varios negocios y a vecinos de la zona.
Produce y  vende  leche, huevos, gallinas y otros e invirtió el dinero en la compra de alimentos para sus animales al por mayor.
texts.en:
This committee started when the members were invited to join by other members working with the Comité de Mujeres program. In this way, between neighbors and friends, the group grew and today each member works and is able to access credit to invest in her work, emergencies or other needs. To make their repayments, the members collect money from their work activities and in this way meet their responsibilities together. One of the members is Hermelinda, an active and hardworking woman. She owns a farm, raising various animals and selling milk, eggs, hens, and other products to her neighbors in the area. Hermelinda invested her loan in the purchase of wholesale animal feed.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animal feed.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María de 43 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Hace 3 años atrás ella comenzó con su tienda de vivieres después que su esposo la abandono con su hija, uno de sus primeros productos de su tienda fueron arroz, enlatados. Debido a la demanda de los víveres ella comenzó a comprar enlatados, arroz y aceite. Ahora trabaja con ayuda de su hija después de llegar del colegio desde las 07h30am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder surtir mejor su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, enlatados etc. En el futuro quiere incrementar su tienda con víveres y ayuda a su hija para que termine sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, and has a small store in the front section of her house. She lives in the Paraiso section of Guayaquil, an urban fringe area characterized by dirt roads and mountains. She set up her store to sell foodstuffs 3 years ago, after her husband left her with her daughter. Some of the first products she sold were rice and canned goods. With the demand for provisions, she began to buy canned goods, rice, and oil. She now works with her daughter (after she gets home from school) from 7:30 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. every day. In order to better stock her store, she wishes to buy rice, canned goods, etc., with the loan. In the future, she wants to expand her store with provisions and help her daughter to successfully complete her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Arroz, dulces

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María tiene 24 años de edad, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel junto a su hijo de 7 años de edad, ella posee casa propia y es comerciante de ropa desde hace 5 años, ella comenzó trabajando como empleada de un negocio de ropa y luego inicio como propietaria de su propio local.
Ella solita un préstamo pues quiere invertir en los estilos y la moda del momento para atraer más clientes,  ella desea comprar blusas, short, pantalones que son las prendas que más se venden; con este préstamo ella comprara por mayor cantidad con la oportunidad de conseguir mejores precios.
Ella desea crecer y establecer un buen número de clientes, aumentar su comercialización y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
María is 24 years old, and she lives in the city of San Miguel with her seven year old son.  She has her own house.  She has been selling clothes for five years.  She started working as an employee of a clothing business.  Later, she started as the owner of her own place.

She is requesting a loan to buy the current styles and the fashions in order to attract more customers.  She wants to buy blouses, shorts, and pants.  These are the garments that are sold the most.  With this loan she will buy in larger quantities, which gives her the opportunity to get better prices.

She wants to grow and to establish a good number of customers.  She also wants to increase her sales and improve the living conditions for herself and her son.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
La Sra. Nicasia D. Leon  es cliente antigua  D. nuestra entidad, es casada y vive en casa propia. 
La titular cuenta con una mercería hace 7 años, contando con buena clientela formada a la fecha, dicho negocio se encuentra en su domicilio.
 Dicho préstamo la titular ha retirado para la compra D. juguetes, ropas y artículos D. librería. A la fecha la Sra. Nicasia ha retirado 6 prestamos desD. el año  2005.
Dicho préstamo la titular considera que le dejara un mejor margen D. ganancia a su negocio y a la vez le dará un  mejor nivel D. vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nicasia D. Leon is a long-time client of ours, is married, and lives in her own home. She has had a dry-goods store for 7 years, and currently has a loyal customer base. She operates the business out of her home. She has requested this loan to purchase toys, clothing, and stationery items. Since 2005, she has taken out 6 loans. The borrower believes that this loan will allow her a wider profit margin for her business and also proviD. her with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mercaderias ropas, juguetes, y articulos de libreria.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es: Doña Esperanza V. B. D. V., es una señora casada, tiene dos hijas, una nena D. tres años y una bebe D. tres meses esta señora trata D. apoyar económicamente a su familia y prepararle un mejor futuro a sus hijas, ella se dedica a la venta D. medicina como también a confeccionar gorritas, suéteres, escarpines, guantes hechos D. lana trabajado con sus manos utilizando una aguja D. cros he, actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. 10 años, doña Esperanza se dio cuenta que necesitaba surtir mas su negocio para poder mejorar las ventas y así obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas amigas que conocía desD. hace mas D. 15 años para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata D. apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas D. su aldea, el cual cada una D. las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tale como: venta D. frutas, crianza D. animales, cultivo D. frijol y tomate entre otros.
texts.en:
Esperanza is married and has two daughters, a 3 year old and a 3 month old. She strives to help her family financially and to prepare a better future for her daughters. She sells medicines and weaves caps, sweaters, socks and gloves from wool. She works with her hands using a crochet needle, as she has been doing since she was 10 years old. Esperanza realized she needed to diversify her business to increase sales and therefore increase her income. She then gathered friends she has known for more than 15 years to form a group since she strives to help not only her family but also her village. Each of the ladies from the group is dedicated to a different activity such as selling fruit, raising animals, growing beans and tomatoes among others.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Asucenas Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Delia Elizabeth T. quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Actualmente las integrantes de este comité se encuentran trabajando apara el progreso de individual y también grupal.
Todas se encuentran satisfechas por los créditos obtenidos ya que pueden concretar con sus proyectos mediante mejoras en sus casa o sus actividades.

Así la  Sra. Delia Elizabeth  quien se dedica a la venta de comestible, anteriormente solo vendía una clase de comestibles y luego de invirtió el préstamo  en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestibles,  actualmente cuanta con varios tipos que puede ofrecer a sus clientes como las empanadas de carne, pollo, jamón y queso, croquetas, milanesas, panchos, chorizos y otros.
texts.en:
Señora Delia Elizabeth T. was the person who started this group. She invited and her friends to participate in the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women program. The members of the committee are currently working on the progress of both the individual and the group. The women are very satisfied with the loans they have obtained and have used them to follow up on various projects such as making improvements to their houses or to their businesses. Sra. Delia Elizabeth earns her living by selling food. In the past she only sold one kind of food, but then she obtained a loan and bought ingredients to make other dishes. Now she has several different things she can sell to her customers such as meat, chicken, ham, and cheese empanadas, croquettes, breaded meat, hot dogs, sausages etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jane A, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy meat, oil etc to make food

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara V. S., tiene la edad de 53 años, es soltera y vive sola en su casa, no tiene hijos. Ella quiere  quiere comprar dos Cerdas de cría para que, cuando nazcan los cerditos de mes y medio de edad ,poderlos vender  y tener más ingresos económicos . Además tiene cerca de su casa una pequeña porqueriza  que desea darle utilidad en los ratos libres. En la actualidad trabaja en el comedor escolar de la comunidad,  El Socorro, pero  desea aumentar sus ingresos con la finalidad de ir haciendo un ahorro, pensando en su vejes y mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella forma parte del comité de crédito de El Socorro  en el cual es Vocal. Es el tercer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR lo que le ha permitido crecer en lo económico, no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Sara V. S. is 53 years old, single and lives alone in her home. She has no children. She wants to purchase pigs so that when their young are one and a half months old, she can sell them and have more income. Near her home, she also has a small pigpen that she wants to use in her free time. At the moment, she works in her community's (El Socorro) school cafeteria. She wants to increase her income in order to start a savings account, since she is thinking about her old age and also, in order to improve her quality of life. She is a member of El Socorro's credit committee. This is the third loan she has received from FUDECOSUR which has allowed her to prosper economically. She hasn't had other loans with state banks. FUDECOSUR offered a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 2 pigs

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Don Luis de 67 años de edad, es agricultor, está casado y vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 27 y 28 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Delicias de Concepción departamento de Morazán, el tiene casa propia y en el terreno cultiva hortalizas y cría ganado dedicándose a este oficio desde hace 40 años, sus hijos son quienes le ayudan a desarrollar las actividades, su hijo al cuido del ganado y su hija a la comercialización de las hortalizas.
Él solicita un préstamo pues desea realizar la siembra y no cuenta con los materiales necesarios ya que desea ampliar el área del cultivo, con este préstamo él comprara semillas y abono ayudando a crecer con sus cultivos y pueda obtener más frutos para su comercialización.
Su proyección es enseñar a sus hijos el trabajo de la tierra y puedan aumentar su producción, que estos se superen y mejoren sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Luis, age 67, is a farmer.  He is married, and he lives with his wife and two children, ages 27 and 28.  They live in the Delicias de Concepción municipality in the Morazán department.  He has his own house.

He has been growing vegetables and raising livestock for 40 years.  His children help him with this work.  His son helps take care of the livestock, and his daughter helps sell the vegetables.

He is requesting a loan for planting because he does not have the necessary materials.  He wants to increase his growing fields.  With this loan he will buy seeds and fertilizer, which will help his crops grow.  Then he will be able to get more vegetables to sell.

His plan is to teach his children how to work the land so they can increase production.  This is so that they will do well and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and seeds to plant vegetables

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El Sr. Pedro es soltero  tiene 42 años sin hijos, el señor cuenta con su concubina que le ayuda en el trabajo.
El señor fue joyero durante muchos años, actualmente se dedica a la recarga de oxigeno y venta de joyas en forma ambulante, cuenta con una clientela formada de varios años.
Le gustaría mas adelante abrir para su propia joyería ya que tiene experiencia en el rubro y cuenta con varios clientes.
Solicita el préstamo para abastece su disponibilidad de oxigeno y también para la compra de joyas de plata como cadenas, aros, medallas y otros.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro is 42, single, and he has no children. His girlfriend helps him with his work. Pedro was a jeweler for many years, but currently he works refilling oxygen tanks and selling jewelry as a street merchant. He has customers that he has developed over the years. He would like to open his own jewelry store in the future now that he has experience in this business and has some customers. He is requesting a loan to fill his oxygen supply, and also to buy silver jewelry such as chains, earrings, medals, and more.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refill oxygen and to buy silver jewelry such as chains, pins, and medals.

loans.name: Chopoklaj Group

texts.es: Doña Lidia Marcela es soltera, cursó Primero Básico escolar, tiene una hija de dos años de edad tiene bajo su cargo, ella se dedica a la comercio, (Compra y venta de Cortes típicos Blusas, delantales Típicos), tiene 5 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El grupo solidario se denomina Chopoklaj del Barrio Santa Isabel Momostenango, el nombré significa frente la arena blanca. El grupo cuenta con seis integrantes, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar: Compra y venta de colchas venta de  fantasías la elaboración de canastas plásticas.  El préstamo que solicitan es para la ampliación de capital así incrementan el volumen de ventas. Esperan que su negocio sea más grande y productivo.
texts.en:
Lidia Marcela is single, and she has a seventh grade education. She has a two year old daughter under her care. Lidia is a merchant. She buys and sells typical clothing that includes typical blouses and aprons. She has been in this business for five years. Counting on enthusiasm and the help of some neighbors, they organized a group in order to be able to request a loan. Their Communal Bank's name is "Chopoklaj del Barrio Santa Isabel Momostenango". The name means Facing the White Sand. Their group is comprised of six members who are engaged in different activities. Among their activities is buying and selling quilts, selling costume jewelry, and making plastic baskets. The loan they are requesting is to increase their capital in order to increase their volume of sales. They hope that their businesses become bigger and more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish (TL), Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es:
Griselda es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el caserío Sialupe Baca, una zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, la zona concentra un movimiento comercial considerable y se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. En este establecimiento ella ofrece a los vecinos de su localidad diversos productos de uso diario que muchas veces no tienen al alcance de la mano ya que son vendidos en la ciudad. Este negocio le permite agenciarse de algunos ingresos que utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Griselda cuenta con una clientela fija ya que suele ofrecer a sus clientes un trato amable y productos de calidad. Actualmente desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos para aumentar sus ventas y percibir un mayor numero de ganancias. Por este motivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante activa y entregada a su familia su mayor anhelo esseguir esforzándose para contribuir al desarrollo y progreso de los suyos. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Griselda is a 38-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Sialupe Baca settlement, a rural zone in the district of Lambayeque. The area has considerable commercial activity and lies twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Her work is selling basic products and groceries in a store installed in her home. In this establishment, she offers her neighbors in the area a range of daily necessities which they often do not have immediately at hand, since they are sold in the city. This business allows her to receive an income which she uses to help her husband cover her family's economic needs. Griselda has steady customers, since she offers her clients friendly service and quality products. Currently, she would like to expand her business by purchasing more products, so that she can increase her sales and earn higher profits. For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 Peruvian new soles. She is a very active woman who is very devoted to her family. Her greatest desire is to continue working hard to contribute to the progress and development of her loved ones. She has had previous loans with Edpyme Alternativa, and she has shown herself to be punctual and responsible in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying basic products and groceries to expand the store installed in her home

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro G. C. es padre de familia de 2 pequeños a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejora calidad de vida, es por ello que quiere ir formando un mejor patrimonio para ellos. El señor desea un préstamo para terminar de construir su vivienda ya que necesita poner vitropiso y levantar una barda al frente de su casa.
texts.en:
Ramiro G. C. is the father of 2 children, for whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. This is why he wants to form more wealth for them. He wishes to have the loan to finish building his house because he still needs to install ceramic flooring and make the wall outside the front of his house higher.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ceramic flooring and to raise the wall outside of his house.

loans.name: María Irma

texts.es:
María Irma es una joven madre de familia que tiene 23 años de edad, reside junto a su familia en el caserío Huaca de Barro, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope, a mas de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de un año a la comercialización de animales menores, ella cría animales en la casa donde reside y los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente comercializa granos como por ejemplo maíz. Ella compra estos productos a los agricultores de la zona durante las temporadas de cosecha para revenderlos a los mismos negociantes que le compran los animales.

María Irma y su familia no cuentan con una casa propia, construir su casa propia se ha convertido en uno de sus anhelos mas esperados y para lograrlo ella y su esposo se han esforzado mucho durante el tiempo que llevan juntos. Actualmente cuentan con algunos materiales pero aun les hace falta comprar cosas, por este motivo María Irma se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante luchadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran honrada y amable, en la imagen nos muestra la construcción de su vivienda que planea terminar gracias al préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
María Irma is a young 23-year-old mother. She lives with her family in the Huaca de Barro area, an agricultural zone located in the district of Mórrope, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She has worked selling young animals for more than a year. She raises the animals in the house where she lives and feeds them grains and natural grasses. When they reach a good level of development, she sells them to merchants that always visit the area where she lives. María Irma also sells grains such as corn. She purchases the grains from area farmers during the harvest season to re-sell them to the same merchants that buy the animals from her.

María Irma and her family do not have their own house. Building a house has been one of her most awaited dreams and in order to be able to do it, she and her husband have put in a lot of effort during the time that they have been together. They currently have some of the materials but they still need to buy things. This is why María Irma has seen it necessary to request a 1500 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa. This will be her first loan.

She is a fighter and has a lot of desire to get ahead. The people that know her consider her to be honest and friendly. In the photo, she shows us the construction of her house that she plans to finish thanks to the loan requested.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to finish building her house.

loans.name: Irma Leticia

texts.es: Irma Leticia C. es una mujer muy trabajadora que cuenta con una papelería, mercería llamada “Claudia” y su esposo trabaja en una empresa que vende muebles, de esta manera es como ello perciben ingresos para mantener los gastos. La señora Irma esta construyendo su casa pero le hace falta instalar las protecciones de la barda para que este mejor protegida y sí ofrecer a su familia mayor protección.
texts.en:
Irma Leticia C. is a very hardworking woman who has a stationery and notions store called “Claudia.” Her husband works for a company that sells furniture and this is how they receive income to cover their expenses. Irma is building her house but she still needs to install the protections on a wall outside of the house so that she is better protected and can offered her family more protection.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase protections for her wall

loans.name: Patricia Yessenia

texts.es:
Patricia de 34 años, vive en una zona urbana llamada “Suburbio” caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales. Ella hace cerámicas y las vende al por mayor y menor. 

Para poder solventa los gastos familiares ella comenzó aprender cerámicas para venderlas al por mayor y menor. Ella hace cerámicas de todo tipo imágenes animadas y otros dibujos. Aunque trabaja sola porque se separo de su esposo ella sigue trabajando para darle una mejor vida a sus dos hijos que están en escuelas fiscales. 

Para seguir haciendo cerámicas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo moldes, materiales de cerámica. En el futuro quiere tener un local con sus propias manualidades.
texts.en:
