Sra. Deicy C. is a member of the Communal Bank “Tres de Noviembre” (Third of November). She lives in the May 24th community which is in the parish of Cumbe. In this area, there are livestock farms with large open pastures. Cumbe offers visitors many special recreational areas such as the view of El Calvario, which is a 15 minute walk from the parochial center; El Gulash, which is between Santa Rosa, Cumbe, and Jima; the beautiful Pucará in Sagrada de los Cañaris; the banks of the Cumbe River; and the ruins of Ingahuasi that ascends to Tinajillas.

Doña Deicy works at a stationery shop that she owns. She started this business a year ago. Deicy works Monday through Sunday from 6am to 7pm. She also raises pigs and chickens to sell throughout the parish.

Deicy is 27 years ago and has been widowed for a year. She has three children who are 7, 6, and 4 years of age. All of her children are in school. Deicy does not have her own home, so she lives at the house of her in-laws and shares in the expenses.

Deicy has been a member for four years and joined the Communal Bank after her mother convinced her to join this group of women entrepreneurs. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of products for her stationery shop such as books, notebooks, pens, etc.

Her goal is to have a home of her own.

loans.use: Purchase books, notebooks, pens, and other products

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo es un padre de familia de 63 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola con bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a mas de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Durante su juventud sirvió en las fuerzas armadas del Perú y actualmente percibe una pension mensual, como este ingreso no es suficiente para hacerse cargo de la economía de su familia decidió dedicarse al negocio de alquiler de cuartos, el alquila algunos cuartos de su casa a los diversos trabajadores que llegan a la zona.

Ricardo desea habilitar algunas habitaciones para poder brindarle comodidad a sus inquilinos, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Ricardo es una persona tranquila y de trato amable, sus vecinos y conocidos dan muy buenas referencias suyas y le consideran alguien tranquilo y colaborador.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a 63 year old father who lives with his wife in the district of Olmos, an agricultural area that experiences some commercial activity. This community is located in Lambayeque Province, which is an hour and forty-five minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

In his youth, Ricardo served in the Peruvian armed forces and now receives a monthly pension. This income is not enough to cover the family expenses, so he decided to start a business renting rooms. The rooms are located in his house and he rents to different workers who come to the area.

Ricardo wants to remodel some of the rooms so that they will be more comfortable for his tenants. In order to carry out this plan, he has decided to apply for his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 PEN.

Ricardo is a peaceful and friendly person. His neighbors and acquaintances give him very good references and consider him to be a quiet and cooperative individual.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel rooms for rent

loans.name: Rosa Mirtha

texts.es: La señora Rosa Mirtha Hernández Hernández se dedica a vender verduras en el mercado Santo Domingo hace tres años aproximadamente , la solicitante vive con sus hijos en su domicilio ubicado en Avenida San Martín de Porras Ica,requiere del crédito para ampliar su negocio y tener mejor calidad de vida , se propone otorgarle el crédito ya que cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Mirtha Hernández Hernández has been selling vegetables for approximately three years at the Santo Domingo Market. She lives with her three children at her home located along Avenida San Martín de Porras in the city of Ica.

Rosa is requesting a loan in order to expand her business and have a better quality of life. She has been provided with this loan because she has good personal and business references.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Nadia Cristina

texts.es:
En la parroquia Canuto  del cantón Chone ciudad conocida por ser una zona ganadera y por sus mujeres hermosas, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Santa Rosa.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Nadia. Tiene 31 años y es madre soltera de un lindo bebito de dos años que es su fuerza para salir adelante, trabaja de secretaria en la casa parroquial (iglesia).

Se dedica a la venta de sabanas y ropa de niños, este negocio lo viene realizando desde que tuvo a su hijo, nos cuenta que al verse sola y sin nadie que viera por su hijo,  le pidió a una amiga que le ayudara a entrar en el negocio y así lo hizo, primero vendía sabanas y después empezó a vender ropa de niños en lo cual le va muy bien ya que día a día tiene mas clientes. Trabaja todos los días en la noche  y los fines de semana en los cuales vende y cobra a la vez. Compra su mercadería en Guayaquil y a veces en Quito ya que allá se consigue a mejor precio y  mayor variedad.

Este nuevo crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa íntima de damas ya que sus clientes le piden  y con esto espera aumentar su clientela. Es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las  facilidades del crédito.
 
Su sueño es darle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
The parish of Canuto in Chone canton is a city known for livestock breeding and its beautiful women. Every 15 days the Santa Rosa Communal Bank meets in this area.

This is Sra. Nadia. She is 31 years old and a single mother of a beautiful two year old son for whom she strives to get ahead. Nadia works as a church secretary.

She earns a living by selling bed sheets and children’s clothing. Nadia started this business after giving birth to her son. Since she is single and does not have anyone to look after her son, Nadia asked a friend who agreed to help her start this business. At first she sold bed sheets and later began selling children’s clothing. She is doing very well because she acquires more customers day after day. Nadia works every evening and on the weekends, making sales and collecting payments. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and occasionally in Quito where she gets the best price and a wide variety.

This new loan will be used to buy women’s undergarments for which she has already received orders and will also help her increase her customer base. This is her second loan with the Communal Bank and she enjoys the loan services. Her dream is to provide a good education for her son.

loans.use: Purchase women’s undergarments

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es: La señora Llaqui tiene 32 años y vive en la zona M de Huaycan, lleva a año trabajando con Edaprospo y es una de los ocho miembros del grupo “Gotitas de Amor” el cual se conforma por sus amigas y vecinas, unidas con el propósito de alcanzar sus metas en conjunto. Por su parte Laqui lleva tres años vendiendo especerías para sostener su hogar colaborando con su conviviente, espera poder arreglar su casa para vivir con mayor comodidad y para esto necesita que Edaprospo le haga más habilitaciones.
texts.en:
Sra. Llaqui is 32 years old and lives in District M of Huaycan. She has worked with EDAPROSPO for the past year and is one of eight members of the group called “Gotitas de Amor” (Droplets of Love), which consists of friends and neighbors who are working together to achieve their goals.

Llaqui has been selling spices for three years in order to support her household along with her common-law husband. She hopes to remodel her house so that her family can live more comfortably. For this reason, she needs assistance from EDAPROSPO to make these renovations.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela A. is from the village of San Isidro. She is 41 years old, married, and has five school-age children. Angela owns a food stall in her local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Angela joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angela has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Angela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Angela from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is from the village of San Isidro. She is 56 years old, married, and has five school-age children.  Veronica owns a business that makes  general household furniture which she sells to local businesses and community members. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Veronica joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase raw materials to make more furniture. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Veronica from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. is from the village of San Lorenzo. She is 58 years old, married, and has two adult children. Teresita owns a business in which she makes and sells cooked food for daily meals. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s bread making and selling business. Her husband operates a tandoor (a type of oven which is made of clay and is heated with a wood fire) in which he makes the bread to sell to the local community. He sells the bread for 5 PKRs which is a standard amount in every city and in this way earns income for the family. 

Shazia lives in the city of Lahore which is the second largest city in Pakistan. She owns a small house made up of two rooms in an area called Mughalpura and lives in it with her family. She is a mother of two sons and a daughter. Her elder son works in a bakery and her daughter does embroidery work at home.  

Her youngest son reads at 10th standard level. Shazia couldn’t educate her elder children due to financial constraints, but she wants her youngest son to complete his education and get a good job because now her two kids are helping to support the family financially. 

Shazia supports her family by selling clothes. She operates her business from her home. She has a good number of clients and she makes a reasonably good income every month. She buys clothes from different cities such as Faisalabad and Multan for their cheap rates and good designs and sells them to her neighbors in the community. 

With the loan amount her husband will buy flour in larger quantities which helps him to make more bread and to increase his selling. Shazia’s husband has had this business for the past 20 years and she is hopeful that her husband will be able to successfully uplift his business by making this investment into it. 

Note: In this photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Shazia.

loans.use: To buy flour for a bread making and selling business

loans.name: Bukora Twimukye, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Hard working and cooperative M. Mary has been operating a small restaurant from Kihihi, where she prepares milk tea served with other local meals. This has seen her earn 320,000 Ugandan shillings per month, which is better than her former business of selling second hand clothes.
This married mother of six children is working hard to see that all her children acquire education. Therefore, she is taking up a loan to help her expand her business and thus be able to earn more revenue. She also earns extra profits totalling to 100,000 shillings from the sale of bananas.

She belongs to Bukora Twimukye group of members who hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase restaurant supplies.

loans.name: Ramzan's Group

texts.en:
Ramzan belongs to the city of Lahore, which is the second largest city of Pakistan. She is 39 years old and married to M. M., who runs a small restaurant in the market where he offers food, bread and tea to his clients. He sells Punjabi dishes in his restaurant such as chanay (made with chickpeas) and Daal chawal (made with rice and lentils and served with pickle). His food is liked by his customers and they have become his regular customers because he has been serving them for the past 21 years.
  
She owns a three-room brick house in the area called Mughalpura and has been living in it with her family. She is the mother of five sons and a daughter. Her two elder sons help their father in his business while her younger children are enrolled in school and are getting an education. 

Ramzan supports her family financially by doing embroidery works for her neighboring clients. She does this work at her home. She is very good at her art and knows different techniques of embroidery that enable her to craft different embroidered designs on clothes to make them look good and attractive. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy food items like spices, lentils, cooking oil, rice and chick peas in bulk quantity for his restaurant business. The bulk material will enable him to serve better food to his client and increase his sales.
  
She is a new loan applicant and is hopeful that it will be a good experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Ramzan.

loans.use: To buy food items in bulk quantity for a restaurant business

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a resident of Lahore, which is the second largest city of Pakistan. She is a seamstress who earns a living for her family by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. 

She lives in the area named Mughalpura in a three-room brick house with her family. She is the mother of five children. Her eldest daughter does embroidery while her younger children are enrolled in school and getting an education. 

Her husband drives an auto rickshaw through which he offers transport facilities to his passengers. He drives a rented rickshaw and because of this, he can’t work for long periods of time and also has to pay rent to the owner of the rickshaw; that’s why Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a rickshaw for her husband. 

She is hopeful that with his own rickshaw, her husband will be able to make his job better and work for longer hours to earn more income. Shamim is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her family. 

Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Shamim.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida lives in the second largest city of Pakistan called Lahore. She is a talented 35-year-old lady. She carries out the responsibilities of a housewife and handles her sewing and embroidery business as well. She started her business five years ago to support her family financially. She receives orders from her neighbors and earns good money by completing them on time. With her earnings, she pays the utilities expenses of her family and allows her husband to relax on this. 

Shahida is the mother of five children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting an education. Her husband has a business selling stamp papers (legal documents to use for legal works). He has been serving his clients for the past 15 years.

Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy stamp papers in large quantity which will help increase his sales and earn more income as well. 

Shahida is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes that it will become beneficial for her husband’s business. In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Shahida.

loans.use: To buy stamp papers for reselling

loans.name: Imilya

texts.en:
Imilya is divorced. She sells various kinds of clothing - jeans, socks, sportswear, etc., at a downtown market in the city of Berdyansk. She has been in this business for three years and, in this short time, has been able to develop her business well. She has very good business location, a large assortment of inventory and many repeat clients. Her income is about 4,000 Grivnas per month.

Imilya would like to borrow 10,000 Grivnas to purchase seasonal inventory. She loves her job and does it well. She hopes to develop her business further and increase her volume of customers even more.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is married with grown-up children. She sells various hardware items – locks, abrasives, heaters, etc., at a hardware market in Berdyansk town. She started this business only one year ago but enjoys retail business and would like to develop it further.

Vera is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to purchase more inventory. She hopes, as a result, to receive additional income and invest most of it back in her business. She believes that hard work and a large selection will help her business to grow further.

loans.use: To increase her assortment

loans.name: Danial

texts.en:
Danial is a 21-year-old single man from Chtoura, Lebanon, who has worked as a barber since 2003. He's a hardworker and his clients are most of his friends, family members, neighbors and, of course, friends of friends. His love of his work is the secret of his success.

This is the first time that Danial has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs the loan to buy new chairs for his barbershop in addition to necessary hairdressing tools.

Danial hopes to own a bigger barbershop so that he can include a women’s hairdressing and beauty salon section.

loans.use: To buy new chairs and hairdressing tools for his barbershop

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 35-year-old married man living in Chtoura with his wife and three children.

Fadi has worked in transportation since 2003; he owns a small van that he uses to transport people all over the country, in addition to providing trips for tourists. His clients like working with him because of his good reputation among others in the same field.

Fadi is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay for his van's registration. His van is his only source of living and he works hard on keeping it legal and up-to-date as much as he can.

Fadi hopes he can open a travel agency in the future where he will own a number of vans with the aim of providing organized trips for tourists all over Lebanon.

loans.use: To pay for his van's registration

loans.name: Solid Teachers Development Initiative-Mityana Group

texts.en: Patrick K. is a teacher by profession and belongs to the solid teacher’s development initiative group-Mityana. He started teaching last year after graduate school. Patrick describes himself as calm, collected, forthright and pro-active. These are virtues he says jump started his progress in the teaching business. He teaches mostly in schools around Kikumbi-Mityana. Patrick, who comes across as a jolly and humorous gentleman, also sells cash crops like coffee and maize to supplement the relatively paltry remuneration he gets as a teacher. In a week, out of his cash crop sales his reckoning is that he makes 40,000 shillings. Patrick has no children and is still single but prefers not to divulge his age, insisting he is an adult and that is what matters. With this loan he says he wants to purchase a cow. With this cow he says he will be able to get milk that he will sell and presumably if the cow gives birth to other calves he will be able to plan to sell them when they grow so as to expand on his business profits.

loans.use: The purchase of a cow.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou S. est une femme mariée. Elle est âgée de 46 ans et  habite à Dalifort. 	-
Elle est informaticienne de profession car ayant subi une formation en informatique. Mais sa préoccupation actuellement consiste à gérer un salon de coiffure dont elle est propriétaire. Et ce qui l’attire surtout dans cette activité c’est le fait d’échanger avec la clientèle et de les rendre service. Madame S.  emploie des jeunes filles  qui sont très  engagées dans le travail. Sur la photo on peut les voir au travail et Madame S. est celle qui est vêtue  en boubou rouge. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Dalifort  depuis 06 mois. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs, montant avec lequel elle envisage acheter des produits pour les besoins du salon de coiffure en vue de  préparer les fêtes de Korite, de Tabaski et de fin d’année. Selon elle ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter son capital, d’accroitre ses revenus et d’améliorer sa situation familiale.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fayou S. is a married woman. She is 46 years old and lives in Dalifort. She has been trained as a computer operator. However, her profession is owning and managing a hair dressing salon. What attracts her most to this business is the socializing and servicing her customers. Mrs. S. hires young women who are dedicated to this work. In the photo we can see them and Mrs. S. who is dressed in red. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 FRS, an amount with which she expects to buy products that she needs for her hair dressing salon in anticipation of the Korite, Tabaski and year end holidays. According to her, this loan will increase her working capital, earn revenue and improve her family situation.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her hair dressing salon

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for the last twenty years and her mixed farm produces tea, tomatoes, maize, beans, vegetables and milk which she sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority and at the local market. She also earns income from the sale of clothes in the local market. Her biggest challenges are bad debts, which pull back her business, the high cost of pesticides, and transportation problems.

Cicilia is 39 years old. She is married with five school-aged children.

Cicilia recently completed her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 90,000 KES to expand her cereals business and her dairy farming. The income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of her family.

In the future, Cicilia plans to purchase a van that will help her transport her products to the market and help her to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To expand her cereals business and her dairy farming

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 41-year-old married mother of five school-aged children. She is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for 20 years and employs four farmhands. Her mixed farm produces maize, beans, milk, tomatoes, bananas, sugarcane and tea (which she sells at the local market and through Kenya Tea Development Authority). She also earns income from her salon and barber shop business and from the sale of paraffin.

Jane has requested this loan of 90,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her cereals business and horticultural farming. The proceeds from these investments will help her pay school fees for her children and expand her businesses. She plans to expand her banana and sugarcane farming and sell bananas and black sugar large scale. Her biggest challenges are the high cost of pesticides, unpredictable weather conditions, and sometimes her products are not enough to enable her to benefit from the economies of scale.

loans.use: To expand her cereal business and horticultural farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a dairy farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya. He has been farming for the last 10 years. His mixed farm produces milk which, he sells through Kenya Cooperative Creameries, and tea which he sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority. He is 37 years old and married with a nine-year-old child who is currently in school.

John has requested this loan of 60,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter and a water pump. He says that these assets will help save time looking for animal feed and water so increasing production. His biggest challenges are poor markets and lack of enough funds to purchase a pure breed since they are very expensive. In future, he hopes to process and package his own milk.

He comments that Juhudi is doing a commendable job with small-scale farmers by funding their projects.

loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter and a water pump.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for ten years and employs 4 farmhands. Her mixed farm produces maize, milk, beans, bananas and tea which she sells locally and through Kenya Tea Development Authority. She also earns income from her computer service business and posho mill -- used to grind wheat into flour. Susan is 57 years old. She is married with 8 adult children. Her youngest child is currently in school.

Susan recently repaid her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000KES and has requested this loan of 70,000KES to purchase a dairy cow and expand her horticultural farming. She says the income from this loan will enable her to pay school fees for her son and expand her computer service business. She hopes that in five years time, she will have at least 7 dairy cows and be able to practice large-scale horticultural farming.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and expand her horticultural farming.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has been practicing mixed farming in Kisii town, western Kenya for 25 years. His farm produces bananas, beans, maize, milk, and tea which he sells locally and through Kenya Tea Development Authority. He is also employed as a casual laborer. He is 49 years old and married with six children between the ages of six and 22. Four of the children attend school.

He recently repaid his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 35,000KES and has requested 50,000KES to engage in horticultural farming. He mainly wants to specialize in tomatoes farming. He says the income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children and improve his family's standard of living. In future, he plans to acquire a van to help him transport produce from the farm to the market. His primary challenges are fluctuation in the price of milk, market competition, changes in weather conditions, diseases and transportation problems.

loans.use: To engage in horticultural farming.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson has been operating his mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya for fifteen years. His farm produces maize, beans, bananas, milk and vegetables which he sells locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to answer the basic needs of his family. He is 58 years old and married with six school-aged children.

Nelson has requested this loan of 55,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his cereals business. He says the extra income from this loan will enable him meet the basic demands of his family and build his business. He plans to acquire a van to transport his cereals and increase his stock by opening a cereals bank. His major challenges are diseases, market competition, poor transport network, and lack of enough capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his cereals business.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a resident of Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She is a seamstress who sews clothes for her neighborhood clients to contribute to her family finances. She is the mother of three sons and a daughter. Her husband is a motor mechanic. He has been operating his own motor workshop in the market for the last eight years. Her eldest son works as an accountant in a private company after completing his bachelor’s degree. 
Her younger children are getting their education and studying in different grades. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his business. With the loan, he will buy the latest repair tools and vehicle spare parts to provide better services to his customers and to increase his income. 

Nasreen is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan. In the previous year, she has proved herself a responsible person who has always paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy tools and spare parts for motor workshop

loans.name: Janipher

texts.en:
Janipher is 49 years old. She is married and has been blessed with four children who are between the ages of 11 and 27. Two of the children attend school. She is a dairy farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for 15 years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces maize, milk, beans, nappier grass and bananas, which she sells locally. She is also employed as a teacher.

She has requested this loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to start poultry farming. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children and meet the basic needs of her family. Her primary challenges are diseases and lack of security. She would like to own a butchery in the future.

loans.use: To start poultry farming

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en: Bushra belongs to a city called Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She is a 45-year-old lady who owns a small house with two rooms in the area named Mughalpura. She is the mother of six children. Her first three sons operate a dairy business in a market. They own a dairy shop and serve a good clientele base. They have been in this business for the last five years. Presently, they have two buffalos who give them 20kg milk per day and they sell 1kg milk for 45 PKRs, which has become the standard amount in every city.  The remaining two sons and a daughter are illiterate, stay at home and don’t do anything. She supports her family financially by selling clothes. She purchases clothes from the wholesale markets in Lahore named “Ichra and AnarkA.” and sells them to her local area. Her earning allows her to pay for the utilities. Her husband's name is A. A. and he is a daily-wage labor.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, they will buy another buffalo and increase the milk production for their dairy business. Bushra is hopeful that her sons will be able to expand their business and increase their income. She is a new user of Asasah and hopes that it will be a good and profitable experience for her son's business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya.  He has been practicing mixed farming for 20 years and produces tea, which he sells through the Kenya Tea Development Authority. His mixed farm also produces beans and Napier grass, which he sells locally.

Samwel is 41 years old. He is married with five children who are all adults. His youngest child attends school.

Samwel has requested this loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says that this loan will enable him to acquire a good quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production. He will therefore be able to provide enough milk for domestic consumption and increase the family's income through the sale of milk.

His primary challenges are diseases and high market competition. In the future, he would like to acquire three quality dairy cows and plant Napier grass on a large scale. He also hopes to continue partnering with Juhudi because it has helped him to access loans cheaply.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gulshan Majeed's Group

texts.en:
Gulshan Majeed (shown in the photo raising her hand) lives in Lahore, Pakistan, where she owns a small three-room house in which she dwells with her family in the area named Mughalpura. A 48-year-old housewife and businesswoman, she manages her household responsibilities and her embroidery business very well. Married to M. H., 54, Gushan has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is illiterate and operates a tire shop in the market, selling a variety of tires and contributing to his family financially. Her younger son and daughter are in 9th and 5th standard respectively.

Gulshan operates her embroidery business to support her family financially, receiving regular orders from her neighbors and relatives, thus earning good income. She has five years of experience in this business and is very good at her art. Her embroidery techniques make her unique among other business women in her neighborhood.

Gulshan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her business in order to buy items such as beads, colored thread, laces and clothes in bulk quantity which will help her fulfill larger orders on time and earn good profit. This will be her second loan from Asasah, with whom she has maintained good credit behavior and flawless attendance at meetings.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items for embroidery business

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah has been operating her mixed farm in Kisii, western Kenya for ten years. Her farm produces maize, beans and bananas which she sells locally. She is 51 years old and a widowed mother of 11 children who are between the ages of 2 and 25. Ten of the children are currently attending school.

Annah has requested this loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow, which will enable her to provide her family with enough milk for consumption and sale. The extra income from the sale of milk will help her meet her family's basic needs. Her primary challenges are insecurity, lack of enough capital for expansion and fluctuations in the prices of her products. In five years time, she plans to acquire 3 more dairy cows and start a cereals business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Vehicle repairs & conversion of his vehicle to run on natural gas

loans.name: Perla Marisol

texts.es: La señora Perla Marisol es madre de 2 niños adolescentes, y es muy trabajadora, ella trabaja en una casa de empeño de la localidad, su esposo el Señor Juan Antonio, le ayuda en el hogar, ya que hace poco se quedo sin trabajo, aunque en unos días empieza en un nuevo trabajo. Ellos necesitan de este préstamo para impermeabilizar su vivienda, ya que con las lluvias se trasmite la humedad y daña las paredes de su casa.
texts.en:
Perla Marisol is a hardworking mother of 2 adolescent children. She works in a pawn shop in her area. Her husband, Juan Antonio, helps her with the house, since he recently lost his job, although in a few days he will start a new job. They need this loan to weatherproof their home, since when it rains moisture seeps into the house and damages the walls of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to weatherproof their home

loans.name: Ruth Cinthia

texts.es:
La señora Ruth Cinthia A. G. se dedica al servicio de expendio de comidas, tiene 39 años, vive por zona de Pacata Alta de la ciudad de Cochabamba, tiene 3 hijos se encuentra divorciada desde hace 5 años, su ex esposo, no responde económicamente con la responsabilidad de sus pequeños hijos.

Es así que Ruth empezó a dedicarse al negocio de ventas de comidas en una pensión en la parada de autobuses donde todos los choferes acuden, y tiene clientes ya fijos ella solo atiende comidas de media mañana y almuerzos, donde sirve casi 50 platos diarios, y por la tarde se dedica a atender a sus hijos.
Ruth tiene un don para preparar platos de comidas muy agradables al paladar, razón por la cual, la demanda  a crecido pero, ya no cuenta con la capacidad de atender a sus clientes, es la razón por la que se apersono a solicitar un crédito, para realizar ampliación en la cocina y poder satisfacer la demanda, lo que le generara mejores ingresos, e incrementara su calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth Cinthia A. G. works in food sales. She is 39 years old and lives in the Pacata Alta area of the city of Cochabamba. She has 3 children and has been divorced for 5 years. Her ex-husband does not take financial responsibility for his small children.  

That is why Ruth started in the business of selling food by a bus stop where the drivers gather. She has regular customers. She only serves food from mid-morning through lunchtime. She serves 50 meals a day and in the afternoon cares for her children.  

Ruth has a gift for preparing meals that are very pleasing to the palette. That is why the demand has grown and she no longer has the capacity to serve her customers. That is the reason that she applied for a loan to enlarge her kitchen and meet the demand. This will bring her more income and will increase her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Operating capital, investment for better infrastructure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Put bars on the front of his house

loans.name: Rosa Albina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Albina se dedica la producción de leche cruda, ella cuenta con 36 años de edad, tiene un hijo que tiene 15 años, viven en la zona de la Maica central, localidad ubicada en la periferie de la ciudad de Cochabamba, es una zona agrícola.

La señora Rosa cuenta con 5 cabezas de ganado lechero de las cuales logra producir 15 litros de leche cruda de cada vaca, con toda esa producción de leche elabora quesillos que los comercializa en los mercados populares de la ciudad de Cochabamba, a precios muy accesibles, siendo así que logra terminar de vender toda su producción todos los días, antes del  medio día, razón por la que no tiene problemas para la comercialización de su producto. La señora Rosa con ayuda de su hijo se dedican solos a la producción y elaboración de quesillos, al cuidado de las vacas, su alimentación y su pastoreo.
texts.en: Mrs. Rosa Albina works with the production of fresh milk.  She is 36 years old and has a 15 year old son.  They live in the central zone of Maica on the outskirts of the city of Cochabamba, in an agricultural area.  Rosa has 5 dairy cows that each produce 15 liters of milk that she uses to make cheese to sell in the markets in Cochabamba for a very reasonable price.  She currently sells out of her products each day before noon because she has no problems selling.  Rosa and her son are the only ones who work making the cheeses and caring for the cows (feeding and grazing).

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her dairy and banana farming

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Alma Rosa, y su esposo Carlos Javier, son una pareja muy unida, tienen un hijo adolescente, ella trabaja en una maquiladora y el en un centro comercial. 
Los dos son muy trabajadores y quieren mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo, solicitan este crédito ya que están construyendo un cuarto en la parte trasera de la casa y solo les hace falta el dinero para el techo de concreto, ellos les agradecen su ayuda.
texts.en:
Alma Rosa and her husband Carlos Javier are a very close couple. They have a teenage son. She works in a maquiladora (a factory), and he works in a shopping center. They are both very hardworking and want to improve their son's quality of life. They are asking for this loan because they are building a room onto the back of the house, and they need only the money for the concrete roof. They are grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora María es una mujer muy admirable, ya que trabaja de lunes a viernes en una maquiladora de la localidad, desde las 5:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde, solo tiene un hijo y hace tiempo se separo de su esposo, su hijo es adolescente y ella quiere darle la mejor educación posible, la señora María los fines de semana vende ropa usada, ella requiere de este crédito para terminar el techo de el frente de su casa, por que ahí mismo vende la ropa y en ese lugar es donde mas le da el sol.
texts.en:
María is a very admirable woman because she works Monday to Friday in a maquiladora [a factory] in the area, from 5:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon. She has only one son, and some time ago she separated from her husband. Her son is a teenager, and she wants to give him the best education possible. On the weekends María sells used clothing. She needs this loan to finish the roof in the front of her house. That is where she sells the clothing, and that place is the sunniest.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Concrete roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Constructing a room.

loans.name: Estela Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Estela y su esposo el señor Epifanio, son una pareja muy unida y trabajadora, ella trabaja como maestra en una escuela primaria y su esposo, es propietario de un Cyber café. Entre los dos solventan los gastos del hogar. Ellos necesitan el dinero de este crédito para colocar un portón al frente de la vivienda, ya que temen por la seguridad de las computadoras que tienen en el Cyber café
texts.en:
Estela and her husband, Epifanio, are a close-knit and hard-working couple. She works as a teacher in an elementary school and her husband is the owner of a Cyber cafe. Between the two of them, they are able to pay their housing expenses. They need money from this loan to place a gate at the front of their house since they worry about the security of the computers that they have in the Cyber cafe.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Place a gate at the front of her house.

loans.name: Veronica Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia D. 30 años D. edad, se dedica a la preparación y venta D. tortillas, está casada y vive con sus esposo quien es albañil y sus tres hijos D. 11, 9, 7 años D. edad, ellos residen en el Municipio D. Jucuapa Departamento D. Morazán; Patricia aprendió este oficio por su madre que también se dedicaba a este negocio, ella trabaja desD. hace seis años D. lunes a domingo. Patricia necesita un préstamo y lo solicita para la compra D. leña y maíz que son su materia prima para la preparación D. tortillas. Esta inversión ayudara a que encuentre mejores precios en el mercado pues su idea es comprar por grandes cantidades que le permita tener un inventario por varios meses.
Sus sueños son comprar una cocina con plancha para hacer las tortillas y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios para mejorar sus condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
Patricia is 30 years old and engages in the preparation and sale of tortillas. She is married and lives with her husband who works as a mason. Her children are 11, 9, and 7 years of age. Patricia resides in the town of Jucuapa in the Department of Morazán. She learned the business from her mother who also engaged in the same activity. Patricia has worked Monday through Sunday for the past six years.

She needs a loan in order to buy firewood and corn, which are the supplies used for making tortillas. This investment will help her get better prices at the market since she will be able to buy in larger quantities, thereby allowing her to acquire an inventory that will last several months. Her dreams incluD. purchasing a stove with a griddle for making tortillas and seeing her children finish their studies so that they can improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase firewood & corn

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 58 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 6 children who are all adults. One of her children is currently attending school. She is a farmer in Nkubu, eastern Kenya. She has been farming for the last 36 years and employs two farmhands. Her mixed farm produces tea, which she sells through the Kenya Tea Development Authority, milk, macadamia nuts, potatoes, bananas, coffee and French beans, which she sells to the Homegrown Company.

Anastasia has requested this loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her horticultural farming. She says that the income from this project will help her improve the livelihood of her family. In the future, she plans to expand her farming and buy a pick-up van that will assist her in transporting her products to the market. Her biggest challenges are lack of markets for her products, the high cost of pesticides and poor road networks. She comments that Juhudi has helped farmers view their occupation as a source of livelihood for their families.

loans.use: to expand her horticultural farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Concrete roof.

loans.name: Camino Al Cielo Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Camino al Cielo lo conforman Ana María Garmendia H., Johana del Socorro F. García y Azucena del Carmen M.. Ana se dedica a la elaboración de Nacatamales todos los viernes, ella inició este negocio desde hace 13 años elaborando apenas unos pocos productos, hoy elabora 2 o 3 veces más de lo fabricaba en un principio.

Johana tiene un ventecita en su casa de habitación, ella con apenas 23 años está incursionando en el mundo de los negocios pues apenas hace 4 meses que inició este proyecto. Azucena se dedica a la venta de pollo, carnes y gaseosas en su casa de habitación desde hace más de 1 año, cuando decidió dejar de trabajar como empleada doméstica.
texts.en:
The Camino al Cielo solidarity group consists of Ana María Garmendia H., Johana del Socorro F. García and Azucena del Carmen M.. Ana makes Nacatamales (Nicaraguan corn tamales, that are larger with more filling than Mexican tamales) every Friday; she started her business 13 years ago with few sales. Today, she makes 2 or 3 times as many products as she did when she first started. Johana opened a small store in her home 4 months ago. Just 23 years old, this is her first venture into business. Azucena sells poultry, meat and sodas. It has been more than a year since she left her job as a domestic helper to start her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: En cerdo, maiz, cebolla, chiltoma, especies

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El señor Esteban trabaja en una maquiladora de la localidad y su esposa la señora Claudia, es ama de casa y se queda al cuidado de su hija, solo tienen una niña pequeña, pero los dos quieren darle lo mejor que puedan. Hace poco tiempo adquirió el señor Esteban una casa de interés social, pero es chica de una sola recamara, para la mayor comodidad de su hija quieren construir un cuarto mas en la vivienda. Ese cuarto será destinado para la habitación de la pequeña niña.
texts.en:
Mr. Esteban works in a local maquiladora [foreign-owned assembly plant] and his wife, Claudia, is a housewife who stays at home to care for their daughter. They only have one little girl, but they both want to give her the best they can. A short time ago, Esteban acquired a publicly-subsidized house, but it is small and only has one bedroom. To make his daughter more comfortable, he wants to build another room onto their home. This room is meant to be his young daughter's bedroom.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build a bedroom for his young daughter

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad lives in the mid-sized city of Vehari, which is known for its agriculture industry. She owns a 3 room brick house where she has been living with her family for over 20 years. She is 42 years old and the mother of five sons and two daughters. Her husband is illiterate and is involved in the animal selling business. He also owns a small piece of land where he grows wheat and sells it to his customers. Irshad's eldest son has a mobile phone shop where he sells used mobile phones to his customers. The other two sons work in the field along with their father, helping him grow wheat. Her other children are very young and are getting their education from a local school.

Irshad has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her eldest son’s business. He will use the loan to buy used mobile phone sets to sell in his shop. Irshad is hopeful that her son will be able to successfully improve his business by making this investment in it. Irshad is a new loan applicant with Asasah and she is hopeful that it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: to buy used mobile phones

loans.name: Las Chavalas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Las Chavalas lo conforman tres mujeres emprendedoras y jóvenes que se dedican a distintas actividades económicas pero que comparten un mismo sueño el cual es sacar adelante sus negocios. Estela G. G., coordinadora del grupo vende ropa usada de manera ambulante en Nindirí y comunidades aledañas, ella hace 6 años tenía una pulpería pero no pudo seguir en la atención de dicho negocio, su esposo trabaja en Costa Rica y se llevó con él a 4 de sus hijos, en cambio ella es la responsable de los 2 menores, su sueño es que su familia esté unida y prosperada.

María se dedica a la compra/venta de frutas, comprando al por mayor y vendiendo al menudeo de manera ambulante es como ella ha conseguido salir adelante; por último Reyna tiene una fábrica de tortilla en su hogar, lugar en el cual ha conseguido vender pinol y pinolillo por encargo desde hace 1 año.
texts.en:
The "Las Chavalas" solidarity group is made up of three young, enterprising women who engage in distinct economic activities but share a common dream of getting ahead through their businesses. Estela G. G., the group coordinator, sells used clothing on foot in Nindirí and surrounding communities. Six years ago, she had a small grocery store, but she could not continue taking care of that business, as her husband works in Costa Rica and brought four of their children with him. Estela is responsible for the two youngest. Her dream is for her family to be together and prosperous. María works buying and selling fruits. She buys wholesale and sells retail, as an itinerant vendor. This is how she has managed to succeed. Finally, Reyna has a tortilla factory in her home. For the last year, she has also managed to sell pinol and pinolillo [a sweet cornmeal and cacao-based traditional drink] on order from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock basic grains, meat, etc.

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon has been practicing mixed farming for the last 22 years and employs three farmhands. He has a mixed farm in Kisii, western Kenya that produces  maize, beans, tea and millet which he sells both locally and through the Kenya Tea Development Authority. He also depends on his monthly pension to cater for his family's basic needs.

Zablon is 54 years old. He is married with 5 children who are between the ages of 15 and 28. Four of the children attend school.

Zablon recently repaid his previous loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 70,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. He says the income from the sale of milk will help him pay his children's school fees and improve their livelihood. In the future, he would like to expand his dairy farming by acquiring 4 more dairy cows. His primary challenges are lack of enough animal feed, lack of qualified artificial insemination and lack of markets for his milk. He would like Juhudi to continue organizing trainings for the farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima lives in the mid-sized city of Vehari, in Pakistan. Vehari is known for its agricultural industry. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for the past 10 years. She is 35 years old and married to S. A., who is 36 years of age and runs a grocery shop in the market. Ghulam Fatima has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son works with his father in the grocery shop while her other two children are getting their education in 8th and 5th standards. Her youngest daughter is only 5 years old and has not yet started to attend school. 

Ghulam Fatima herself is a caring lady who prefers to spend her time at home managing the household chores and taking care of her family. She is an uneducated lady but wants to give her school-going children a good education so they never face the problems which she faces in her life and to make their lives better for the future. 

Ghulam Fatima has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy groceries for his grocery shop. She hopes that this investment will change her husband’s business condition from good to better and his household income will be increased. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and plans to work with Asasah on a long-term basis.

In the photo, group member Bashiran is displaying a shawl from her shawl-selling business.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María del carmen, es soltera solo vive con su mama, ella mantiene los gastos de la casa, ella trabaja en una tienda, en el departamento de ventas. Con las lluvias que han caído aquí en la cuidad se daño el techo de su vivienda, es por eso que esta solicitando este crédito para mandarlo reparar, ya que se pronostican lluvias muy intensas y teme por la seguridad de ella y su madre.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is single and lives only with her mother. She takes care of the household expenses. She works in the sales department of a store. The roof of her home has been damaged by the rains that have fallen here in the city. So, she is requesting a loan to have it repaired, as very heavy rains are predicted to fall and she fears for her and her mother's safety.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair the roof on her home

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is a resident of a mid-sized city called Vehari (known for its agriculture industry) in Pakistan. She is a 47-year-old lady who lives in a single room house with her husband and three children. Her husband operates a business selling fertilizer and seeds. He has a good number of clients who give him good orders. He earns a good amount by fulfilling their orders on time. 

All of her three children are involved in making & selling bread. They operate tandoors (a kind of oven made of mud and burn with fire in it) in different locations in the market and sell bread to their customers. They all started doing this work in a very early age to contribute to their family financially. They had to quit school after completing the 5th standard. Since that time, they have been working for their family and making their parents proud.  
Khursheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy seeds & fertilizer in large quantity to meet his customer's orders and to earn good profit on it. She is a new loan applicant and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds & fertilizer to sell

loans.name: La Iglesia Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario La Iglesia lo integran Darling Rodríguez C. de 35 años, Nestor José C., Gilma Estela Rodríguez y Maryen Griselda Guzmán H.. Darling, quien es la coordinadora del grupo decidió hace 3 años que debía ayudar a salir adelante a su familia y fue así como inició una pequeña fritanga los fines de semana, ella empezó con pocas cosas pues no tuvo ningún apoyo económico, sin embargo después de obtener el primer crédito su negocio empezó a tener una mayor vida y ahora además de las comidas vende verduras en su hogar.

Nestor es chofer de una caponera desde hace 3 años, Gilma vende comidas en los campos de beisbol cercanos a su hogar los días domingos y Maryen vende verduras y productos de la compañía AVON desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The members of "La Iglesia" ["The Church"] solidarity group are Darling Rodríguez C., who is 35 years old, Nestor José C., Gilma Estela Rodríguez, and Maryen Griselda Guzmán H.. Darling, who is the coordinator of the group, decided three years ago that she should help her family to get ahead. This is how she came to start a small business selling fried foods on the weekends. She started with very little because she didn't have any economic support, but after she received her first loan, her business started doing better. Now, along with foods, she sells vegetables from her house. Nestor has driven a motorcycle taxi for three years. Gilma sells food on Sundays at the baseball fields near her house. Maryen has sold vegetables and Avon brand products for two years.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock basic grains, meat, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Abu. He is married and has two children aged 10 and 7. He has three additional dependents who live with him because they help him in the shop.  In 2006, Abu established his provision shop business. He began his business because he realized he needed a source of income to take care of his children. Working 6 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 2,217,600 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL. Abu has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy drinks, top-up (phone cards), soap, and milk. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 221,760 SLL. In the future, Abu plans to establish his business to the highest peak and build another house for his children. He spends on medical but not much. He plans to re-invest the profit so that the shop will grow. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drinks, top-up, soap, milk, sugar, butter etc.

loans.name: Moray

texts.en: This is 48-year-old Moray.  He is married and has four children aged 21, 17, 13, and 2. He has five additional dependents who live with him because they are all sons and daughters of his brothers and sisters in the village where they lack formal education facilities.  In 1983, Moray established his clothing and shoes business. He began his business because he was trained by his elder brother to do business. His previous loans have enabled him to build a house, educate his children and acquire some assets. The profit he gains is the favorite part of the business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 2,654,820 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL. Moray has already received and successfully repaid previous loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy more shoes, jeans and shirts. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. In the future, Moray plans to build another house and establish a business on a large scale. Moray is hard working and very honest. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional shoes, jeans and shirts

loans.name: Flor Del Bosque Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Flor de Bosque se encuentra conformado por Johana de los Ángeles T. Guzmán, Daysy del Rosario González Rodríguez, Isaura del Carmen C. B. y Pedro Rolando Gaitán Guzmán. Johana como medio de subsistencia se dedica a la fabricación y venta de comidas en especial fritangas los días viernes, sábados y domingos; esto desde hace 4 años.

Daysy, vende frutas en el mercado Oriental del departamento de Managua, vende todo tipo de frutas pero en su mayoría la de la temporada ya sean estas naranjas, melones, piñas, pitahayas, entre otras. Isaura tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación la cual es pequeña pero consigue de ahí para el pan de cada día; así mismo Pedro tiene también una pequeña pulpería la cual a pesar de ser pequeña es el principal sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
The members of the "Flor de Bosque" ["Flower of the Forest"] solidarity group are Johana de los Ángeles T. Guzmán, Daysy del Rosario González Rodríguez, Isaura del Carmen C. B. y Pedro Rolando Gaitán Guzmán. To earn a livelihood, Johana makes and sells foods, especially fried foods, on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. She has been doing this for four years. Daysy sells fruits in the West market of the department of Managua. She sells all types of fruits, but in this season, she sells mostly oranges, melons, pineapples, dragon fruit, and others. Isaura has a pulpería [small grocery store] in her house. It is small but this is how she brings home the bread each day. Likewise, Pedro also has a small pulpería which, despite being small, is the principal livelihood of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock basic grains, meat, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional drinks

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 38 years old. She is married to a civil servant and has three children, aged 14, 11 and 5 years. Two of her children are secondary-school pupils and the youngest is in a preparatory school. 

Fatmata started her business in 1995. For the past years, she has been selling ready-made items such as jeans, T-shirts and pants. Her business is located in the Cotton Tree Market, Makeni. Fatmata started this business for her to be able to generate enough profit to help her husband provide livelihood and other support needed for their family. Fatmata works seven days a week and 11 hours daily. On average, Fatmata earns 1,750,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) monthly from her business.

Fatmata has a very good loan repayment history. She needs a loan of 3,000,000SLL to help her buy jeans, T-shirts and dresses for kids. She intends to use the proceeds from this loan to educate her children and reinvest in her business. She thanks you for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy more jeans, T-shirts and pants for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more rubber utensils and sets of dishes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes and wax cotton for her business

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos el mayor de 14 años y el menor de 5 años, residen en el Cantón Corralito del departamento de Morazán; Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace dos años y la forma de vender es a través de catalogo en los cantones cercanos, este negocio fue iniciativa propia siempre viendo la forma de tener ingresos para su familia.
Ella necesita invertir es por eso que solicita un préstamo para comprar cosméticos por mayor como labiales, rímel, cremas  y distribuir a los clientes, esto ayudara a que María no pierda sus clientes sino por el contrario pueda ofrecerles variedad de productos de belleza.
Entre las aspiraciones de María están: ver que su negocio crezca, aumenten sus clientes, mejoren sus ingresos y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old and lives with her husband and four children. Her oldest child is 14 years old while her youngest is 5 years old. They reside in the canton of Corralito in the Department of Morazán. María has been selling cosmetics for two years and offers her products by catalog in the neighboring cantons. She started this business out of her own initiative so that she could generate income for her family.

María needs this loan so that she can purchase cosmetics in bulk such as lipsticks, mascaras, and crèmes to distribute to her customers. This will keep María from losing customers because she will be able to offer them a variety of beauty products. Her aspirations include seeing her business grow, increasing her customer base, improving her income, and providing her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase lipsticks, mascaras, and crèmes

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es:
Doña Ana de 60 años de edad, reside en Concepción Batres, Usulután y vive con su hijo de 28 años y un nieto, ella se dedica a este negocio por la ayuda de una amiga a quien doña Ana le trabajaba y para realizarlo es ayudada por otra amiga, ella no posee horario y cuenta con la preferencia de varios clientes.
Doña Ana desea seguir trabajando es por eso que solicita un préstamo para invertir y aumentar su producción, ella comprara leche en grandes cantidades para poder realizar su venta; Esto le ayudara pues contando con Leche ella podrá preparar más productos derivados de esta como queso, mantequilla y quesillo para cubrir con la demanda de sus clientes y atender a nuevas personas.
El sueño de ella es ser distribuidora mayorista de productos lácteos en Concepción Batres.
texts.en:
Doña Ana is 60 years old and resides in Concepción Batres, Department of Usulután. She lives with her 28 year old son and a grandson. Ana learned this business from a friend for whom she worked. Now that she has her own business, Doña Ana has another friend who works as her assistant. She does not have a set schedule and is preferred by many different customers.

Doña Ana wants to continue working, so she is requesting a loan to invest in and increase her production. She plans to buy milk in large quantities so that she can complete her sales. By having more milk, she will be able to prepare more daily products such as cheese, butter, and cheese balls to meet the demand of her customers and to attract new clients.

Her dream is to become a wholesale distributor of dairy products in Concepción Batres.

loans.use: Purchase milk

loans.name: Elisa Abigail

texts.es:
Elisa tiene 25 años y se dedica a la venta de pescado y tamales, vive con sus padre y tres hermanos también es madre soltera de 3  hijos de las edades de 9, 7 y 5 años, sus hijos dependen únicamente de los ingresos de Elisa, Ella comenzó este negocio porque su hermana le aconsejo ya que ella también se dedica a la venta de pescado; Elisa vende los pescados por la mañana y por la tarde sale con la venta de tamales y los distribuye en los alrededores todos los días.
Ella necesita de un préstamo para la compra de más producto, por eso se ve en la necesidad de solicitarlo porque de invertir en más pescado y preparativos para tamales como Maíz, pollo y condimentos, ella podrá aumentar sus ventas ayudando a sus hijos en lo necesario.
Sus proyecciones son crecer con el negocio, tener un lugar fijo donde realizar sus ventas, ayudar al desarrollo de sus hijos y que estos se preparen para que puedan optar por una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Elisa is 25 years old and engages in the sale of fish and tamales. She lives with her parents and three siblings. Elisa is also a single mother with three children (ages 9, 7, and 5) who are solely dependent on her income. She started this business because her sister suggested that she do so and now she also sells fish. Elisa sells fish in the mornings and then sells tamales in the afternoons. She distributes her products in the surrounding neighborhoods every day.

Elisa needs a loan to buy more products. She needs to invest in more fish and ingredients for making tamales such as corn, chicken, and condiments. Elisa wants to increase her sales to provide what her children need. Her plans are to grow her business, have an established location where she can sell her products, help her children develop, and be prepared for improving her financial situation.

loans.use: Purchase fish, chicken, corn, and condiments

loans.name: Francisca Elizabeth

texts.es:
Francisca resiD. en Concepción Batres, departamento D. Usulután, tiene 35 años y vive junto a su familia, es madre soltera D. 4 hijos D. las edades 14, 13, 8 y 1 año, las dos hijas mayores le ayudan a desarrollar el trabajo que ella realiza que es la producción y venta D. lácteos, el negocio lo inicio hace 12 años con el apoyo D. una vecina para quien Francisca trabajaba, así logro colocar su propio negocio y lo atienD. todos los días sin horario fijo.
Francisca tiene la necesidad D. adquirir utensilios necesarios para el proceso D. producción y comprar la leche por cantidades mayores pero no cuenta con el dinero para dicha inversión, por lo que solicita un préstamo para poder solucionar su situación, con este préstamo ella compara los útiles como depósitos donD. moldear sus productos y podrá aumentar su producción ya que estos utensilios le harán mas rápido y fácil el trabajo.
El sueño D. Francisca es crecer con el negocio darse a conocer con más personas, contar con la preferencia D. los clientes y mejorar el nivel D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca resides in Concepción Batres in the Department of Usulután. She is 35 years old, a single mother, and lives with her four children (ages 14, 13, 8, and 1). Her two oldest daughters help with her business producing and selling dairy products. Francisca started her business twelve years ago with the help of a neighbor for whom she worked. She was able to establish her own business and manages it every day without being on a fixed schedule.

Francisca needs to acquire the necessary utensils for processing the milk that she buys in large quantities. However, she does not have the money needed to make this investment. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to resolve this situation. She plans to buy equipment, such as molds for shaping her products, so that she can increase her output. These tools will make it faster and easier for her to work.

Francisca dreams of growing her business until she becomes recognized among more people. This will allow her to be a preferred vendor among her customers and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase equipment needed to increase her output

loans.name: Sergio Alberto

texts.es:
Sergio de 30 años de edad, vive en Concepción Batres del departamento de Usulután, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 2 y 1 año de edad, el se dedica al enderezado y pintura de vehículos en su propio taller, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 5 años y lo aprendió por que trabajaba en otros talleres, el realiza sus trabajos con dos empleados que le ayudan, él tiene la dificultad de no contar con capital para invertir en repuestos y herramientas para el trabajo.
Él solicita de un préstamo para la compra de las herramientas necesarias para desarrollar su trabajo, con esta inversión el estará preparado para atender las demandas de sus clientes y darles un mejor servicio.
Las aspiraciones de Sergio son contar con las herramientas para realizar su trabajo, brindar un mejor servicio, ampliar su negocio y darle estabilidad; mejorar las condiciones de su familia y que estos cuenten con lo necesario para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Sergio is 30 years old and resides in Concepción Batres in the Department of Usulután. He lives with his wife and two children (ages 2 and 1). Sergio performs auto paint and body work in his own shop. He has owned his business for five years and learned this job while working at other repair shops. At his business, Sergio has two employees who help him. He has had difficulty acquiring the capital to invest in the parts and tools he needs for his work.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy the necessary tools to perform his job. With this investment, Sergio will be prepared to meet the demands of his customers and provide them better service. His aspirations include having the necessary equipment for his work, providing better service, expanding and stabilizing his business, and improving his family’s conditions so that they will have everything they need to develop.

loans.use: Purchase tools

loans.name: Ramon Alcides

texts.es:
Ramón de 26 años de edad, es empleado y reside en San Rafael Oriente del departamento de San Miguel donde vive con sus padres y hermanos, él es soltero y no tiene hijos, su trabajo es en una institución crediticia y él se encarga de realizar cobros a los clientes, Ramón desea mejorar su vivienda ya que le faltan algunas cosas para estar completa y así que su familia cuente con una mejor casa más segura.
Él Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción como arena, cemento y pagar albañil, este préstamo ayudara a realizar la mejora en la vivienda y que en temporada de invierno no les afecte a sus familiares.
Su proyección es mejorar su casa, tenerla en buenas condiciones para que su familia este protegida y segura.
texts.en:
Ramón is 26 years old, employed, and resides in San Rafael Oriente in the Department of San Miguel with his parents and siblings. He is single and does not have children. He works at a credit institution where he is in charge of collecting payments from the customers.

Ramón wants to improve his home, but he lacks a few things needed to complete the job so that his family can have a house that is more secure. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials, such as sand and cement, and to pay for a mason. This loan will help improve his home in time for the winter season so that the rest of his family will be protected. His plan is to improve his house until his family has good conditions that will keep them safe and secure.

loans.use: Pay for materials & labor necessary for home improvements

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Martha Luisa

texts.es: Martha Luisa P. tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, reside en la Aldea La Concepción en la Ciudad de Juticalpa, departamento de Olancho. El primer negocio de Martha fue la venta de ropa interior de forma ambulante, pero hace 30 años una de sus amigas le ensenó a confeccionar ropa de cama, cortinas, manteles, uniformes, faldas, blusas, pantalones y ahora ella cuenta con su propio taller de costura que está ubicado adentro de las instalaciones del Hospital San Francisco de Asís en la misma ciudad. Martha solicita el préstamo para comprar una cantidad grande de materia prima como telas, hilos, encajes, y elásticos, etc. de este modo podrá ofrecer a su clientes una variedad de productos a un precio accesible, ya que estos son personas de muy escasos recursos económicos que laboran y visitan el hospital. Una de las dificultades de Martha es que padece de presión alta y tiene que comprar todos los meses pastillas para mantener su presión estable. Su sueño es que su negocio siga prosperando y que su familia siempre permanezca unida. Ha sido clienta de FAMA por dos ciclos y con los préstamos obtenidos ha podido mantener su negocio y ha podido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Martha Luisa P. is 54 years old, married, and lives with her husband and three children in the village of La Concepción, which is in the city of Juticalpa, department of Olancho. The first business that Martha had was selling underclothes as an itinerant vendor, but 30 years ago, one of her friends taught her to make bed clothes, curtains, tablecloths, uniforms, skirts, blouses, pants, etc. Now she has her own sewing workshop, which is located in the facilities of the San Francisco de Asís Hospital in the same city where she lives. Martha is requesting this loan to buy a large quantity of raw materials like fabric, thread, lace, elastic, etc. In this way, she will be able to offer her customers a variety of products at accessible prices. Her customers are people of very scarce economic resources who work at or visit the hospital. One of the difficulties that Martha faces is that she suffers from high blood pressure and has to buy pills every month to keep her blood pressure stable. Her dream is that her business will continue to prosper and that her family will always remain together. She has been a client of FAMA for two cycles and the loans she has received have helped her to maintain her business and to be able to help her husband with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, lace, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Ana Cecilia E. L. tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos, y junto a sus dos hermanos reside en la Colonia Mina Guifarro en la ciudad de Juticalpa, departamento de Olancho. Es una joven que desde temprana edad ha tenido que trabajar porque su madre emigró a Estados Unidos de forma ilegal y alguien tenía que ayudar con los gastos familiares.
