Los fines de semana ella se dedica a vender de forma ambulante mercadería como ser sandalias, cosméticos, accesorios para mujer, y también ropa mixta, etc., y de lunes a viernes tiene un empleo fijo. Ana solicita el préstamo porque actualmente no tiene mucho inventario y necesita viajar a la ciudad de Tegucigalpa para comprar mercadería sobre todo estilos que están a la moda. Con el apoyo del préstamo ella podrá tener mayores ingresos porque obtendrá ganancias y con estas apoyará a sus hermanos ya que ambos están estudiando. Una de sus dificultades es que su madre está mal de salud y no puede estar cerca de ella para apoyarla. Sus anhelos son que la salud de su madre mejore, tener un local propio que sea amplio y bonito para poder exhibir su producto y que sus hermanos sean profesionales. Es su primer crédito en FAMA
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia E. L. is 25 years old, single, and does not have any children. She lives with her two siblings in Colonia Mina Guifarro, in the city of Juticalpa, department of Olancho. She is a young woman who has had to work since a young age because her mother immigrated to the United States without documents and someone had to take care of the household expenses. On weekends, she works as an itinerant vendor, selling merchandise like sandals, cosmetics, women's accessories, a variety of clothing, etc. From Monday to Friday, she has a steady job. Ana is requesting this loan because right now she does not have much inventory and she needs to travel to the city of Tegucigalpa to buy merchandise, especially items that are in style. With the help of this loan, she will be able to earn more income because she will make more of a profit, and will use this to support her siblings, who are both in school. One of the difficulties she faces is that her mother is in poor health and she can not be there to support her. Her greatest hopes are that her mother's health will improve; to have her own nice, spacious store to show her products; and that her siblings will become professionals. This is her first loan with FAMA.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing, sandals, cosmetics, women's accessories, etc.

loans.name: Santos Emilio

texts.es: Santos Emilio Munguía Ramos tiene 33 años de edad, reside en el Barrio El Centro, en el Municipio de San Esteban, Olancho. Vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y sus cuatro hijos de 9, 8, 6 y 3 años. Santos posee una pequeña pulpería que atiende todos los días desde las 6:00 am hasta las 8:00 pm. Él trabaja junto a su esposa con el deseo de poder brindarles a sus hijos todo lo básico y necesario para su sostenimiento. Él solicita este préstamo para poder comprar una mayor cantidad de productos y así mantener bien surtida su pulpería. Con el apoyo de este préstamo Santos podrá comprar al contado la mercadería que necesita para incrementar su inventario y así mejorar el precio de venta para sus clientes. Sus sueños son poder extender su negocio a otros lugares de la comunidad y obtener más ganancias para poder brindarles a sus hijos la educación que necesitan para tengan mejores oportunidades de desarrollarse en la vida.
texts.en:
Santos Emilio Munguía Ramos is 33 years old and lives in the neighborhood of El Centro in San Esteban municipality, Olancho. He lives with his wife, who takes care of the home, and their 4 children, ages 9, 8, 6, and 3. Santos owns a small store that he attends to everyday from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. He and his wife work hard, with the goal of providing for their children's basic needs. Santos requests this loan so that he can buy a greater quantity of products and keep his store well-stocked. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy merchandise at wholesale prices, so that he can increase his inventory while offering lower prices to this customers. Santos dreams of expanding his business to other locations in his community, thereby increasing his income and providing his children with the education they need to have better opportunities to develop in life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, lard, beans, rice, pasta, churros, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna G.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for breeding. She is 50 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Sto. Domingo. Edna has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Edna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Edna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Celia

Celia has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Celia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Celia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase products to sell. Celia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Analinda

texts.en: Analinda C. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 39 years old, married and has one school-aged child. They are from the village of Sto.Domingo. Analinda has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Analinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Analinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase products to sell. Analinda is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha B. is from the village of Sto. Domingo. She is 47 years old. Editha is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Editha sells used clothing in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Editha joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Editha is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Editha from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: To make a living, Editha R. fattens pigs for sale. She is 41 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from the village of Sto. Domingo. Editha has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Editha joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Editha is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more livestock to raise and sell. This will be her second loan from ASKI. loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes C. is from the village of Sto. Domingo. She is 59 years old. Mercedes is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedes sells clothing products in the local community. Mercedes has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Mercedes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mercedes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Mercedes from ASKI. loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen C. owns and operates a tailoring business providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She is 55 years old, married and has nine grown-up children. She is from the village of Sto. Domingo. Helen has been in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Helen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Helen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more fabrics and materials. This will be her fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly C., 38, is married and has five school-aged children. She is from the village of Santo Domingo within Quirino municipality, a part of Isabela province on the Luzon islands. Dolly runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Dolly has been in business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2007 Dolly joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Dolly is requesting a new loan, her eighth from ASKI, of 10,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc

texts.en:
Jeanne D'Arc is 37 years old, married and has five children between the ages of 5 and 22. All but her youngest are enrolled in school. Her husband constructs houses for a living.

For the last year, Jeanne D'Arc has been making and repairing shoes. With this loan’s proceeds she will purchase materials for making more shoes such as thread, leather, and shoe polish. The profits from her business will be used to pay her children’s school fees. In the future, Jeanne D'Arc hopes to be able to afford a machine that sews shoelaces.

loans.use: For materials for making more shoes

loans.name: Zoraida Ysabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Zoraida Benítez, es casada de 50 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, es comerciante, vive en el Barrio Villa Rossana de la ciudad de Ita.
 Se dedica al comercio hace mas de 17 años, posee una despensa de nombre Villa Rossana donde atiende a una buena cantidad de clientes que se encuentran muy satisfechos con la atención y los servicios de la Sra. Zoraida.
Hace mas de 5 años que se encuentra trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya y nos comenta que se encuentra muy a gusto trabajando con la empresa y que seguirá esforzándose día a día para cumplir con sus obligaciones y seguir trabajando y de esa manera ir aumentando sus ingresos familiares y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
Ella desea seguir cargando su despensa con mercaderías para no dejar de abastecer a sus clientes, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como panificados, fideos, azúcar, harina, y otros productos de uso domestico.
texts.en:
Zoraida Benítez is 50 years old, married and has two children. She lives in the Villa Rossana area of the city of Ita. She has been in business for over 17 years, running a small grocery store called Villa Rossana. She has many customers who are satisfied with the attention and services provided by Zoraida. She has been working with the Fundación Paraguaya for over 5 years and tells us that she enjoys working with the company and will continue to work hard everyday to fulfill her obligations. She will continue working in this manner and increase her family's income so that she can provide a better quality of life for her and her children. She would like to carry on stocking her grocery store with goods so that she can continue to supply her customers, and she is requesting the loan to buy products such as baked goods, noodles, sugar, flour and other everyday items.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, rice, noodles, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
El Sr. Vidal D., es soltero de 36 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Capiatá km. 21, barrio Loma Ybate. 
Es comerciante, confeccionista y costurero desde hace más de 20 años y hace  2 años que se independizó y posee su propio taller de confecciones con el nombre de Power Confecciones. 
Cuenta con dos máquinas rectas industriales y una overllock de 5 hilos y con el crédito otorgado por la Fundación Paraguaya adquirió una cortadora con mesa, la cual le genera más ganancias ya que no tiene que estar pagando a terceras personas para realizar el trabajo de corte, además posee una clientela bien formada la cual se encuentra muy satisfecha con la producción del Sr. Vidal.
 Con la producción propia el Sr. Vidal puede acceder a un precio mucho mejor el cual le posibilita a aumentar sus ventas y de esa manera incrementar sus ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
El Sr. Vidal comenta que se encuentra muy agradecido con la Fundación Paraguaya por la confianza depositada en su persona con el préstamo otorgado.  
En esta ocasión el solicita un préstamo para la compra de una mesa con cortadora ya que le facilitara mucho el trabajo además de agiliza por que con esta herramienta el podrá cortar en una ves gran cantidad de moldes para coser.
texts.en:
Vidal D. is a single 36-year old man. He lives in Capiatá, in the Loma Ybate district. He has been a retailer, tailor and cutter for more than 20 years. Two years ago, he set up on his own and now runs a tailoring workshop called Power Confecciones. He has two industrial sewing machines and a 5-thread overlock machine. He also purchased a table cutter with a loan granted by the Fundación Paraguaya, and this increased his profit margin because he doesn't have to pay a third person to do the cutting-out work. Vidal also has an established client base that is very satisfied with his work. By producing the clothes himself, Vidal can offer a much better price, allowing him to increase his sales and therefore his profits, and improve his standard of living. Vidal says he is very grateful for the trust the Fundación Paraguaya has shown in him by granting him the loan. Now he is requesting a loan to buy a cutting table. This will make his work much quicker and easier because it will allow him to cut a large quantity of sewing patterns at once.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a special cutting table.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Ricardo Benítez A., de 38 años de edad, soltero con una hija, vive en la casa de sus padres, es comerciante.
 Posee una cantera en la compañía de Arrua´i desde el año 2000, donde explota una gran cantidad de piedra a diario, para proveer a las zonas vecinas y también a ciudades aledañas, actualmente está explotando como 130 cargas de piedras semanales, para las diferentes zonas ya mencionadas.
Posee una clientela bien formada que trabajan de forma exclusiva con el Sr. Ricardo.
Nos comenta que se encuentra muy agradecido por la confianza depositada en su persona con el préstamo otorgado y día a día seguirá trabajando para no defraudar la confianza puesta y de esa manera seguir retirando créditos futuros.
El Sr. Ricardo solicito el préstamo para el pago del personal y combustible ya que intensificaron el trabajo para abastecer un pedido de muchas cargas de piedras, y desea cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ricardo Benítez A. is 38 years old. He is single and has one daughter. He lives in his parents' house and is a businessman. He has owned a quarry in the town of Arrua'i since 2000. He extracts a large quantity of stone every day, supplying neighbouring areas and nearby cities. He is currently excavating around 130 loads of stone per week, for the various areas mentioned above. Ricardo has regular customers who work exclusively with him. He tells us that he is very grateful for the trust shown in him by granting him a loan, and that he will continue working daily to prove himself worthy of that trust. That way, he will be able to keep receiving loans in the future. Ricardo requested the loan to pay his workforce and buy fuel, since the workload has increased to supply an order for many loads of stone, and he wants to meet his customers' requirements.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in quarry (to pay workforce and buy fuel)

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
El señor Reinaldo tiene 64 años de edad, es separado, tiene una hija ya mayor de edad e independiente a él, vive en el barrio denominado Sportivo de la ciudad de Itá.
 Hace poco mas de 2 años volvió de la República de Argentina, donde había viajado para realizar diversos tipos de trabajo como empleado y de esa forma pudo contar con un capital para invertir en un negocio, actualmente posee un puesto comercial en el mercado municipal de la ciudad hace 1 año, allí realiza la venta de diversos artículos como ser bazar, regalos, juguetes, bijouterie y artículos de  santería. 
 Solicita el préstamo en esta ocasión para surtir sus artículos de juguetería con la compra de camioncitos, pelotas, muñecas, mochilas y otros juguetes.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is 64 years old, separated and has a grown-up daughter who lives independently. He lives in the Sportivo district of the city of Itá. He returned from Argentina just over 2 years ago, having travelled there to do various jobs and earn enough capital to invest in a business. He has been running a stall in the city's municipal market for a year now, and sells various items such as hardware, gifts, toys, jewellery and religious merchandise. He is now requesting a loan to expand his stock of toys. He wants to buy toy trucks, balls, dolls, rucksacks and other toys.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toys, gifts, jewellery, religious merchandise etc.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
La Sra. Marlene C. tiene 25 años, es de profesión peluquera ,tiene una hija de 3 años de edad de nombre Soledad, vive en la casa de sus padres donde tiene una despensa bien surtida desde hace más de 2 años, posee una buena cantidad de clientes. También posee una pequeña peluquería anexada a la despensa, donde atiende a una gran cantidad de clientes, más en los días viernes, sábados y domingos.
Nos comenta que gracias al primer crédito que retiró de la Fundación Paraguaya, ha logrado aumentar de manera progresiva la cantidad de mercadería puestos para la venta y de esa manera logró mejorar su calidad de vida  y de su familia, es por eso que día a día seguirá trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para lograr todos sus objetivos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como harina, arroz, bebidas en general, fideos, etc.
texts.en:
Marlene C. is 25 years old, a hairdresser, and has a 3-year-old daughter named Soledad. She lives in her parents house, where she has run a well-stocked store with a good number of customers for more than 2 years. She also has a small beauty salon next to the store, where she attends to a large number of clients, mostly on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. She says that thanks to her first loan with Fundación Paraguaya, she has been able to steadily increase the amount of goods she sells and in this way has improved her quality of life and that of her family. For this reason she will continue to work hard every day so that she achieves all her goals. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise, such as flour, rice, beverages, pastas, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, rice, beverages, pastas, etc.

loans.name: Magadalena

texts.es:
El Sra. Magdalena Chávez de 49 años de edad, es comerciante, posee una despensa bien surtida en la Compañía Ca`aguazu´i de la Ciudad de Itá, además posee una gomería la cual es muy conocida en la zona, de dicho negocio se encargan su marido y sus hijos.
La mayoría de sus hijos están trabajando y estudiando a la vez, la Sra. Magdalena es muy trabajadora y sacrificada y día a día se esfuerza para poder cumplir su obligación como madre de familia y con la educación de sus hijos.
Solicitó el crédito para aumentar la mercadería de su despensa ya que posee una clientela bien formada y numerosa y necesita abastecer a todos.
Comentó que se encuentra muy agradecida con la Fundación Paraguaya ya que con el préstamo otorgado aumentará día a día su negocio y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de sus familiares.
texts.en:
Magdalena Chávez is 49 years old. She is a merchant with a well-stocked store in the Ca`aguazu´i neighborhood in the city of Itá. She also has a tire shop which is well-known in the area and run by her husband and children. Most of her children are working and studying at the same time. Magdalena is very hardworking, sacrificing and strives daily to meet her obligation as a parent and to provide an education for her children. She requests a loan to increase the merchandise in her store, since she has a steady and large clientele and needs to supply all their needs. She says she is very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya since this loan allow her to increase her business day by day and to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, rice, sugar, pastas, etc.

loans.name: Rhonalyn

texts.en:
Rhonalyn M. is 33 years old, married and has a four-year-old child and a two-month-old baby. She is from the town of Banga in Cotabato province on the southern Mindanao islands. Rhonalyn is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell. She also planted coconut trees on part of her land. Rhonalyn works hard to provide for her family and to save for her kids' future.

Rhonalyn joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rhonalyn is requesting a new loan, her second from CEVI, of 8000 PHP that will be used to purchase seed and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry Y. is from the town of Banga. He is 43 years old, married, and has 5 children. His eldest is 16 and the youngest is 4. Jerry is involved in farming and hog-raising. He tills his land to plant and harvest rice crops. His wife helps him sell their harvest at the market. He also grows and fattens hogs for sale. 

Jerry joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI, and is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and feed for the pigs. This will be Jerry’s second loan from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children’s tuition fees and improve his business. Jerry dreams of having all his children finish college someday, and he works hard to make this possible.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy P. is from the town of Banga. She is 40 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 10 and 5. She is a farmer and an accessory vendor. She and her husband cultivate their land to plant and harvest rice crops. She also allots some of her time to selling accessories like bracelets and necklaces. 

Nancy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI, and is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it and to support her children's schooling. One of her dreams is to see her children finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon Y. is from the town of Banga. She is 26 years old, single, and has a 9-year-old child. To make a living, Sharon owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting and selling rice. She has been engaged in her business for over 7 years.

Sharon joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI, and is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it and to start a reserve fund for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B., 31, is from the town of Banga. She is married. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting and selling rice. She has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

Anita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI, and is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and other items for her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and other items for her farm

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie S. lives in the town of Banga. She is 38 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She and her husband make a living as rice farmers, carefully tilling their land to plant and harvest their crop. Amie also runs a sari-sari store where she sells food items such as bananas, sugar and other items. She has also opened an Internet cafe in her town, and is very proud of the fact that it helps people, especially students.

Amie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to buy supplies for her farm and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida B. lives in the town of Banga. She is 55 years old and has a 16-year-old child. She has made a living as a rice farmer for many years, and works hard because she wants to give her child a bright future. 

Leonida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to buy additional seeds and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar Y. lives in the town of Banga. He is 38 years old, married and has two children who are four and eight years old. For more than 10 years, he has made a living as a rice farmer, working hard to provide a stable income to his family.

Edgar joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid one loan from CEVI and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by his farm to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana is single and makes a living selling spices at her town's central food market. She went into business about a year ago because unemployment is high and jobs are in short supply where she lives. Today, she enjoys being self employed and is making plans to expand her business. To help make this expansion possible, she is applying for a loan for 10,000 Grivnas to increase her supply of working capital and maintain a large assortment of spices because this is key to attracting new customers.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is divorced and has one child, a son who is grown and lives on his own. She makes a living selling women's shoes at her town's central market. She went into business 15 years ago and has done a great job of expanding her business and acquiring repeat customers. She enjoys her work and is eager to continue expanding her small company

Olga has applied for a loan for 10,000 Grivnas to buy items for the upcoming fall season. She plans to use the increased income made possible by this loan to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell during the coming fall season

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila is married. She sells women's clothing at the central market in Nova Kahovka town. Ludmila has been in this business for seven years. She has been able to develop the business well and attract many customers. Her kiosk is in a good location in the market, which helps Ludmila to attract more and more new customers. Ludmila would like to borrow 7,500 Grivnas to purchase new inventories to increase the assortment of clothing she offers. She hopes to earn more profit and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing for sale

loans.name: Volodimir

texts.en:
Volodimir is married and has two children. He is an energetic small-business entrepreneur from Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Volodimir owns real estate and rents his property to legal entities and individuals. The facility he offers for rent is located in a good area of his home town which unfailingly attracts customers who are willing to pay a high rental fee. Volodimir has been in this business for five years.

Volodimir is seeking a loan of 8,000 UAH to do maintenance on the facility he owns and leases. He is hoping to improve the plumbing system in the building to make it more comfortable and attractive for existing and new customers. Volodimir has proved to be a responsible and reliable client with a solid credit history.

loans.use: To do maintenance on his rental property

loans.name: Akif

texts.en:
Akif M. has always been a hardworking man who from a young age has made sure that his family never went without their daily bread. He is married with two children. Akif has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of food. His monthly income is about 300-500 AZN.

With a small amount of starting capital, Akif began this enterprise five years ago. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he has expanded his business, and today his whole family is engaged in the business.

Akif needs to expand his store and buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of goods he has for sale. He is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN for this purpose. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
Rasul M. is 34 years old, married and is the father of three children. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children.

Rasul is an enterprising man who constantly tries to do things better and to improve, day after day. He works hard in his fields where he spends as much time as possible cultivating and fertilizing his land and spraying it to prevent diseases that might affect his yield. He raises tomatoes and cucumbers. Rasul also keeps cattle.

Rasul is applying for a loan of 1000 AZN. He needs seed and fertilizer to continue raising his crops and would like to purchase two head of cattle.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and two head of cattle

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim A. is a successful entrepreneur, father and dedicated husband. He has two children who are giving him the strength to work hard. Rasim began a small grocery store many years ago with a little capital he saved. He was assisted by his wife who helps him serve his clients. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery has become more popular. He is asking for a loan of 1000 Azerbaijani manats so that he can expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Mushviq

texts.en:
Mushviq M. has an economic activity dedicated to the raising of animals in order to generate revenue from the animals and the products they provide. Mushviq has earned a living from raising cattle since he was young. He's married and has two children. His monthly income is 300-400 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN). He usually sells cattle to the local butchers.

Mushviq needs to buy animals such as cows and calves. He's applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: Purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan Q. is a young and energetic guy who is married and has one child. He is young and full of energy. He tries every single day to make the life of his family better.

Elshan raises sheep in a small village in the Agsu region. Elshan’s primary clients are butchers. He started his business a year ago. He took up the business of his father, who is now a pensioner. Elshan has great experience in sheep breeding and the farming business because he has observed it from childhood.

Elshan would like to expand his business, and so he has asked for a loan of 900 AZN to buy eight sheep and fodder. This will help him to increase his income and improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase eight sheep and fodder

loans.name: Km 7 Monday Group

texts.es:
Para la Formación del presente comité inicio la Sra. Liz Muller  quien vive en  la zona del barrio km 7 Monday. Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se Denomina “km 7 Monday”,  están en el Séptimo ciclo con  17 integrantes y sus respectivas actividades productivas, son muy unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Nancy quien se dedica a la venta de joyas, esta actividad lo viene realizando hace tiempo, y so forma de venta es la de recorrer hasta los cliente ya que la venta en su local no es mucha.
Ella recorre por varios lugares ofreciendo sus joyas, como empresa privadas y públicas donde muestra a los empleaD. las mercadería y en ocasiones los deja a créditos y posteriormente pasa a cobrarlos.
Para ella esta actividad le conviene a pesar de que no le deja mucha ganancia ya es muy difícil la venta, ella esta conforme ya que puede hacer este trabajo en sus horas libres sin descuidar a su familia.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de joyas ya que no cuenta con suficientes variedades para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Liz Muller lives in the ‘Kilometer 7 Monday’ neighborhood and started the group by contacting her neighbors and friends. The group name is also ‘Kilometer 7 Monday’ and this is their seventh loan cycle. They have 17 members, each with their own businesses, and they are very close, supportive, and responsible.

One of the group members is Nancy, who works selling jewelry and has been doing so for a while. Her sales strategy is to travel to her customers because she does not sell much in her shop. She travels to several places to sell her jewelry, such as private and public businesses, where she shows them her merchandise and sometimes leaves them on credit and later returns to pick them up. The business is good for her despite the fact that she does not earn much because sales are difficult. She is satisfied since she can work in this business during her free time without neglecting her family.

Nancy is requesting the loan to purchase jewelry because she does not have enough varieties to sell to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase jewelry

loans.name: Olga Francisca

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Calceta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Agustín, ciudad conocida por gente trabajadora y  mujeres hermosas.
 
Aquí conocimos a la señora Olga, ella está en el Banco Comunal hace ya 14 años y dice que siempre han estado junto a ella para ayudarla a crecer en su negocio, por eso está muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir. Tiene 59 años, esta casada y tiene tres hijas todas mayores de edad, todas viven con ella, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella tiene un negocio de fabricación y venta de cojines, confecciona distintos diseños y modelos en las fundas de los cojines, los que se pueden dar para diferentes usos como almohadas, para muebles y hasta diseños para los novios ya que  siempre le compran porque son un lindo obsequio, estos los elabora con plumón para que queden mas suavecitos. Trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8am hasta las 20h00, estos productos los fabrica y los envía a Quininde y Quito y allá su hermana se encarga de venderlos, también entrega en Calceta a un bazar ya que tienen mucha demanda.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar materiales para la fabricación de sus productos. 

Sus sueños son tener un taller más  grande y poder enviar sus productos al exterior ya que dice que sus cojines son los mejores en el mundo.
texts.en:
In the lovely city of Calceta, known for its hard-working people and beautiful women, the San Agustín Village Bank meets every fifteen days.

That's where we met Olga, who has been with the village bank for fourteen years. She says the bank has always been there to help her grow in her business, so she really appreciates Fundación Espoir.  Olga is fifty-nine, married, and has five grown children, who all live with her.  Her husband is in agriculture.

Olga makes and sells cushions.  She sews different designs on the cushion covers to serve a variety of purposes, including for pillows, furniture and even for couples getting married; people buy those designs all the time because they make nice gifts, and Olga makes them with down so they'll be softer.  She works Monday through Friday from 8 in the morning until 8 at night.  She sends her products to Quininde and Quito where her sister sells them.  She also brings things to a bazaar in Calceta because there's a lot of demand there.

Olga plans to use her loan to buy materials to make her cushions.  

Her dream is to have a bigger workshop and to be able to send her products internationally because she says her cushions are the best in the world.

loans.use: To buy fabric, down, thread, fasteners, etc.

loans.name: Cano Romero

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Calceta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Agustín, ciudad conocida por su gente trabajadora y sus mujeres hermosas.
 
La señora M. tiene 56 años, esta casada y tuvo 8 hijos todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos viven con ella, uno de sus hijos es especial (discapacitado)  y con mucho amor y abnegación ella  lo cuida y lo seguirá haciendo toda su vida, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella desde hace muchos años aprendió  corte y confección, tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde realiza muchos trabajos a las personas que le llegan a buscar ya que ella siempre ha quedado bien con sus clientes y según sus clientes es muy buena en lo que hace, confecciona todo tipo de ropa pero dice que prefiere la ropa de damas ya que hay más variedad de diseños. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9am hasta las 12pm y desde las 15h00 hasta las 18h00,  en las noches cose su hija, ella le ayuda cuando tiene muchos encargos.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace dos años, la llevo su hermana y le ha gustado por la facilidad para conseguir los prestamos.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran taller para administrarlo  con su hija.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Calceta the San Agustin communal bank meets every two weeks. The city is known for its hardworking people and beautiful women.  
 
M. is 56 years old. She is married and has 8 grown children. Three of them live with her, and one of her children is special (handicapped). With much love and sacrifice she takes care of him and she will continue to do so for her whole life.  Her husband is a farmer. 

Many years ago she learned to cut and sew clothing. She has a small sewing workshop where she does a lot of work for people who seek her out because she has always pleased her customers. She is very good at what she does; she makes all kinds of clothing but says she prefers women's clothing, since there is more variety in the designs. She works every day from 9am until 12 am and from 3 p.m. until 6 p.m. At night she sew with her daughter, who helps when she has a lot of orders.

She will use this loan to buy fabric and other materials for sewing. She has been in the communal bank for two years. Her sister took her and she likes how easy it is to take out loans. 
 
Her dream is to have a large workshop to run with her daughter.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Lilian Rocío

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Calceta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Agustín, ciudad conocida por su gente trabajadora y sus mujeres hermosas.
 
La señora Lilian esta en el Banco Comunal hace tres años, en la actualidad  se  desempeña como fiscal de pago y esta muy contenta con su cargo y a gusto en el Banco ya que gracias a este ha salido de muchos apuros económicos. Ella tiene 40 años, esta separada  y tiene tres hijas dos ya mayores de edad y otra de 14 años que esta estudiando en colegio, dice que al estar sola y con esa carga le obligo hace años a dedicarse al comercio.

Tiene un almacén de repuestos y accesorios de carros, en el lugar donde ella alquila vive y tiene su negocio, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 17h00. Compra los repuestos en Guayaquil y Santo Domingo, dice que como en todo negocio hay días buenos y malos, pero que siempre sale adelante.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar para comprar repuestos para tener todo lo que sus clientes buscan.
 
Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y su almacén en un local independiente.
texts.en:
The San Agustín Village Bank meets every fifteen days in the beautiful city of Calceta, known for its hard-working people and pretty women.

Lilian has belonged to the village bank for three years, where she's currently a group monitor.  She is very happy with her work and she likes being with the bank; thanks to them she has gotten out of a lot of economic tight spots.  She is forty-years-old, separated, and has three daughters, two grown and one, fourteen, who is in school.  Lilian says that being alone and having such responsibilities forced her long ago to dedicate herself to her business.

She rents a spare parts and car accessories warehouse in the same place where she lives and runs her business.  She works every day from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening.  She buys the spare parts in Guayaquil and Santo DOmingo.  She says that, as in all businesses, there are good days and bad days, but that she's always getting ahead.

Olga plans to use her loan to buy spare parts so she can have everything her clients are looking for.

Her dream is to have her own house and a warehouse in an independent establishment.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel M. is from the village of Poblacion 2 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Maricel is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Maricel owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Maricel has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maricel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair the existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maricel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Fuerza Del Mañana (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Fuerza del Mañana está formado por 10 socias amigas que laboran en diferentes actividades con un fin común que es mejorar sus economías y así salir adelante junto a sus familias. Viven por diferentes parroquias que pertenecen a la ciudad de Cuenca, en donde su mayor actividad es la agricultura y cría de animales.

La Señora Piedad U. vive en la comunidad de Susudel que pertenece al cantón de Oña, tiene 53 años, es divorciada hace 28 años, tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad que son casados y viven independientemente. Esta orgullosa que gracias su esfuerzo y trabajo tiene su casa propia. 
Doña Piedad se dedica a trabajar en un comedor que es de su propiedad, en el cual labora desde las 5 de la mañana en la preparación de sus platos y trabaja hasta las 9 de la noche cuando termina de vender sus productos, también se dedica a la cría de animales como cuyes y cerdos que los vende en su propia comunidad. Este es el primer crédito que realiza en este banco comunal ya anteriormente ha sido socia de otro banco comunal en el cual fue miembro activo un año y medio. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres como un quintal de arroz, azúcar y más productos para la elaboración de sus platos.

Su meta es  aprender a conducir para poder trasladarse con más facilidad a su hogar.

La Señora Carmita C. vive en la comunidad de Misicata que  pertenece a la parroquia de Baños. Este es  su primer crédito, fue invitada por una amiga quien le ha incentivado a que forme parte de este hermoso grupo de mujeres. Se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal hace 4 años y vende solo en sus tiempos libres. También se dedica a la agricultura, siembra verduras y ya cuenta con clientes a los cuales les  entrega sus productos  y el sobrante lo vende en el mercado de la feria libre, esta actividad  la realiza hace 15 años.
Doña Carmita tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 20, 18, 13 y 11 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y su sueldo es para sus gastos personales, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo  estudia el último grado de la escuela. Su esposo es chofer y labora conduciendo su propio bus, gracias al trabajo conyugal cuentan con su  casa propia. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos como perfumes, cremas etc., de la marca Yanbal y también en semillas para sus cultivos.

Su meta es  comprarse un vehiculo para llevar sus verduras y vender con mas facilidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank Fuerza del Mañana is made up of 10 members who are friends. They work in different activities with a common purpose which is to improve their finances and thus get ahead with their families. They live in different parishes that belong to the city of Cuenca, where the main activity is agriculture and raising animals.   

Mrs. Piedad U. lives in the community of Susudel which belongs to the Oña canton. She is 53 years old and has been divorced for 28 years. She has 4 grown children who are married and live on their own. She is proud that thanks to her hard work she owns her own house.  

Piedad works in a restaurant that she owns. She works there from 5 in the morning preparing the food and works until 9 at night when she finishes selling her products. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs and pigs that she sells in her own community. This is the first loan that she has taken out with this community bank since previously she was an active member of another community bank for a year and a half. She will invest her loan in buying groceries such as a a 100 pound sack of rice, sugar, and other products to make her dishes.    

Her goal is to learn to drive to be able to get around more easily. 

Mrs. Carmita C. lives in the community of Misicata, which belongs to the Baños parish. This is her first loan. She was invited by a friend who encouraged her to join this beautiful group of women. She has sold Yanbal products for 4 years and she only sells in her free time. She also is a farmer; she plants vegetables and she has customers whom she delivers her products to and she sells what's left over in the free market. She has been doing this for 15 years.

Carmita is 38 years old. She is married and has 4 children, aged 20, 18, 13 y 11. Her two oldest children work and their wages are for personal expenses. Her third child goes to high school and the youngest is in the last grade of elementary school. Her husband is a driver and he works driving his own bus. Thanks to the couple's work, they own their own home. She is going to invest her loan in purchasing Yanbal cosmetics,  such as perfumes, creams, etc. as well seeds for her crops. 

Her goal is to buy herself a vehicle to transport her vehicles more easily.

loans.use: To buy a 100 pound sack of rice, sugar and groceries; cosmetics, creams, perfumes; seeds.

loans.name: Editha Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Quiroga se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos.

La señora Edhita es hace seis años socia del Banco Comunal, y siempre le han gustado las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Hace varios años se separo y de esta relación tuvo 4 hijas tres de los cuales ya son independientes y solo uno de sus hijos vive con ella.
 
Ella es modista y tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde realiza varios tipos de trabajos, ya que ella cose de todo, desde ropa de damas hasta ropa de niños, además se dedica a la cría de animales de corral. Trabaja todos los días en las noches y los fines de semana todo el día ya que de lunes a viernes trabaja con una señora, tiene muchos clientes que le llevan sus trabajos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar una máquina para hacer hilvanes y telas para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Sus metas son tener su casa de cemento ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
The community bank Quiroga meets every fifteen days in the Quiroga parish of the city of Calceta, a region where the people for the most part work in agriculture, raising animals, and the sale of their products.

Señora Editha has been a member of this community bank for six years, and she has always liked the ease of obtaining loans. She has been separated for some years and she has four children from this relationship. Three of them are already independent, and only one of them lives with her.

She is a dressmaker and has a small sewing shop where she does various types of work, since she sews everything, from women's clothes to children's clothes. In addition, she raises barnyard animals. She works everyday in the evening and all day on the weekends, since from Monday to Friday she has a job where she works for a woman. She has many clients who wear her products.

She will use this loan to buy a machine to do basting and fabrics to offer to her customers.

Her goal is to have her own cement-block house, since the one she has is made of cane.

loans.use: Buy a basting machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Quiroga se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos.

La señora Ángela   tiene 61 años de edad,  hace varios años quedo viuda y tiene 7 hijos todos mayores de edad pero dos de sus hijas que están solteras aun viven con ella, es secretaria del Colegio Simón Bolívar de Calceta, se graduó de repostería y pastelería en la Universidad Técnica de Manabí.

Tiene un local donde ella elabora y vende los más deliciosos bocadillos y pasteles de toda la zona, nos afirma ella muy orgullosa de lo que hace porque dice que todo lo que hace lo realiza con amor, prepara bufet para fiestas y para cualquier compromiso, además también los fines de semana prepara y vende comida. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes y los fines de semana todo el día,  a veces le ayudan sus dos hijas cuando llegan de sus estudios.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar  materiales  para la elaboración de los bocadillos que solo se consiguen en Quito. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace ya diez años y le gusta por la seriedad con que todo se realiza.
 
Sus metas son ampliar su negocio y tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Quiroga Community Bank meets every 15 days in the Quiroga parrish in the city of Calceta, an area where people are mostly dedicated to agriculture, raising animals and selling their products.

Ángela is 61 years old. She has been a widow for many years and has seven children who are adults however two of her daughters, who are single, still live with her. She is a secretary at the Simón Bolívar college of Calceta. She graduated from baking and pastry in the  Technical University of Manabi.

She has a shop where she makes and sells the most delicious sandwiches and cakes in the whole area. She tells us that she is very proud of what she makes because she says she makes them with love. She prepares buffets for parties and for various committments. In addition, at weekends, she prepares and sells food. She works every day in the afternoons and works all day on the weekends. Sometimes, her two daughters help her when they've finished with their studies.

This loan will be used to purchase materials for making the sandwiches which can be acquired only in Quito. She has been a member of the community bank for ten years and she likes the seriousness with which everything is done.

Her goals are to expand her business and have a great shop.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour, eggs, butter, marmelades, and general groceries.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe S. is from the village of Solinog Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Fe is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as noodles, canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Enn

texts.en: Mrs. Enn M. was born in 1952 and lives in Samna Khmau village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sokha Chea, are farmers who own a 3-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family; her husband is also a palm juice collector. Mrs. Enn M. has some problems because her field's soil is infertile. To improve production, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and to rent a plowing machine to plow her field. She is the mother of three children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory and one is a student.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to rent a plowing machine

loans.name: Haidelyn's Group

texts.en:
Haidelyn E. is from the city of Minsubong Tangub City. She is 20 years old. Haidelyn is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Haidelyn is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Haidelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas, corn, sweet potatoes, and cassava for sale. Haidelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Haidelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Haidelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Haidelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Rosa Belinda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Quiroga se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos.

Para la señora Rosa es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy a gusto por los beneficios que ha recibido de la institución. Tiene 47 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 10 años, no pudo tener hijos pero crio a dos sobrinos como si fueran de ella,  uno de ellos vive con ella, su marido es albañil.

Se dedica a la compra y venta de maní, compra el producto en grano a los comerciantes en Calceta el mismo que traslada a su casa donde lo cocina y muele para después entregarlo  a su hermana que lo lleva a Santo Domingo donde lo entrega a clientes o tiendas del lugar, dice que allá su producto se vende a muy buen precio. Trabaja sola todos los días siete horas al día.  También cría animales de corral  que le dejan ganancias.

Este crédito es para comprar maní para tener reserva ya que se pone escaso y es muy caro.
 
Sus sueños son tener un carro y una lavadora de ropa para que le facilite sus labores del hogar.
texts.en:
The Quiroga Communal Bank meets in the Quiroga parish of the city of Calceta every 15 days.  This is a place where most of the people work in agriculture, raising animals, and selling their products.

Rosa is in her fourth cycle in the communal bank.  She is happy with the benefits she has received from the institution.  She is 47 years old, and she has been in a common-law marriage for ten years.  She was not able to have children, but she raised two nephews as if they were her own.  One of them lives with her.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

She buys and sells peanuts.  She buys them whole from merchants in Calceta.  She takes them to her house where she cooks and grinds them.  After that, she delivers the product to her sister to take to Santo Domingo.  Her sister delivers the product to customers or the stores there.  She says that her product sells there for a very good price.  She works alone seven hours everyday.  She also raises farm animals, and that produces income.

This loan is to buy peanuts to have in reserve because they are scarce and very expensive.

Her dream is to have a car and a washing machine to help with the housework.

loans.use: To buy peanuts

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix M. is from the village of D'ban Calamba Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old. Felix is single. To make a living, Felix owns and operates a service based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from motorcycle transport services in the local community. Felix has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Felix joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felix is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Felix from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

La señora Guadalupe tiene 45 años, mantiene hace 16 años una relación de unión libre y fruto de la misma ha tenido 5 hijos, uno mayor de edad dos están en el colegio estudiando y los menores en la escuela, su marido es técnico en arreglo de impresoras, ella junto a toda su familia viven en una finca de su papa.

Se dedica a la cría de pollos tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, compra los pollos cuando están pequeños en una incubadora en Calceta, los mantiene por espacio de dos a tres meses y los entrega en tiendas en Calceta o los vende por libras cerca de su casa donde tiene un pequeño puesto para vender. Trabaja todos los días  seis horas al día en todas sus actividades.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más pollos ya que  la temporada que viene va a tener mucha demanda como todos los años. Está en el Banco Comunal hace seis años y está muy contenta, le gusta las reuniones ya que se distrae en ellas y aprende cosas nuevas.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Quiroga Communal Bank meets in the Quiroga parish of the city of Calceta every 15 days. This is a place where most of the people work in agriculture, raising animals, and selling their products.

Guadalupe, age 45, has been in a common-law marriage for 16 years.  They have five children.  One is grown, two go to high school, and the youngest ones go to elementary school.  Her husband is technician who fixes printers.   She lives with all of her family on a potato farm.

She raises chicken on a small farm that she has at her house.  She buys the chickens when they are small and in an incubator in Calceta.  She raises them for a period of two or three months.  She then delivers them to stores in Calceta or she sells them by the pound near her house where she has a small stand.  She works six hours everyday in all of her activities.

She will use the loan to buy more chickens.  There will be a lot of demand next season, like there is every year.  She has been in her communal bank for six years, and she is very happy.  She likes the meetings because they are entertaining, and she learns new things.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy chickens
